developerResponse: {'id': 27814282, 'body': "Thanks so much for sharing your feedback, we love to hear that you're enjoying the new pinch-to-zoom feature in our latest update. Thanks for being an HBO Max customer!!", 'modified': '2022-02-02T21:43:19Z'}
title: HBO Enforces Mandatory Letterboxing for “CoNsIsTeNt ViEwInG eXpErIeNcE”
review:
EDIT: Freedom to watch content in preferred aspect ratio is restored! Pinch to zoom to full screen works again. Five stars restored; thanks for listening, HBO. 

Original review:
There used to be a button in the bottom right corner that eliminated the black bars at the top and bottom, clipped the video, and made it full screen. This is the optimal viewing experience for me and I’ve enjoyed it that way before the update and even on HBO Go before that. It’s gone now and I’m livid. Without this feature, you do not have the freedom to choose your best viewing experience. You have no choice at all now; instead, you pay to have HBO decide for you. HBO makes you suffer without this feature because they want to foster a “consistent viewing experience across all devices”. So I guess not being able to watch content the way you prefer doesn’t qualify as a good “experience” anymore. My experience is derived from the freedom to watch the content how I like it, so to remove that freedom seems counterintuitive, foolish, and nonsensical. My friends, our preferences shouldn’t be dictated by HBO. I yearn for the day our freedom will be restored in an update because, only then, will we have the truly optimal experience we used to expect from the Home Box Office.

title: Great movies terrible app
review: I love the amount of shows and movies HBO Max is. Totally worth spending money on, the problem I have is that it’s so slow and a nuisance when watching a movie or show and I get notification about streaming either with cellular data or WiFi. It’s so annoying having to go back and forth turning them on and off because of how it won’t stop changing it’s “mind” on my connection. Wish it was like Netflix more. Where it’s automatic on both ends. What’s also annoying is clicking in and out. I can’t exit the app with it still playing the movie. Another complaint is that the episodes aren’t laid out, have to retype the title to see again what is next or reading the description. It’s just super slow and is nowhere near how amazing the Netflix app is built.  I hope it develops new downloads where it doesn’t create such a hassle trying to watch my shows and movies because it’s not worth $10 a month if all it’s gonna do is create problems and not allow me to watch movies on a smooth run. Also last thing, I hate how it’s so slow when I try to replay back. This goes the same for the website as well. Like Netflix has never given me this problem (I’m not complaining that Netflix is better but in comparison between app navigation, it is top tier) I like rewinding to watch best comical scenes and whatnot but Everytime I do on HBO I have to remind self to try and not do it or it crashes into this slow time warp. Please fix this!!

title: Buggy, slow, poorly designed, screen-waster
review:
Got a decent size iPhone? Good thing, cause this poorly designed app will waste about 30% of the screen by putting black bars on all four sides. They apparently took away full-screen mode at some point in the past year. Seems like it was intentional, since people have been complaining and they haven’t brought it back. I just rejoined, and the bad experience is making me think it will be a pay-for-a-month-and-out situation. Get your act together, HBO. Why throw all that money at making good content if your app dev team is going to chase away your subscribers? 

Update: the Developer response only addresses my “feature request” for full screen. That is a “feature restore” after some bizarrely-bad decision to remove it. I’m not going to go fill out some form to get it back - this should be obvious. 
Also, the app is objectively bad in many ways: slow, laggy, locks up randomly, crashes, poorly laid-out, odd controls, and so much more. No amount of feedback can help a team that would release such a bad app in the first place. They need to just look at other apps that work correctly, and do that. 
My review here is just to give fair warning to anyone considering watching HBO on their iPhone that it will be an annoying experience. The developer shouldn’t need to read the details here to know they’ve got a mess on their hands.

title: Great content/terrible app
review: The content this streaming app has already and is coming up with is phenomenal in all levels, which makes the following all the more painful. The app is slow, buggy, and glitchy. I can’t watch this app on my Vizio tv because it’s always freezing, glitchy and the audio desynchronizes. All of this at random times. I wish it was just certain shows, but unfortunately I haven’t found a movie or show in which it doesn’t happen. I used to think it was my internet or my tv, but it’s the only streaming app that gives me these problems. I wish it was only happening in my tv, but it also happens in all my devices, although in my phone and iPad it happens less. I end up hailing to download the shows in my phone or iPad to then watch them. However, the download doesn’t always work either; sometimes downloads have unexpected errors and I have to try 5 times to get a show or movie downloaded. I have some feedback about the interface too, but there’s no point in focusing on that until all of these bugs are fixed. Actually, there is one interface note that I don’t think should wait until the bugs are fixed, the fact that when you’re done watching an episode or movie and want to rewatch it, instead of starting over (because you’ve finished it) it goes back to where you left off in the credits. Really?

title: Thoroughly broken apps & utterly inept customer service
review:
I’m not sure any elaboration is necessary but in case you want it: App failures run the gamut, from full crashes to any function you can think of “working” one day, completely wasting your time again the next, and back again whenever. Even when app functions are “working”, the app and all its functions are so poorly thought out it’s cumbersome to use at the best of times. The apps are so bad that if you make the mistake of contacting customer service they’ll quickly whine to you about how new they are so you should give them a break. HBO, the inventors of cable TV, who between HBO Go, Now, and Max have had well over a decade to give a hoot about creating a decent app and have so astoundingly failed to do so the only reasonable conclusion is that they just don’t care, that HBO wants you to give them a break because they’re the new kids on the block. But seriously, don’t even try contacting customer service if you wish to maintain sanity. Just cut and run. Anyone you speak with at any level is either ill-informed, ill-equipped, incapable, just doesn’t care, or any combination thereof.

Edit: Don’t be fooled by “Warner Media responded to my review”. 100% of my dozens of attempts to resolve issues over the past months have proven that this company has absolutely no interest or ability to help in any way with any problem you might have

title: Solid selection, but very glitchy at times
review: App is great when it decides to do what it’s supposed to. I download a lot of shows because of lack of service in some areas so I can still watch stuff on the app. Well often times I open the app and it will say “no service try again”, which of course It’s right I don’t have service but the problem is it gets stuck on that screen and won’t let me get to my downloads. Sometimes opening the app in airplane mode helps and sometimes it doesn’t. Also have issues with some of my downloads just disappearing from my downloads list, often times even episodes of shows I just downloaded the night before. Naturally it’s frustrating to go to use the app and watch a show I downloaded the night prior only to find that it’s not in my download list. I’ve even had it where a show wasn’t in the list and then after several times of shutting down the app, restarting my phone, and then all of a sudden some of the stuff I downloaded will all of a sudden appear.  I constantly keep the app and my phone updated so I all I can gather is that the app is just very buggy. So like I’ve said the app is great when it decides to work. On a side note, not to be totally negative,when connected to wifi the app does seem to work as intended with no issues.

title: TERRIBLE Buffering to the Point Where You Can Never Watch Anything
review: I never write reviews, but I bought this on accident because unfortunately if you start the process of making an account, it charges you through the App Store, rather than asking you to put card information in on a later step. So I figured I’d try it out for at least a month, and in the couple days I’ve had it, I can almost never actually watch anything. Even when it says my wifi strength is strong and every other streaming service I have works perfectly fine, this one does not. I can barely ever get stuff to start and the few times I actually can, I can never even finish an entire episode before it starts buffering again and fails to play. This has happened on my phone and on my smart tv and it also has happened in more than one place on different wifi connections. My smart tv and iPhone are also both up-to-date and I’ve tried restarting both multiple times. I’ve had a little more luck watching on my phone, but it is still a pain and I would much rather watch off of my tv. It’s disappointing because they offer some really good movies and shows, but in my experience I can’t even watch them, and looking at a large portion of reviews, many people have experienced the same thing with HBO Max.

developerResponse: {'id': 27815144, 'body': 'Good news! You can now use the Pinch-to-Zoom gesture to make shows and movies fill the screen on your iOS device. Download the latest HBO Max update and let us know if you have any questions.', 'modified': '2022-02-09T20:06:54Z'}
title: Needs expanded screen and playback screen option
review:
As with everyone else, content is great, but in 2021 you should be able to have the option to: 1. Expand the screen Yes, I get that HBO wants the experience to be consistent throughout all devices, but not all devices are the same size. Even for content that clearly does not fill out any sides of the screen you are not able to expand that. Easy fix and implementation, yet HBO is too stubborn to allow it. 2. Video speed control Let people consume the content how they want to. If keeping users on your app is the goal, then give users a customizable experience. I would like to spend more time on this app, such as when I'm on my breaks at work, however given the lack of expanded full screen, I am unable to view the content as it's too small, so I don't stay on the app

***edit 2/9/22***
HBO Max has recently added expanding the screen, which is a huge option for users. Consistency seems to have improved as well. 
Big steps in the right direction, changing it from 1 star to 5 stars as I value adapting to customer responses.

title: HBO reigns supreme
review: If the streaming services were in the military, then HBOMax would be the general of it all! First off I love the original movies and shows. 99% of the time it’s award winning in my opinion. The selection of movies they have is incredible, it’s not like most other services that give you a couple A movies and then the next 300 are low budget crappy movies. No HBO has a very wide range of of tier one movies for every genre and if you don’t want to watch a movie then have your pick at some of the greatest shows ever made. I have watched band of brothers about 17 times now along with my favorite Westworld and I love that you get this great service and not to mention same day releases of movies that are premiering in the theater with everything that I have mentioned before at a awesome price per month and I have had the service for 3 years now and it’s stayed the same so big congratulations to HBOMax for not jacking up the price like everything else is doing in the world. I would recommend this service to anyone who wants a great deal and awesome place to watch great shows and movies!!!

title: Accessible but, AD is not updated regularly...
review: As a blind person, I have issues with lots of apps. I don't usually complain if it's not something I really want to use. I have video on demand and use this service. I also have the app on my telephone. It is very accessible. I am grateful for that. I am also grateful for an audio description section. The only issue I have with this is, it's not updated like everything else. If I go to the movie theater, watch a movie with audio description headphones. Shouldn't that also be on the HBO Max platform? If I watch a movie or Series on the HBO Max app and the show or movie has audio description, shouldm't that also be on my video on demand? If something is released from the beginning with audio description, how is it not on every platform that provides that entertainment? This is unacceptable. If A film company or production provides you audio description when they release art to the public on all platforms, why don't the platforms use it? Oh yeah. I forgot. Blind people don't watch TV or movies or do anything else to be productive citizens on this planet. I feel disrespected by platforms especially, when I talk to customer service or send an email with feedback and nothing ever changes. Do your job or I'll go somewhere else and take my money with me.t

title: Terrible App! Quality Content
review:
HBO clearly has big budget capabilities, but this app isn’t it. It’s so buggy. It crashes all the time. The main issue seems to be downloading shows. If you’re lucky, one show will download. The download will fail a few times, but eventually it gets there. But NEVER try to download two shows at once. It will crash for sure. After you get the one show to download, that’s it. Every other download will fail and/or crash the app. I haven’t tried downloading a movie because a 60 min show takes all my patience. Next you have the caching issue… every time you move from a screen back to the previous screen it has to reload the whole page again. And it’s not fast about it. And last, offline is a struggle, but once you get the app to come to terms with being offline, it will get the job done. However, it doesn’t seem to sync back to my HBO profile, so when I go back to my AppleTV, it doesn’t register that I’ve already watched a few shows of a series. 

 I need HBO iOS and AppleTV apps to be a lot better. Their app have always been terrible, but it’s gotten so bad that I’m now one of those people leaving a long ranting app review, screaming into the void, as if it’s going to help.

title: Woe is the user who forgets how bad this app handles
review: I recently purchased a subscription, ad-free, for hbo Max because I had one last year and I remembered all the great shows it had to offer, on top of realizing young justice was on hbo max which I had never seen but it is an amazing animated series. The first season handled fine honestly, not many issues that I could notice. But the second season is where it took a turn for the worst. The episodes would freeze on frames, not just buffering as the audio would keep going and upon rewinding it would freeze on the same frame and unfreeze at the same time no matter what. This was faulty app design. But no matter I said, I’ll download the episodes and they’ll play much better. Oh how naive and arrogant I was. You see, Hbo max will completely crash if you attempt to queue more than one episode for downloading at a time in too quickly of a succession. This means queuing up a season of the show for downloading is out of the question, as once the app crashes the downloads fail and you have to try again only to have it crash. Again. So woe be the user who remembers the glory days of hbo max but forgets the horrendous mistakes of its creators. TLDR: amazing catalogue, terrible app design

title: Downloads
review:
If I download an episode or movie, it says it will expire in 29 days. If I don’t watch it in a couple days, I have to renew it. The issue is that renewing doesn’t work majority of the time. This is a pain because I download stuff so I can watch when I get to areas without service. I shouldn’t have to check everyday to make sure it hasn’t expire 4 weeks early.

Edit: This is in response to the reply by the developer. It doesn’t matter what you have written on some website. I download a movie or a show and it says it will expire in 29 days. A few hours later it changes to start counting down from 72 hours or something like that. If it’s only good for 3 days, why say 29 days? That’s an issue on your end that needs to be fixed, not send me somewhere where it explains how it should be. The app should be right from the start. But then when I tell it to renew my download, it makes it look like it did by having the movie or show under my downloads and not grayed out or having the exclamation mark over the picture. So the renew feature also needs to be fixed. For giving me the runaround, I’m taking my rating down to one star. The next step, deleting and canceling my subscription.

title: Great content, problems with app
review:
I’m streaming HBO Max on a Roku Ultra and agree with others that the app could use some improvement and is kind of buggy. For me, the sign in process was a problem.  I changed my password and couldn’t sign out on my Roku, the button was in settings but it wouldn’t sign me out.  I had to go to the app on my phone and remove the device manually.  For a premium service such as this, it could use some improvement.  It streams beautifully for me, but the navigation and other functions are a little behind the other streaming services.

The variety of content that you offer is very good, considering all the the hubs to the other services and new content on a regular basis.  I think the price is fair compared to the other services; I signed up for an annual subscription of ad-free (actually a renewal) and got a little price break.  I enjoy many shows and films, but got hooked on “The Gilded Age” and look forward to season 2.  The new documentary on Arthur Ashe is excellent.  If you could make some improvements to the app, this would be practically perfect.

title: Download to play later: Only in airplane mode?!
review:
The latest update has broken a very basic and needed feature. If you download anything on wifi to watch later (to save your cell data), the only way you can view the download is by putting your phone in *airplane mode*. Even turning off wifi and cell data isn’t enough because the app complains you don’t have an internet connection to *stream* the *downloaded* video! Why do we have to render our phones useless in order to watch something specifically designed to be watched when we have limited (or only costly) internet access????

Edit: the response was a joke. It sent me to their help form. I got an email response offering to resolve “only allows playback of downloads on wifi to view later” and a link telling me how to download for later viewing.  It then sent me over to chat help to resolve my issues trying to stream content.  There was little response from the first ‘person’ about trying to stream on a different device. Then after explaining the issue yet again, a new ‘person’ came onto the chat and offered to help me stream my downloaded video while in airplane mode(??).  Again, this last update has rendered the app useless.  I hope playback is possible in future updates.

title: App embarrassing for HBO brand
review: HBO has long been known for great content, but this app tarnishes their rep.  There are so many issues I don’t know where to start.  First off, it is extremely slow. This includes loading time but even just clicking any button takes about 10 seconds to do anything. For example, deleting a download takes forever and there is no indicator that it is doing something. Downloads are touchy. You can only download one show/episode at a time or they will fail. Then you can’t restart the download, you have to delete it, search for the show and try again. Several times I have tried to watch a download on a plane. If you aren’t connected to the internet you can get a message that you aren’t connected and it kicks you out of your logged in session. What is the point of downloads other than to watch offline?  My last complaint is usability. Simple things like when you see shows you are currently watching there is no option to go to the landing page for the show. You can only resume the one you are watching. It is not a great experience to have to search for the show when the current episode is right there I front of you. When you compare the quality of the app to others this one falls way short.

title: Default Setting is Only Stream Over Wifi
review: I have experiences a lot of problems with this app. First it wouldn’t transition into background (in-picture) mode. It would just shut off whatever I was watching when I went to use another app (the other movie/TV app has never done this to me). Then it makes it incredibly difficult to browse a tv show’s catalogue if you recently watched an episode of that same show. For example, when I attempt to watch select episodes of South Park it’s a real pain to watch an episode from season 11 if I recently watched an episode from season 9. It will only let me watch the next consecutive episode in season 11. And then the app kept crashing. Full disclosure, I use a VPN and I am aware that this may conflict with geofencing of content limited to  certain markets, etc.  However, it seems that unless I disconnect the VPN prior to browsing on the HBO Max app, the app irreparably crashes necessitating deletion of the app, powering off/restarting my device, then redone loading the app. And also, the downloading of content to your device feature for future offline viewing does not work. Why? Because the app doesn’t work if your not online!!! I know I’ve been spoiled by other streaming services but there is no excuse for this bugginess. None.

title: Your app is super annoying and buggy Contant is five star
review: Your Contant is five star but it brings it down to one star in a matter of moments because of the frustration of your app I just finally got logged back into my app when suddenly the next day the thing logged me out on its own and would not let me log back in again this is happened so many times it’s getting to be very annoying fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app fix your app is this repeat annoying you’re probably not even reading these reviews most likely but if you are your app is much more annoying than saying fix your app over and over again and stop logging people out every five minutes and stop locking people out so they have to reset their passwords over and over again if I could I’d report you to apple if I knew how and to AT&T which I still could not that I think they’ll probably do anything about it they’ll probably say they can’t do anything on their end. Again I say please fix your app everybody here seems to be having the same problem why don’t you listen to them read your reviews increase your customer service by fixing your app

title: Works Fine for Me
review: I was surprised to see how low the rating was while updating the app recently (2.8 as of June 2022), and kinda feel compelled to provide a different perspective for folks. My experience with the HBO app has been totally fine, as in it does exactly what it’s supposed to and works just as well as any other streaming app I use. Just from a technical standpoint (not talking content), I read a lot about bugginess and slow loads on fast connections, but it works like a charm for me and has always been reliable. I’m using an iPhone 12 Mini with the latest iOS and good internet, not sure if that makes a difference. Given how solid HBO/Warner’s selection of shows and movies is (now I’m talking content), I wouldn’t want folks to miss out or not try it on their phones because they think the app’s gonna crash regularly. Or maybe it will for you, who knows, but I’ve been using it almost entirely on mobile for over a year and have had zero issues. Take it or leave - cheers!

title: Unbelievably buggy, especially for downloading content and playing it offline
review: This review is not about the content on HBO Max but about the app itself. This app is slow to respond and load which is a bit annoying. But it is unbelievably buggy and almost unusable when trying to download content. Once you manage to download your content without the app crashing or stalling out, trying to play your downloaded content often leads to an error about not having a connection. Isn’t that the point of downloading content… so you can play it offline….? This issue is particularly frustrating to have once you’re already somewhere out of cell range and thought you’d be able to watch something you downloaded only for it to require an internet connection. This seems to be an issue that HBO Max is aware of because they have a series of steps to go through to try and resolve the error on their website. But even that doesn’t work half the time. I’ve even tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app with no luck. Once in a blue moon the HBO Max gods smile upon you and you can watch your downloaded content. But holy — for one of the big streaming services to have an app this bad is mind boggling.

title: Good content but app interface is super buggy
review: This application is so frustrating on both my LG TV and phone, they have good shows and movies but the app interface and the app itself is terrible. Just navigating the app feels like a chore, it’s almost as if they are trying to hide their movies and shows from you. Their interface makes it so you have to search for specific titles or genres categories for all the content to show up properly, while other streaming apps display a large variety of content for you to look through as soon as you open the app. Sometimes it will close randomly while I’m watching a show or movie or the app itself freezes as soon as I open it and I either have to wait 5-10 minutes or delete the app and re-install it to get it working again. Not to mention skipping and going back is always laggy and not smooth like on other streaming apps, they really need to fix this interface, because the content is good, but in terms of service of the app itself, it’s terrible. I expect better from HBO, they are miles behind in terms of quality of service, from other streaming apps

title: Best Deal with TRULY quality shows/movies
review: This diverse library filled with spectacular original shows and classic cult content is honestly my favorite of any streaming service out there. Other services charge twice as much, don’t offer discounted prices without ADs and are so over saturated with low quality content that using this service rocked my entire mentality about streaming. As part of a low income household I cancelled every other app I was paying for to afford this, and then out of nowhere they offered 6months at 50% off, and just as that deal was about to come to an end they extended the offer for an ADDITIONAL 6months. I love how they exclusively stream movies that play in theaters for those of us who prefer to watch at home, and honestly I can’t see myself ever switching to another streaming service at this point. Hoping that there will be a continued discount for long time users and looking forward to the future of this app!!!

title: Shows are great. App is awful
review: HBO Max has many great shows.  Shows from TV movies and shows they’ve created. However, the app is terrible. In order to get to the section of a show description where you can see all the seasons choose your season and choose your episode you have to actually go through the search menu. And for the last several months it doesn’t forward itself meaning you watch a show an episode of a show so episode seven of season two and then you watch episode eight of season two and then you watch episode nine of season two and you turn off the app when you turn the app on again it restarts add episode seven of season two so you have to manually swipe through the shows to get to where you left off. And then the next day you open the app again and it still goes all the way back to episode seven of season two even though you might have watched through episode two of season three of any given show it’s incredibly frustrating. I really don’t understand why they can’t get this right it used to be an occasional thing but now it’s every time.

title: App Glitches/ Provider
review: The two issues I have with HBO Max is this provider situation and the app itself… I used the AppStore to download the app and to choose a subscription (which I was charged for), logged into the app various times, deleted and re downloaded the app, and unfortunately the websites for HBO doesn’t allow you to login to your account without the app…looked around in the app functions/settings and was informed on the app that I do not have a subscription with the account I made, in the email verification of the subscription I purchased it is listed as Warner Bro’s as the provider, made attempts with them as a provider, I also use Spectrum for my wifi I attempted with them and lastly there was no option for my mobile carrier (TMobile). Tried on my flat screen as well and I had the same issues. Will be in touch with HBO as soon as possible. Hopefully I can get more of a run down on the provider issues and glitch… would be a disappointment to cancel my subscription. I used  hbo years ago and was very excited to see what MAX had to offer, never had these issues with the old HBO 😕

Thanks! - HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-07-05T14:42:02Z'}
title: Glad I only signed up for a month
review: I was tempted to do a year subscription to save the 2 months of fees but glad I hedged my bet by only doing a month subscription which I’ve canceled the auto renew after 2 days. Great library, the worst app I’ve ever used. How can your streaming platform be so bad in every way when there are a multitude of other apps to model after?  Does nobody at HBO have a Netflix/Amazon/Disney/Hulu account?  Here’s a tip HBO, drop $18/month for the premium Netflix subscription and take it as a tax deduction for research and development of your own app.  HBO should just admit they’re inept and hire literally anybody with a half decent app to create theirs.  Please fix the browsing interface, add options to change brightness on the screen, improve the apps ability to download over cellular as 5G is now much faster than most home Wi-Fi and yet the app could not be more fickle in starting a download over cellular even when a speed test clocks the connection at 500+ mbps.  Start with that and go from there.  Seriously, HBO should spend the amount it does to license a half decent show or movie and I’m sure it can build an app that isn’t the worst.

Thanks! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-05-20T16:20:46Z'}
title: Love The App, But Needs Improvements
review:
I love this app, it’s my new favorite streaming service! After I binge the new Stranger Things and Umbrella Academy I’ll be unsubscribing from Netflix and coming here! Only giving one star, though, because it’s extremely inconvenient and frustrating. 

 I like to rewatch shows a lot, but it’s VERY tedious trying to rewatch a series on HBO 🤦🏽‍♂️ It doesn’t let you clear your watch history and it won’t start at the beginning of an episode like EVERY other major platform does.. when I go to replay episodes it starts at the end credits. So I have to hit the back button and then “restart” EVERY! SINGLE! TIME! It’d be fine if I only had to do it once but then when it autoplays, the NEXT episode is started at the end too. It’s ridiculous.

 Yeah you can clear it from your “continue watching” LIST (which I have to download the app on my phone just to do it when my family primarily watches on the TV) but that doesn’t mean it resets your progress. They need to add this feature ASAP (preferably on ALL platforms, not just mobile and desktop) it would be SO much more convenient and I’d definitely change it to 5 stars immediately.

title: GARBAGE APP FOR PRICE
review: Let me just start by saying I love HBO and it’s shows, and it’s catalogue of entertainment on HBO Max is the best of the best. That earns it the one star rating. All of the rest, everything else having to do with the actual app, is GARBAGE. Fire whoever designed this and hire the Netflix developers ASAP. We are paying a great deal of money for this, it’s not like it’s a free add-on. It’s horrible that my downloads don’t show up properly when I travel out of country (I downloaded them purposely to watch), trying to fast forward or rewind causes a total crash, you have to select who is watching every 15 minutes, you can’t pick up properly after one show to the next or when you stop watching a show (it’s always like 20 minutes off and forget about fast-forwarding), and just general “wheel of death” delays when trying to select ANYTHING. You would think this is some game that’s for free and has advertisements that slow it down. It’s not, it’s an expensive app by a well-developed conglomerate, there’s no excuse for it to be this bad. You need to fix this, it’s GARBAGE and you know it and it hasn’t improved since you started it!

title: Why even offer the download option?
review:
Update: got a response from the developer with a link to the FAQS which only verified exactly what I said in my review. The first step is "while connected to the internet...." 

So yeah. It's pointless 

To be clear this is a review of the app, not HBO. I downloaded a bunch of things to watch while I was on the plane. But you can't even open the app once you're on the plane. Or anywhere else w out wifi. So if I can't open the app on my iPad what's the point of being able to download anything. Doing a little digging, apparently this is a long standing issue that they could have and should have fixed by now. This is a basic design flaw and the download features is inoperable and no reason for this to still be an issue. There is no justifiable explanation for having me waste my time downloading only to not be able to watch. If you can't figure it out then just say that and down allow downloading. Or at the very least put a warning that says you still need a wifi connection to watch So irritated.

title: Auto play has got to go!
review:
The inability to disable auto play on, I presume, most devices where HBO max can be played, including my iPhone with service from AT&T, is absolutely horrible. Some programming, such as VEEP, include actual parts of the show under the credits. The auto play in VEEP cuts off a full two minutes of the program. This is as much of an insult to the people who created this program (and many others who employ this technique) as it is for some idiot to pan and scan some directors carefully crafted film. Why do the intellectual property representatives even allow it?

HBO Max is not the only app guilty of this. BritBox does it too. The standard design of auto play should be ALWAYS to play the ENTIRE program. If there is a manual option, it should be too advance the auto play, not stop the auto play. This should be industry wide! HBO has always prided itself on extremely high-quality programming. With HBO Max, it has diluted its brand considerably. If they're app development department we're half as smart as the people who brought us VEEP, the Sopranos, Entourage, etc. , the functionality of this app would be a whole lot smarter.

title: Great Service, Thank You
review: I really like HBO Max a whole bunch. The amount of content they offer, and content they offer that I dig, is rad I think. Plus, I love how they don't just offer one movie in a film series. They do it the right way in my opinion and instead of just giving you one or a few movies in a series they give you all of them. That attention to detail and thought is what makes me appreciate this service a ton. Also, they just keep adding new television shows and movies I love. Plus, it may seem odd and I'm sure it's just the ratio of people doing it. But, it feels like every time I search for some show or movie that they end up not carrying. That it doesn't seem long afterwards that they finally do offer it. Many thanks to all involved in this app/service for all you offer and for how well I believe that this app works. Thank you for all of that and God bless.

developerResponse: {'id': 26747829, 'body': 'Hi there.\n\nWe’d definitely like to take a look at the experience you’re having and do some testing on our end to see if we can identify a bug. Please reach out to us here: help.hbomax.com/appreview. Thank you!', 'modified': '2022-05-22T12:12:57Z'}
title: Excellent Content, Freezes Often
review:
Really impressed with the variety and depth of content, as well as the video quality. On the iPad Pro the video frequently freezes, or locks up, requiring pressing the “back” arrow, and then reselecting the content, pressing the purple “resume” arrow. We can always eventually resume where we locked up, but we feel there might be some glitch in the app that needs to be addressed.
Any suggestions to get around this freezing would be greatly appreciated. We tried deleting and reinstalling the application.
iPad Pro 12.9 2nd Generation running IOS 14.4. Running the app directly, not using Apple TV.

Update:  Months later and still the connectivity issues remain. We cannot understand why this has not been addressed! Content is superb, but frequent pauses remain extremely frustrating! Please address the connectivity issues! You have by far the best selection of films and series, but the frequent lock ups and long connectivity pauses are detracting from completely enjoying program content!

title: Good selection, sluggish app, needs gesture support.
review:
I mainly use this app on my iPad, so keep that in mind. 
The selection is fantastic and frequently updated, which is great and what the 3 stars are for.  Unfortunately this app is a bit sluggish and is more prone to long loading times than any of the other streaming apps I use. 
For me, one of the worst and constantly annoying things is that this app doesn’t support any gestures within its video player.  I always go to swipe or double-tap, etc. to fast forward or rewind but then remember that with this app I have to precisely touch the buttons right IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SCREEN, so then the screen has a smudge right in the center of it and then I have to deal with that. I just wish they’d add gesture support for each end of the screen and/or (at least) move the buttons down so they aren’t right in the middle of the video player screen. If they added gesture support for the iPad and iPhone viewer, that would be helpful.

title: Painful to Download Shows for Offline Viewing
review: I really want to love HBO Max app but it’s painful to download shows for offline viewing. They have the best show line-up among all the streaming services but the many glitches reduce the positive viewing experience. The download button (arrow-down symbol) frequently disappears. Then, there’s the frequent logging out. Supposedly, on my iPad Pro, automatic log-on is supported. And when you watch a downloaded show, even if you only watch 30 seconds into the movie, you only have 48 hrs to complete your show. After 48 hrs, it will expire and have to attempt to download it again. Good if it lets you and supposedly, it will allow you to “renew” the permission but frequently it will tell you have reached the maximum limit of downloads for that particular show. And lastly, when your internet goes off in the middle of a download, the process goes back to square-one when your internet connection resumes. Lots of potentials…but too many problems. Learn from Netflix and Disney Plus please!

title: A serious faux pas
review: Absolutely vile and disgraceful what they are doing to animators and artists right now. Shows exactly where their hand is and that is  in the money pit. No regard for the hundreds of artists that have put in so much work for them to make them one of the better streaming services. Looks like their dedication to art only goes so far as their tax write-off. Half a mind to cancel. Stupid corporate greed. And absolutely no idea what a modern audience wants. I thought the company was actually making good strides with all its scripted original shows and now to get rid of so many and have so many more innovative shows on the chopping block!!! What a shame and what a waste. Hope y’all go down as the biggest fools in the industry. Somehow makes Netflix look good after their huge mess up with animation earlier this year. just shocking and so so so disappointing! and to say unscripted shows are what women enjoy and scripted shows are what men enjoy? Are you actually dumb??? jesus what century are you programming television for. thought you were cutting edge sad to see your just as behind the ages

title: Why can’t you cast HBO Max?
review: Only reason for 1 star is the inability to cast. Why is that? You go to a friends you wanna watch a movie you can’t cast from your phone. I’m not trying to login everywhere. Fix it. Please and thank you! If I could have one wish from HBO Max first and foremost it would be the ability to cast to television sets within and away from my home. If I could have two wishes from HBO Max it would be to bring back Dream On (I know it’s a nearly impossible usage rights issue-but like Lennon, I too am a dreamer). If I had three wishes from HBO Max it would be to keep doing what you’re doing because I ❤️ it: The Righteous Gemstones✔️ Euphoria ✔️ Hacks✔️Succession ✔️ Barry✔️Last Week Tonight✔️ Bill Maher✔️ And Just Like That✔️The Other Two✔️ Mrs. Fletcher✔️A Black Lady Sketch Show✔️ Westworld✔️Sharp Objects✔️ Big Little Lies✔️ Mare of Eastown✔️The White Lotus✔️ Curb Your Enthusiasm ✔️✔️✔️ and many, many more that I could list but alas this review needs to end eventually. You do so many things better than everyone else, please fix the technical issue and allow us to cast, because world peace is a ways away. Thank you.

title: Only App that makes my phone hot
review:
The HBOMax app is super buggy. anytime I open it to even just search the app catalog, my phone will get very very warm in my hand. It’s the only streaming app I use on my phone that does that. Also, all of the other streaming apps that I subscribe to have the option to expand whatever I’m watching to the full width of the screen on my phone, however the HBO app doesn’t. The show or movie plays in a smaller box smaller than the full length and width of my phone and there’s no way to expand it. In addition, when I open the HBOMax app on my Apple TV device an attempt to play a movie or show, if I attempt to fast forward or rewind a show fire Apple TV, it is very difficult. it’s almost like I have no control over the fast forward or rewind control. It has a mind of its own. 

Also, I wish HBO would build a star rating system in to the app so people could communicate to HBOMAX what we like and don’t, even if we watched the whole thing, and maybe even a place for comments.

title: Good Selection, Terrible App
review: The app has a great selection of movies, all downloadable, including all JL animated movies and some great TV shoes.  Problem is even when they were properly downloaded, I could not access them.  I downloaded multiple things in preparation for a flight and had several problems.  For one, the time bar would stop tracking and stay put on a certain time, and would not disappear from the screen.  If I would try to restart the app to get rid of it it would take 5 min to reload the movie, though it was downloaded.  One time when opening the app on the flight I only received the loading screen and was never brought to the page to access my catalogue, again, though they were downloaded.  This continued for the remainder of the flight so I had no access to the app.  There were several glitches when I would open the movie and it would only appear in the bottom left corner for about a minute before the app all together cut out.

title: App barely works
review: Let me just say this is the first time I’ve written  a review for an app. I’ve used bad apps, but they’ve never frustrated me to the point of actually warning people to save themselves from the headache that is this app. I work in the military, and frequently have poor/no connection to internet when on duty. I usually download a handful of movies and episodes before duty so I have something to watch before bed or when I have downtime. This app, even when movies are downloaded doesn’t even work. When I got the movie to work, after 25 minutes the interface froze and crashed. The app takes a century to open with no internet connection, and when it finally opens the downloaded movies don’t play. I basically should just have not downloaded anything. Thankfully I have a few books to read but it’s nice to keep up with shows and movies that my friends and family watch back home. I really hope they fix this app, they have a movie selection that I think is on par with Netflix but this app leaves a lot to be desired.

title: Something is amiss
review:
How is it 58,000 people rate the app and it can't even average a mediocre 3 stars, but it comes out with an Editor's Choice award meaning it should be in the top 1-5% How much does it cost to buy one on these awards?

In any event, I don't use it much at all on my mobile devices but I use it on Roku and it is fairly average. Compare it with most of its competition and it will fair about the same. There's too many things to pick on to list them and there's several nice features to applaud. To save writing wwar and peace, you'll like some stuff, really hate others, wonder if programmers and evaluators actually watch TV, but in the end it will get most things done.

p.s. Would really like to get rid of the "Who is watching" screen! I'm the only name on the account. There's NEVER anyone else watching. A computer can't figure out there's only one account? Worried about parental controls? Make an option for it...oh wait, you did.

title: Good shows, bad app
review: HBO arguably has always had the very best lineup of original content. But this continues to be the weakest streaming app. Even if I pause the show for a moment it takes like two minutes to reload when I press play again. It’s reminiscent of very old school technology. And this archaic nonsense where I can’t turn off the auto play and I have to watch the first five seconds of the next episode before I’m able to turn it off, since it already takes so long to respond, is really irritating. Why can’t I just turn off auto play so it automatically goes back to browse when a show ends? Not everybody binge watches entire seasons of shows at once. I like to mentally digest an episode before I move onto the next one. But really I don’t need a reason. You need to give us more options. People are who they are. Your app designers are either being controlling or lazy because I’ve seen this complaint for years and you don’t seem to do anything about it.

title: App buggy, Can’t Watch Downloaded content without app crashing
review:
First of all I love the amount of TV shows and movies HBO max offers compared to other streaming services offer. They always update their content often compared to the others. However I cannot enjoy downloaded content on the go without the app crashing and getting stuck on the loading screen. No other app has had this issue when it comes to downloaded content. 

It is time for HBO max to make a new app design and provide a services update to fix the downloaded content issue. For the amount of money my family pays, I should be able to watch the movies and tv shows I downloaded, but sadly HBO max will not let me. 

Word of advice, if there’s a tv show or movie that you really enjoy I would suggest buying it off of iTunes and downloading it directly to your device.  I’m going to start doing that from now on.

title: Great content, terrible app
review:
HBO has A-grade content but a C-grade app.
Firstly, It seems like these guys have never heard of a share button. I’m watching a documentary on the phone and there’s no button share it. 

Secondly, when I went to resubscribe, I couldn't find the re subscribe option under ‘subscriptions’. Under that tab it redirects you to a ‘learn more’ page where you still couldn’t find the re subscribe option. Only when you try to play a video will it take you through renewal steps, so what should’ve have been 3 clicks, became 10. When have you heard of an app or any service making it difficult to resubscribe?

Third, I can’t find an option to alter the video quality at all. When you’re watching on mobile data, you might need to lower the quality to watch it. 

Fourth, I don’t see an option to rate or review the movie in the app, at least I can’t find it. Not sure why they wouldn’t want this data since it could enhance their recommendation engine. If they had a section under the title for adding ratings or reviews, it could increase engagement with users in the long term.  

In this day and age, these just seem like obvious features that a well capitalized company should be able to easily implement. If I’m still subscribing to HBO, it’s despite the app being this awful, which says a lot about the value of their content and what HBO Max could be if they had executed this right.

title: Great selections of shows, abysmal app.
review:
The selection of shows is awesome, with plenty of highly acclaimed content to choose from. The app, however, is horrible. 

If you pay for the premium version to download shows, it often refuses to open the app while offline. 

If you download a show on your device, even if it says download complete, it will crash your app when you try to select it because it is missing data. 

If the episode expires before you are done watching it, it will not let you renew the view time. In order to be able to watch the expired episode in the device download, you have to delete the episode and re-download. 

The app crashes so frequently, I have to uninstall and re-install to get it to function. 

The app is unable to manage downloading a season of 10+ episodes. You have to download a few at a time, or the app will cancel half the download and you’re stuck with missing episodes. 

The video controls constantly glitch, and either won’t let you pause, or will freeze you out of the menu. 

HBO Max is by far the worst steaming app in terms of function that I have used. It becomes a chore to watch a one hour episode with the constant crashes, freezes, and glitches. If you’ve purchased the premium version to watch downloaded episodes offline, you will spend half the time staring at the purple logo screen watching the load icon glitch out.

title: Removed a star and cancelling
review:
Okay, so went on a trip to Europe.  Downloaded some videos to watch on the long flights and layovers.  I was on airplane mode on the first long flight. Midway through the first episode, app crashes.  I relaunch and it stays on the loading screen (can’t even select profile).  I reboot and relaunch again. Same result.  Frustrating, but I figured it would resolve once I had internet again.   No luck. Entire time in Europe it just tells me I can’t stream, but can watch my downloads, but then won’t play the downloads saying service not available.   I try to reach out to support but all their web pages reroute to say  service not available in my region.  Not helpful.   I leave a review.  They respond and send me two links in the email message. I click them and in each case get rerouted to the generic error page saying service not available in that region.    

Now that I’m back in the US, I’m cancelling my subscription and updating the review to 1 star because zero isn’t an option.

title: Decent Shows, AWFUL App Experience
review: Considering you have to pay $10+ a month for access you’d think the app would be amazing. The app consistently disconnects while watching and says I’m not connected to wifi when I am and every other app works. It also has recently started a new bug when I open the app where it says “It looks like you’re offline. Don’t worry, you’ll be able to stream once you're back online”. Like the other error, I am online and every other app works. Then it says “Check Connection” on a button but it doesn’t actually do anything. Not to mention that the layout is horrible, you have to search the show to get to the episodes even if you’re already watching it. Every action takes awhile to happen and scrolling feels very delayed and buggy. You’d think a huge company like HBO could hire a few developers and have these minor issues fixed in a few days. To be honest you’re better off finding the same shows… “elsewhere” on the internet.

title: Selection is great if it doesn’t spaz out
review: I love the selection HBO Max has to choose from. It would be my favorite platform if it wasn’t for all the glitches. This is the only app that I have trouble streaming. Whether I am watching from my Vizio TVs or from our phones they always glitch. I have to reboot the TVs before I can stream my shows. Same on the iPhone, sometimes restarting the phone helps but I have never ever experienced glitches or anything so annoying with any other platforms. For the price you shouldn’t have to deal with this. I also think you should be able to preview a show when you are browsing. HBO is capable of more but they need some serious improvements to this app. Which is unfortunate because many shows on HBO Max are not available on HBO through DirecTV. I hope they can make improvements asap because it’s been like this since the HBO Max was launched and I’m a day one customer!

title: Buggy and Crashes
review:
The only app we struggle to connect to our Apple TV or Chromecast, hardly works on the app on the television, and will only work on my laptop like half of the time…. A waste of money if it’ll never work… I’ve been struggling with it for over a year now. Close to canceling my subscription. It always says to try a private browser or when I do a private one it asks for a non private one. The app always says it’s unable to connect and poor connection. The tv app just will load and load. Again, I would question if it was our internet if we had absolutely any other problems, but we don’t.

Another note, when it does connect to the tv a lot of the time the app will start playing the audible subtitles (the ones for dead individuals) even when it isn’t selected. Luckily I have learned to turn it on, let the show run, then turn it back off and it’s gone, but I’m tired of taking 20 minutes to set up HBO to watch a 30 minute show.

title: Great content. If you can get to it
review:
I’ve been trying not to write a negative review in hopes the app would get fixed. That has not happened since I started my subscription two years ago. Why does it take so long to fix bugs that everyone complains about? From the comments I see here I am not an isolated case. 

Others have already complained about constant crashes and bugs. One of the most annoying is the offline viewing feature. You can’t download anything. The downloads would stop for no apparent reason. Resuming any download doesn’t work. Or if it does I wouldn’t have noticed after waiting for a very long time each time. No one has the patience for that. Download speeds are horrific (and yes, I use a very fast connection). To download a couple of movies and tv show episodes for your flight, you need to start a day ahead. Cause the download speeds, twinned with constant download issues and the need to restart the app will take that long.

title: Selection is great, app is subpar.
review:
As has been discussed in other reviews, the selection of shows and movies is why I pay for this subscription. And am very pleased with that aspect. This app however feels cumbersome. Navigation is slow, and sometimes frustrating while trying to browse episodes in a series. 

The worst experience with this app is in offline mode. This app is by far the worst streaming service I have used for offline entertainment. I like to download shows and movies for air travel. While offline this app performs very poorly. At times I can’t even get to the downloads. It’s like the app gets stuck trying to load online material without realizing it’s not connected to the internet. This is very frustrating and I hope the app developers come up with a more functional and enjoyable offline experience.

title: EXTREMELY buggy on iOS 16
review: Love the content and loved this app before I updated my iOS, but with the new iOS update, playback on HBO Max became a nightmare. Footage constantly freezes to the point where it’s practically unwatchable. It’s worse when watching in Picture-in-Picture mode, but still a problem even when focused on the HBO Max app. I initially thought it was just a problem with the internet or how it’s being streamed, but even downloaded content experiences constant freezes. On top of that the app often just says everything is unavailable and it takes 5+ reloads to load account info or even just the home screen. Thankfully I can still watch HBO Max on my TV and computer but the app is worthless on my iOS 16 phone now. No other video streaming app is performing this poorly on iOS 16, so I’m hoping an update will come to HBO Max soon to get them back in line with their competitions on this platform

title: App is unusable
review: This app is so terrible that I feel like it can’t be a mistake, they would have to try to make it this awful. When I try to use it on my TV my TV has a stroke. When I try to use the app on my phone it doesn’t work, trying to airplay it to my tv it doesn’t work. It randomly stops working every minute and closes, when I reopen it the language will be different even though it’s not selected, the descriptive speech thing will be on, the episode or movie will be all the way back at the beginning. The only thing that works is closing it and restarting the app again only for it to happen again in another minute. Impossible to watch a full movie or tv episode. I’ve been paying for HBO now/ HBO max for a while and it’s never been this bad, don’t buy this subscription until they fix it if they ever do because they don’t seem to care. Look online and see every other person talking about how awful it is if you don’t believe me.

title: Terrible optimization and menu loading times
review:
I mean I know on my Samsung galaxy tab this app works great but for some reason you guys have horrible optimization issues with the iPhone version of this app (Next episode button doesn’t work most of the time, bad menu navigation with no user friendly sense or feel at all, download times are bad even with a good internet connection/they’re very limited on the speed they allow you to download videos for offline viewing. Also idk why it seems like the videos only last 2-3 days before you gotta renew the licensing through the app for it and when you try it doesn’t work you just usually have to redownload the entire video but that one is broken on iPhone and Samsung galaxy s7 tab as well

One good thing I can say about HBO is they have great content, they just need some new people on their app development team that’s all.

title: Great content, horrific app.
review:
If you download content to watch offline, unfortunately hbo max is not the app for you. Downloads are unbearably slow (No, it’s not a connection issue. Every other streaming app I use is lightning fast.) If you’re lucky enough to get a title to download completely, I hope you enjoy watching it over and over since the hbo servers can’t seem to recognize when you delete a title. You will not be able to download any more content unless you contact hbo’s extremely ineffective customer service to delete titles for you and ‘reset’ your account. You’ll just get the ‘download limit reached’ error every time regardless of whether you have one title downloaded or thirty titles. Their solution is to delete and reinstall every single time you want to download something. It’s really quite pathetic. 

Again, the content is fantastic. The app is probably the worst one out there and customer service is a complete joke.

title: Bugs that never get fixed
review:
Okay, I use this app for my iPhone X and my Xbox One. They both actually share a common issue: They always show a message that says can’t play title (or something like that) and will sometimes work after a couple tries even though nothing has changed since the first attempt. In general the content is amazing, but this issue really kills the experience. Another issue I’ve found on mobile devices is that it can’t seem to download any movies or shows, or at least says it can’t. I’ve done every method listed for trouble shooting and I have had more than enough space in the device, yet it still gives the same problem.

Edit: The message for download problems is:
“Oops, something went wrong. We couldn’t complete your download”
That’s all it says, no reason why it wouldn’t work and nothing that would help with trouble shooting.

title: Offline function doesn’t work.
review: I moved to an area where we don’t have internet. So I was excited to see they had a download option. I can barely get it to download anything. The few times I did get it to download I was unable to watch what I downloaded because when I get home and try to use the app it doesn’t go into offline mode like the other streaming apps I use. It just keep cycling the 3 dots on the bottom of the screen. From reading the other reviews on this app it doesn’t look like they are trying to fix it. I really would like a refund but I don’t see that happen so we are going to cancel our subscription and highly recommend others do the same they are definitely not giving us what we paid for. We posted about this before and got a response that basic tried to make it look like this is our fault some how. It’s funny that we have Disney plus and Netflix and have never had this problem.

title: Waste of $$$
review:
The app and service are glitchy.  The connection is lost or buffers periodically  while streaming individual episodes. If you do try to report the issue, plan on spending 30-45 minutes on the phone.  You will need that time to run all the “troubleshooting” steps they recommend.  By the end of the call, HBO Max will have blamed your internet service, router, wiring, tv make/model/software version, and your choice of viewing device.  Also, plan on disconnecting/reconnecting all the above and placing a call to your internet provider to verify speed and outages.  It was also recommended that I schedule an appointment with my internet provider to have additional wiring installed. *at my expense of course* The one thing that won’t be addressed is your initial problem, nor the quality of service that you are paying for and not receiving.  
**If you have money to throw away and enjoy wasting time, this app is for you.**

title: Not really the best streamer
review: This app has a great selection of shows and a lot of them u can’t find on anything else but it has lots of bug such as random small glitches, not working through a website (only works as an app), and if I pause my show for 10 minutes to go do something  when u press play it shows a small snippet of the part I was on(less than 2sec) and then fast forward to the last 3 minutes and sometimes I don’t realize and I’m very confused on what is going on, and the closed captioning is terrible sometimes it doesn’t show at all when it’s on and other time it shows the same sentence that was said like 3 times then other times it’s delayed or to fast over all it definitely needs fixing the bugs I mentioned aren’t all that I’ve dealt with. the only good thing I have to say about this app is the options of shows that’s it

title: Awful
review:
This app feels like a prototype from 2013. 
Nothing about it is user friendly. I feel like it forces you to sit down and watch a show or movie in landscape mode. I want to be able to browse while a video is playing. I want to be able to click my phone off for a moment but still be able to hear the show. If I want it paused I’ll hit the “pause” button. If I wanted to sit down and give a show my full attention, I would watch it on my TV. I want to be able to use my PHONE while I am watching something on my PHONE. Even though I love so many HBO shows, I honestly use Peacock more just because it’s so brilliantly user friendly; it plays video on a small moveable window that allows me to use my phone while enjoying content. If i didn’t get this app for free through my provider, I would cancel my service and delete it out of shear frustration not to mention how terrible the streaming quality is. IT’S JUST AWFUL.

title: HBOMAX App
review: I have been an HBO customer for a while. Became a big fan when Game of Thrones and True Detective series were created and back then I would use the HBOGO app. I must say HBO offers so much more quality content than the competition. I love that I will never go w/o finding a dozen or more shows or movies I want to view at any given moment. Looking forward to the House of the Dragon coming this year. Would like to see True Detective come back for another season. One small issue I find when streaming a movie or show the player will not allow a minimized window for multi-tasking. That would be a nice feature one day hopefully that could be added but I’m pleased with the app and my purchase. Keep up the good work!

title: Terrible Performance
review: This app is horrible. I have no wifi available to me while I am at work. I do not have unlimited hotspot on my phone so I don’t tend to stream my titles. I download all of my titles in my house before hand to have them readily available. This does not help. The app requires internet connection to verify the license. When I open the app and access my downloaded titles it freezes and I need to close and re-open the app. Then upon second opening it requires me to log in to my account again. Then freezes again and will not access my downloads causing me to close the app a second time. Then on the third try when I open the app the titles load and playback is fine. This happens every single time I try to watch anything. In that exact sequence, every time. When I close the tablet and let it sit more than 30 mins, the process starts all over again. If I could give it zero stars I would.

title: Literally doesn’t even function
review: I’ve had nothing but bugs and issues with this app since it’s come out. Now I can’t even watch anything bc the second I try the app crashes or it sits there buffering then takes me to my downloads page and tells me to check my connection because I’m offline? Im in my bed at home, my connection is fine, my internet is fine, I have no problems except for the app. And this kind of stuff happens with all sorts of my devices too, not just my iOS app. I even have issues on my smart TV sometimes. You guys need to do something about this. I can’t even watch my downloaded items without the app crashing or suddenly telling me I don’t have internet anymore even though it was functioning up until the point of pressing play, what’s even the point?! Im paying for a service that doesn’t even work half the time!

title: Its ok
review: Great selection of shows and movies, when it actually works. My wifi is fine with every other app and device but HBO always is lagging or displays some type of “error” message on the screen. Iv also had issues with my debit/credit info being leaked as well. I got a fraud alert charge on my credit card, as well as a message from HBO Max alerting me that there has been various logins on my account. I called customer service and the guy clearly had no idea what he was doing and was rude. He ended up resetting my password but somehow sent it to the wrong email? I dont even know how that happened honestly. He then couldnt figure out how to fix the issue then tranferred me to someone who solved the issue in 2 minutes. Overall, good selection, and the customer service if ok depending on who picks up.

title: Barely functions
review: HBO Max has great content but I find myself feeling having to use this app to access it not worth it. This app is so buggy it’s almost as if it’s a developers amateur app they’ve developed for coding boot camp or something. I’ve never even seen some of the bugs that occur in this app before. For example when I play an episode of a series, the app will lag for MINUTES, like 1-2 STRUGGLING just to start to play an episode. Sometimes it just never does, even though my internet is completely fine. But half the time after it does this the episode will magically think it’s been played and just skip into the next episode. Then I have to manually back out and try to open up the previous episode which the app now thinks I have already played. I can’t even fathom how such a bug would happen, but it’s the HBO Max app and it’s better at being buggy than being an app for playing actual content.

title: Bugs
review: Love the app and the selection of movies and shows on there! But about every 40-45 minutes of watching a show it’ll freeze my whole TV. Literally, the TV gets frozen, to the point I have to unplug the whole TV for about 30 seconds to a few minutes(the longer the, better I’ve realized). And it’s just ridiculous, I had this app for about a year and a half ago and I kept it for about a year and then I cancelled it for a while. So, recently I’ve tried to download it again, hoping that they may have worked out those bugs I was experiencing. But nope, same problem as before. The app will suddenly freeze after watching a few episodes of something and we have to unplug the TV for a bit and plug it back in to get it to work. Would be a perfect app and perfectly worth the money… IF they fixed those annoying bugs!

title: This app is possessed
review: I almost never feel compelled to write a review, but this app is an exception. I love watching the shows and movies that HBO has to offer. However, this app only gives me headache every time I try to use it. It won’t play on my TV without me casting from my phone, and even then, it says it cannot play the requested title. Every. Single. Time. I have to keep trying to load it and play the episode through my phone. And when I finally get the episode to work, sometimes it’ll just pause and skip to the next episode, not letting me select anything to change it back. I swear the app is possessed. I’ve even had it stop my episode to play the next one in a different language. I’ve seen no improvement in the time that I’ve had the service. I’m finishing my show and then cancelling this buggy app. Definitely not worth $15 a month.

title: Viewing offline is horrible
review: Several times I went on long trips.  I download on my IPad several shows and movies in preparation to view offline on my trip.  While offline the app lets me start and play one downloaded item.  After completion, I want to select a second downloaded item to view while offline and the app hangs.  It typically shows a magenta splash screen with logo and cycles three dots at bottom.  You leave app and return it doesn’t correct, you restart IPad it doesn’t correct, but if you connect to internet it will correct ( that’s my recollection).  It seems the app is looking for a response from the server to start the next show.  What’s the point?  I am playing downloaded content offline because I don’t have access to the internet.  Frustrating to say the least.  Netflix and Prime apps don’t have this issue.

title: content  is good, app  has issues
review: as a voiceover user, most of the buttons are not spoken. it’s not as bad as peacock, but pretty close to it. most of the buttons and edit boxes and stuff are not spoken aloud. also when you enable audio description, it go to watch another movie that has audio description  later, you have to enable audio description all over again. For some reason it doesn’t save the audio description preference. That is extremely annoying. I have all kinds of boobies added to my list, but when you go into the app, the list itself is nowhere to be found. so I still have to search for stuff using the search because there’s no button that takes you to your list. If it’s there, it’s not being spoken anywhere. The developer wrote a response stating that I have to go to a help  website, so I did, and the  help website requires me to pass a captcha  I can’t see.

title: Great content, terrible app
review: I primarily use the download feature because I do not have Wi-Fi at home, so this review is mostly in reference to that. The app crashes often (usually while downloading things). It happens when I try to download multiple things at once. If a download expires, the prompt to “renew” the download does not work, so I have to redownload completely… again, this is very time consuming if I have to download one-by-one. The last issue doesn’t always happen, but sometimes if I go to pause the video, it becomes “frozen” (the video keeps playing, but I cannot press any commands (pause/home/etc). Once that occurs, sometimes the app won’t open again. Long story short, there are random bugs that haven’t been fixed (and are extremely irritating). Love the content, but not an enjoyable app to use.

title: Content great , but app is crashing
review:
I love the content that HBO max is offering but I have some problems with the app.
I wanted to download some episodes of a series but it seems like that there is a bug in the app. I started the download thinking that it will download everything in the background, which it did but just partially.
The first episode I downloaded worked fine, the next day when I wanted to watch the next epsiode the app crashed and closed itself without warning. Then  I skiped this episode and the next worked. When I tried to go back to the not working episode it crashed again. I then deleted the app and reinstalled it and tried it again. Some episodes failed to download but showed up as downloaded. The next time downloading worked but on the last episode the app crashed again and closet itself.
I am using an IPad Pro M1 from 2021 with the current software.

title: Slow, outdated and very frustrating app
review: The HBO app has a lot of catching up to do. At first I thought it was just my iPad, but then it started happening on my iPhone and my smart TV… Crashing in the middle of a show, freezing up at the end of a show and not skipping to the next episode. The user interface is outdated. If you start a show from their home screen, it doesn’t take you to the next episode automatically. You have to go and search for the show to find the list of episodes. The app sometimes takes a few tries to load and buffer a movie. The HBO app is slow all around. It’s hard to stream from your iPad to a smart TV. Sometimes I have no luck mirroring my iPad to the TV. I’m not going to blame my devices as they are all new devices with a very strong Internet connection. My siblings also complain about the app they have the same app issues that I do in their own homes.

title: Blah!!!
review: As far as content goes it’s great! But I’ve had issues with this app from day one! First off. I do not want to be asked every single episode if I want to continue watching because I’m using data. Like many of us in this day and age I have unlimited data and it’s a cell phone. People can simply turn it off when they are done. Second of all this app is full of bugs. There is ALWAYS a service issue or or an issue where it takes to long to load, or during the middle of a show it’ll say “something went wrong or we can’t play this title right now” all those times I’ve checked my internet. That wasn’t the issue. It happens where ever I go or where I’m streaming at. If I can’t go a day without an issue I’m going to have to cancel my subscription. I’ve had it for a little over a month now and if I can’t watch anything without a problem there is no point in having it.

title: Can’t turn off auto play!
review: This app leaves a lot to be desired, and many others have written about the problems I have experienced too. For the price, it should really be a better app! But my biggest reason for the 2 stars is that it lacks the ability to turn off auto play. When will this be addressed? In every other streaming service I use I can turn off auto play. I do not want another episode to start immediately after one has finished!! If I should nod off while watching, a few episodes can go by. Also, if I’m watching on my iPad and nod off, it just goes on playing- so the Lock Screen never engages. I want an episode to end, period. If I am not sleepy, I am perfectly capable of starting the next one myself. I truly hate this about this app. Please give customers the choice to turn off auto play!!

developerResponse: {'id': 31365304, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to talk to you directly to help. If interested, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-08-09T13:08:44Z'}
title: Waste of time and money!
review: The newest update has blocked me from viewing any content other than rated G. It pops up with a notification that I can’t watch my selection because of “parental control settings”. I have never set any parental controls. Even after trying to create a kids profile with the minimal amount of control, which allows NC-17 to be played, the app still won’t work. I have spoken to their “advocates”, that was a joke. I went through all these hoops, sign in, sign out, check for updates, delete the app, turn my phone off, re-download the app… none of that worked. The “advocate” concluded with saying that “sometimes these things happen on apple devices and hopefully the bug team can fix soon, but I can enjoy streaming on a different device”. This conversation lasted about 20 mins and fixed absolutely nothing. Why can’t I use something I’m paying for?!
