See this article for some common tips and tricks: http://itsh.bo/max-downloads. If you have any additional questions, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you. Thanks, HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-01-12T10:50:27Z'}
title: Ok, but can’t actually play downloaded content when no internet
review:
The app won’t play downloaded content when you are disconnected from the internet. I downloaded a movie to watch on the plane. It started fine when we were leaving the airport, but after putting on airplane mode, about 30 minutes into the flight, the movie stopped responding to commands (e.g., pause) and going back home and then back into the app caused a several minute wait, followed by “not connected”, with no response to trying to restart the movie. Useless functionality if it doesn’t actually work.

Update: I read the help article mentioned in the developer response and none of it applied to my experience. I’ll edit the review when the app is updated and the issue is fixed.

developerResponse: {'id': 27815123, 'body': 'Good news! You can now use the Pinch-to-Zoom gesture to make shows and movies fill the screen on your iOS device. Download the latest HBO Max update and let us know if you have any questions.', 'modified': '2022-02-03T18:43:29Z'}
title: Bring back Full Screen!! 4:3 unwatchable!
review:
Update: I’ve since unsubscribed due this issue, but it appears they have fixed it as others are updating their reviews. Updating to 4 stars as this was my only issue. When I was using this service the Content is great, app is acceptable but could better handle your continue watching, recommending new content, etc. 

Original: Disabling zoom to fit is the most bonkers thing they could have done. Squared videos are now only tiny little boxes in the middle of the screen, they used to fill my entire screen. This has totally ruined the viewing experience! If this doesn’t come back soon I’ll have to cancel the service, can’t watch half the stuff I want!

title: Unable to use the app or the streaming site
review: My family had decided to invest in our  paid first subscription of HBO Max, but I have been unable to stream anything through the site (it says my device is unsupported) through my MacBook Pro that is 12.0.1 using Google Chrome that is completely updated. So then I downloaded the app hoping that it would work on my iPhone, and alas, it also does not work on my iPhone which is also updated to the latest version.   Anywhere I try to submit questions does not receive them and when I search why it’s not working, it just says to check my browsers.  I would like my money back and I am never going to try hbo max again. We were excited about finally trying a new streaming service, but now we are disappointed that we will never be able to enjoy the Sci-fi content that hbo exclusively has rights over. What a shame.

title: Great when it works
review:
Selection is great. My only issue is that I download content to watch when flying. So many times the content isn’t available and there is no error message. If I delete and reload it works half the time (not ideal when I don’t have access to internet/wifi). If the license needs to renew, that’s one thing, but it doesn’t tell you and it would seem to expire too quickly if that’s the case. 

Even if the content seems available, the app often says “you’re offline check connection.”  What’s the point of the download if I can’t watch while offline? Also, it gives me that error when I have cellular connection and have authorized to stream over cellular (again, not sure why it would need to stream if downloaded).

HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-10-02T02:15:59Z'}
title: Content not good enough to justify shorty user experience
review:
The HBO app is the only one out of the major streaming services that I consistently have issues with. Their app is constantly getting stuck. It recently logged me out on my iPhone and now it legitimately won’t let me log back in. I’m trying to sign in with my TV provider and it just gets stuck loading. It never times out and realizes that it’s stuck. It just stays with three dots blinking forever and will never let me sign in. 

HBO max is also the only streaming app I have issues with when downloading for offline use. About 50% of the time the app will show the show or movie as downloaded but when I go to play offline it will error out. I can also only download one thing at a time. If I try to download two episodes or two movies at the same time, instead of queueing like Disney or Netflix does, the app freaks out and doesn’t download either thing. 

HBO max is also one of the only streaming apps that doesn’t adjust video quality for low bandwidth. It will get stuck buffering instead of switching to lower quality like Netflix. 

Everything about the app is frustrating and I’m starting to feel like their content isn’t worth the hassle. I’ll like stop paying for hbo max in favor of other services.

HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-04-20T13:52:16Z'}
title: Spend some of that network $$$ on your app.
review:
For a network that spends billions of dollars on content, they failed to make a stable app.

HBO Max has all kinds of buggy problems. Your content will mysteriously stop play in between with alerts that you are not connected to WiFi when intact you are. There’s also the problem of stream just buffering itself for extended periods of time; the solution for which is to go back and hit play again. Other intermittent problems include tracking previously watched episode in tv shows so you’re often coming back to play the same episode again. Another bug I noticed is, for tv shows; you can’t select the episode you want to watch. There’s simply no easy option to navigate this thing. 

HBO needs to prioritise and change this app entirely. It has so many bugs, makes me wonder what is it are paying them for again?

developerResponse: {'id': 29673624, 'body': "Hey there, thanks for taking the time to share your experience! If you're still getting these errors and would like some help with troubleshooting, please reach out to our team at: help.hbomax.com. We'd be happy to help you get back to streaming all your favorites with us! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-05-11T00:42:04Z'}
title: Good, but one problem..
review: This app has sooo many good things, to movies to shows. I almost watch something every day! But I want to get to the problem. Whenever I watch a show it skips. And it’s kinda glitches. And when it skips it takes me forward. And I miss a lot of parts in shows because this problem. But the weird thing is that it only does this for shows, so whenever I watch a movie it doesn’t skip. I don’t know if it’s just happening to me, or if a lot of people are having the problem. But except for that, it’s a good app! It also has a lot of shows and movies that other apps don’t have. Like Netflix doesn’t have Harry Potter. But what I’m trying to say is that it is a very good app to watch things on.  So I really recommend it! But that’s it!

You also may want to try restarting your network (modem and router) if you haven't yet. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-05-11T16:22:10Z'}
title: Serviceable catalog, horrendous app
review:
Whenever possible, do try to avoid using this app when streaming and use a computer. I have never watched a title on the app successfully without either captions being incorrect or streaming being interrupted. I have been trying to watch The Batman without interruption since it released in March on the app and have yet to have a successful run front to back. The app will frequently buffer in the middle of streaming and will also frequently be unable to play the title at all. Not to mention the atrocious captioning for all titles. I feel genuinely bad for any deaf or hard of hearing viewers because good luck picking up on any of the details as literally every single caption is either delayed, cut off, or flat out inaccurate. 

HBO you have a duty to your customers to make your content accessible for all. Get your act together and fix this horrific excuse for an app.

HBO Max Customer Support", 'modified': '2022-03-20T20:15:56Z'}
title: Just another definition of corrupt capitalism
review:
I only have HBOMax because of AT&T. That being said, I’m downgrading my plan because it’s not worth the perk(Just gonna leave that alone).

When you think HBO, you think blockbuster movies as close to the theater as you can get. HBO offers the big name movies and occasionaly(super rare) gems you didn’t expect. Other streaming services seem to excel in introducing you to new genres or shows to binge. It’s like HBO is just using their brand to trick us into thinking this app is capable of the same. But clearly it’s just meant to keep their name relevant against the streaming services making them obsolete. Pure money grab for the big screen companies.

HBOMax today is the same terrible platform and navigation abilities from day 1 with the absolute minimum being done to upgrade over the years. Soooo many bugs. To say I’m disappointed would be an understatement.

title: Alright but one thing is holding it back…
review: I have to say a great selection and I cannot complain about quality….but…. in the mobile version of the app I cannot browse episodes of a series :/. Sometimes for some reason my app skips an episode for some reason then I can’t browse and select the proper episode I desire to watch and it kinda bums me out. What I have to do is go on my Xbox and open the app while logged into my account and select my desired episode then go back to my mobile device which confuses me as to why I’m having this issue. Maybe there’s a button I just haven’t found yet but I swear there’s no way to browse episodes within a series. I hope something is done but other than that I would’ve given a definite 5 stars

developerResponse: {'id': 28149719, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username Thwrh where it asks for your Web Handle.', 'modified': '2022-02-20T11:14:36Z'}
title: Downloading feature needs major work!
review: Content on the app is great. They offer a nice selection of tv shows and movies, but the app itself needs major improvements. Out of all of my streaming apps it is the one I find the least user friendly and has the most problems. The app consistently crashes, the response time with searches and trying to open things is lagging, and the download feature is horrible. I spend hours trying to download a single episode because of consistent errors being thrown, but could download multiple series and movies on competing apps. I’ve also found that if you are trying to download something you have to keep the app open the entire time and your phone unlocked.

developerResponse: {'id': 27713116, 'body': "Hi, we're happy to help. We have some great troubleshooting steps here that should improve your experience on your iPad: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-01-28T05:56:26Z'}
title: Very disappointed with the app for iPad
review: Ever since I downloaded the most recent Apple upgrade, HBO max playback has been terrible. After each episode it skips 2 to 3 episodes so I have to stop it, go back, and try to play the skipped episodes again.  I say try because frequently those episodes will not play or they will skip again. For some reason the Sopranos is the worst. After it skips episodes literally the only way I can get them to play is to download them. and half the time the download cannot be completed .  I thought the last update would fix this bug but it has not. I’m not sure if this is a common issue or not but considering that I am paying for the service, I would like for it to work better.

title: Great content, way better than the rivals!
review: The content is great, high quality movies and series and no garbage like what Disney is doing with Marvel for example. I never thought I would get hooked to a DC series again, but watched Peacemaker and what a great show. Now I’m watching Doom Patrol and it’s great too! Same as the movies we find in HBO Max, they offer good movies and tv series, instead of generic garbage. Even the classic cartoons are here! The app definitely needs some work, like the download interface for example. It needs organization and to be more responsive, but I won’t leave a negative feedback, because I know that they’re working on that

HBO Max Customer Support', 'modified': '2022-09-13T16:24:13Z'}
title: Worst Video App on the App Store
review:
This is, by far, the absolute worst experience I have had trying to view media on my IPhone. The thing that infuriates even more, which is somehow simultaneously the reason this wretched app is getting even two stars, is the selection of films and television shows. They are, by a long shot, the best selection out of all of the streaming apps. This adds insult to injury, however, if you spend the time that I just did trying to watch even five minutes of one of my favorite shows. The user interface? Horrible. I couldn’t find a person to design worse.

Fix your app. Seriously. It cannot be rocket science. Literally every other subscription media service has figured out how to offer an even somewhat enjoyable experience on mobile devices.

title: GREAT CONTENT!
review:
I will be honest, the ONE thing I don’t like about the mobile app is that if you already have a show in your “currently watching” list, it’s a pain in the neck to get to the list of episodes. Sometimes I want to skip an episode or two, ya know? 

But besides that, this is my favorite streaming platform. Easily. Whenever I want to watch something and I don’t know which platform has it, I check HBO Max first because they have all of the BEST content. Oh and unlike certain other streaming services, HBO Max actually includes ALL of the seasons of every show they have on their platform. Never change, HBO. Never change.

developerResponse: {'id': 30685577, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username Lilmion where it asks for your Web Handle. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-07-03T11:36:24Z'}
title: Great Content but Bad App
review:
The selection of movies and shows are great, for DC fans this is basically a must have and there’s a nice amount of anime and cartoons as well as just shows in general. 

The problem is the app itself is slow and barely runs I mean across all platforms from TV to Laptop to Phone which all are new devices the app still runs slow, the load times are rough. Compared to Netflix for example which runs pretty smoothly on any device HBO is way behind.

Navigating the app to find new shows is difficult unless you already have something in mind and can just search it but if you’re just trying to see what HBO has to offer they don’t even show everything and the categories aren’t really set up for you to find what you’re looking for.

developerResponse: {'id': 28394300, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to talk to you directly to help with this. If interested, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support.', 'modified': '2022-03-05T08:33:33Z'}
title: Skips to the end
review: Terrific content featured on a horrible app. Incredibly slow to load and extended lags after any clicks/actions. The latest frustration is every single time I attempt to watch something, it immediately skips to the end & then buffers. I try to skip back using the icon and/or manually slide to the start, but with the extended lag on any clicks, it inevitably crashes. It’s averaging 5-10 minutes just to get something to start to play. This is all content that has never been viewed or opened previously, but the status bar shows it as a “watched” item. I don’t bother trying to download anything anymore because it will never play offline. Far better apps with my other less expensive streaming services. A truly subpar vehicle for a premium price.

title: Needs more anime
review:
Hi! My family and I just recently downloaded HBO Max thinking it would have something for everyone in the family because we all like different things. But my main focus is that this app has barely any anime. My sister, (who also watches anime) told me that this app has a huge anime section. I downloaded it only to find out that it has like only 6 animes. I checked in the kids and adult section but still barely any anime. 

A few animes that I would suggest are: Naruto, Naruto Shippuden, Fairy Tail, My Hero Academia, Demon Slayer, and Ouran High School Host Club. These are just a few that I suggest adding. 

Overall, this app isn’t too bad but if you added at least Fairy Tail to this app I would definitely use more and give this app 5 stars!

title: It Works!
review: I was hesitant to try this app as the ratings were not very good? But I decided to give it a try. I’m old school as I always do a couple of things before and after I install a new app. Before I install I  make sure my devices are up to date. Then I do a “hard boot” or “restart” depending on the device. After the app install I again do a “hard boot” or “restart” before using the app. So far I’ve never had any problems including this app. Everything works just fine. I also perform these “maintenance“ functions regularly just to make sure everything works as it should. Good luck!

If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-02-26T06:01:02Z'}
title: Doesn’t load
review: While I was watching a show I had to rewind to hear something again. The website completely glitched me out and I refreshed, signed out and signed back in, closed the browser, restarted my laptop, and even cleared cookies on Chrome. The website would not let me watch again and kept giving me a message saying “Can’t Play Title” “Make sure your browser is not in private browsing mode”. I was not on a private browser, and my wifi was good. After all of those attempts on my laptop, I tried on my phone through the app and I still couldn’t watch it. I kept getting a message saying I was offline, when I was not. I even downloaded the episode to see if it would let me watch it since I was “offline”. I still couldn’t watch it, and now the app was glitching me out of an episode I had downloaded.

Thank you! HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-05-07T16:25:13Z'}
title: Great content horrible and buggy UX
review: Lots of things to watch so overall that makes it worthwhile but this UX is really poor. There is no obvious way to navigate back to a series list of seasons/episodes. Turns out if you click on the title of the episode it takes you back but man it’s annoying.  Also downloading content to watch off line means leaving the app open and keeping the screen from going to sleep or it stops/hangs.  You need to keep your downloads to 2-3 episodes at a time or it stops   /hangs and lastly sometimes the whole app crashed and closes when you click download button again causing the downloads to stop/hang and then you have to remove and re-add them…

developerResponse: {'id': 31349789, 'body': "Hey Eoin, we know how frustrating this can be and we'd be happy to help! If you're still having trouble singing in and would like one of our advocates to walk you through the process, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact. Best, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-08-08T23:38:33Z'}
title: Unable to sign out of old account.
review: This app is terribly built. In an attempt to sign in to my provider account that provides me my new subscription I am unable to sign out of my old expired account. Beyond frustrating the lengths I have to go to even get I to this streaming platform. Go to the website to sign out I all devices, this can take up to 4hrs to complete. When I launch the app, it asks me to pick a plan, restore purchase, or sign into provider (which is continuously failing) with no option to sign out. From the resubscribe screen there is no option to sign out of the app or to manage your profile, it is essentially softlocked. The one time it bugged and I believed I signed out, the keyboard would not pop up upon trying to sign into my provider. Content-wise it’s not bad, as for its service as a whole? Pretty crap.

HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-01-19T05:47:32Z'}
title: App extremely glitchy.
review:
Catalog of options is great but the good basically ends there.
The basic services has constant commercials. I thought going ad free would be reasonable.
Paid the $15/$16 and the hard times began.
The streaming is extremely glitchy. At first I thought something was wrong on my end and this belief went on for days even though I could stream other apps. I even tried uninstalling and reinstalling and restarting my phone multiple times.
Finally I decided to start downloading the shows I wanted to watch and for all of 2 episodes I rejoiced believing I had solved the problem.
I had not.
From there the app slowed dramatically. It takes a long time to launch the Home Screen at all. The shows will mess up while playing. The downloaded shows will act like streamed shows. They’ll stop, skip, lose sound, etc. no amount of relaunching fixed this problem. 
Today we have a fun problem where I can’t get anything to play. I’ll try to start something and the whole app will close out. 
Needless to say, my personal time with HBO will not last beyond this subscription, which is sad, because I still have a lot I want to watch.

title: Designed Only To Take Your Money
review:
After suspicious activity started appearing on my account, I followed instructions left in the “Help” center of HBOMAX’s Q&A page. Twice on my own I had changed the password and hit the “Sign Out Of All Devices” feature. It only signed out of the devices but password did not change on both instances. 

This lead me to calling costumer service, who was helpful and very courteous. They were able to change the password but now that is the password. The one I put in with their help afterwards did not stay either. So luckily I remembered the password they chose because otherwise I wouldn’t be able to have gotten back into my account. And it still won’t change.

This isn’t even taking into account the numerous freeze ups the app preformed each time I went into to change my account nor the fact that I have to delete the app for every download I select, or otherwise remain stuck in a single movie on loop playing on this app every time I open it. 

The app for Tv is great, but the phone and account managing needs a major tuneup. 

Buyer beware.

developerResponse: {'id': 31567303, 'body': "Hi there! We're sorry to hear this has been your experience, and we'd like to spend some time looking into this with you. If you're interested in speaking with an advocate directly, please fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - VHS Collector - where it asks for your Web Handle. Thanks! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-08-20T14:51:01Z'}
title: Used to be amazing
review:
But now I can’t log in with a provider using my ios device. Click the button, spinning icon just spins. Forever. And I shouldn’t have to resort to using another device to use the app we pay for,  especially when the one device i use the most is the one that wont let me log in. Maybe I’m not around the other device, so that option isn’t even available let alone convenient. I know I’m not the only one experiencing this issue. Please do something about it. 

I was halfway thru watching a movie, paused and went to work. Didn’t even close the app, came back to it after work and the app had signed me out, and then would not let me sign back in. I am able to log in using other devices at home. So it is not an issue with my account. Please figure it out. Again, it’s not just me.

You also may want to try restarting your network (modem and router) if you haven't yet. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support.", 'modified': '2022-09-08T12:16:41Z'}
title: Horrible app of all streaming apps
review: It’s always buffering, when you try to go back (rewind) a show or movie it takes forever. Not user friendly. Then when it gets to the part you were at originally it stops, skips forward, no sound… it’s a disappointing app and one that I wouldn’t recommend if it weren’t for the shows like House of the Dragons. Two stars instead of one for that reason alone. We’ve been sitting here for 30minutes trying to get through 5min of a show with it constantly buffering, sound going out, skipping ahead and then skipping back. It even takes a long time to make a selection…like going to the app settings. Super frustrating and kind of makes me want to throw the remote at the tv. But it’s not the tvs fault lol

title: AWESOME CONTENT SELECTION!! Impossible to enjoy. ☹️
review: I guess I’m just confused because it looks like you’ve been getting reviews for a year plus that say the same thing. Why doesn’t it work? It’s not my Internet because every other app works flawlessly… Netflix, Disney +, Prime, Apple TV… it takes way too long to actually get the app to load… Half of the time it kicks me back out to the home screen. If I manage to get into the app and pull up something to watch, it has a window that pops up over it multiple times saying that it’s not available right now but then it will start back up after a moment. Constant interruptions are no fun. If it helps, i use a fire stick. I hope y’all can figure something out, because it’d be great to keep your service.

Thank you, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-02T02:02:24Z'}
title: Popular show = no service
review:
1. This is a premium service with little to no way of watching the content “provided” with cellular data. Even if you allow it through settings both phone and app, you will still have issues. 
2. When a popular show starts or finishes, the servers cannot keep up with demand. Thus not allowing you to watch the content you’ve paid for until a later time. The whole point of having an app is to be able to watch content at any time with wifi or cellular data. 
3. It buffers way too much. Literally the middle of a show or movie, always in the good parts, buffers. Again just another example of HBO’s servers not being able to keep up. 

Save your money. Don’t get the app. Literally probably better subscribing to STARZ or Peacock. Plus they are cheaper!

title: Great content / bad app
review:
This app feels very outdated unfortunately. It’s frustrating when it has the best shows catered towards me. I love Batman and Cartoon Network animations. When it comes down to it there are such simple fixes that could make this app an easy 5 star. 
My notes on things I would fix(these are more luxury fixes but nonetheless problems I have)
- When clicking a show it doesn’t automatically show me the catalog of seasons/episodes 
- No option to skip episode. Sometimes I’m just done with a episode three quarters of the way through and just want to skip but have no option to.
That’s all for now. It’s pretty disappointing how often people make their remarks yet developers haven’t fixed them. I’m rooting for you developers!! 😎

title: No promos
review:
Unfortunately, if you’ve already started a subscription with the App Store, if HBO offers an enticing promo later on, you won’t be able to take advantage of it and will need to pay full price. 

Right now, HBO Max is running a 40% off promo for both new and returning subscribers. But only on their website. When signing into the website to select the promotion rate on my account, it indicates that my subscription is managed by Apple and thus cannot be modified outside of the iOS app. However, upon accessing my subscription & expired plan in the iOS app, the plans that are being offered are _only_ the full price plans. 

Such a bait & switch. The app is sub-par at best and 4K content is still very few & far between, so it’s difficult to justify such a high subscription rate without the promo sale. Really disappointing

title: Please FIX
review:
I’m writing this review in hopes the developers will fix this app!  As far as a streaming service goes, it’s top notch!  Content is awesome.  But this app, just ruins it and leaves a bad overall impression.  

The app crashes all the time, not just my phone but my iPad too.  On my iPad mini, it won’t even stream, just spins and spins.  Netflix works just fine though.  If you try and download an app to your device, 1 out of 3 times it will crash the app.  And it’s also very slow as well.  Every time there is an update i hope this will fix the issues but no such luck.

It’s a shame because this is truly an awesome streaming service but the user experience, aka this app, just is plain horrible and you would expect better from a company such as this.

title: So buggy
review: The content is good but the app is ridiculously buggy. My top two pet peeves are that 1. The next episode will never play automatically on my iPad. I have this mirrored on my Apple TV and I have to open the iPad for the next episode to play each time. Would be great if it did so automatically, and even better with a timed option, so that I can fall asleep to my favorite shows. 2. It stops working between almost every single episodes!!! It will tell me that my connection isn’t working (even though it works fine for Netflix and everything else) and I have to restart the app 20+ times and eventually it will work again. For a premium app, these glitches really impact the user experience and are unacceptable. At some point I’d rather just watch a streaming service that actually works

title: Fantastic streaming, terrible offline access
review:
The Good: HBO Good shows Good diverse genres Worth the money The Bad: Hopefully a developer reads this. Firstly, Accessing the app offline is terrible. Instead of detecting my phone is in airplane mode and going straight into offline mode, it’ll get stuck trying to connect to the internet and just won’t pull up. I tried everything from restarting airplane mode to restarting my phone but the app wouldn’t stop loading. Very frustrating on a long flight. In addition to that, it is incredibly slow to download on good WiFi (500mbps+) and sometimes gets stuck loading the data. TLDR: Great for streaming. But this app not being able to function offline is a huge hinderance.

Update: downloading is still an awful experience.

title: Very buggy on iPad
review:
Every time i click on a movie/show or watch on my iPad it takes a very long time to load. When it does load it would skip the whole movie/show straight forward to the credits. Then you have to hurry up and click the pause button and rewind it to the beginning of the movie/show.  
It is very annoying especially when you can’t pause it in time and you have to click on it again and have to deal with the same process. Now I don’t have to do that on my iPhone, it works perfect, but with my iPad that’s where the problem occurs. It wouldn’t be a problem but for me it really is because i watch all of my shows on my iPad, no app does it other than this one. Would be a top tier app if fixed

title: Favorite streaming app
review:
I’m not sure if the bad reviews are trolling or their phone just has slow performance lol. But this is the best streaming service in my honest opinion. So much nostalgia, classics and great content. I do wish you guys would speed up the process with DC and fantasy genre MAX originals. As well as giving Zack freedom! Whether it’s DC or other content! He’s great for bringing more fans together, and can draw more subscribers to the already fast growing platform.
Edited: can you guys add an anime category, it would be so thoughtful and helpful, rather than have us have to scroll a lot to find some lol.

title: Forgot that I can’t get my downloaded content on the plane
review: Like many others I gave this a 2 star rating due to the extensive library. Otherwise would've given 1 star (or 0 if I could). I downloaded a ton of episodes for my cross country flight last year and was never able to watch them on the plane. I checked out reviews once I landed and learned that many people were having the same problem. I guess I assumed they fixed it because I just repeated my mistake last week. Uggh. I thought maybe it was just slow so I waited 10 full minutes and still nothing. After a long and boring flight, I tried watching downloaded content in airplane mode at home. No problems whatsoever. Why can I not get it to play in the air??

If interested, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support.', 'modified': '2022-01-02T05:11:34Z'}
title: Download feature is a pure joke
review:
I downloaded a few titles for international air travel. The app takes forever to launch in airplane mode. Finally after about 30 sec of waiting you are shown with downloaded titles which you cannot playback. Total shame. I thought that after restoring Internet access while in Europe I could watch my downloads but it even got worse. I switched by mistake to my kid’s profile and I cannot undo it b/c user switching menu is gone while not in the HBO service area :))) Hire better QE engineering team!!!

Update after developer response:
I am still abroad and the URL to the help site you sent me redirects me instantly to a landing page saying that HBO Max service is not available in my area. As much as I appreciate your help I am sorry to say that not only app’s UX is busted but so is the online help.

title: Great content, awful app
review:
Anyone who knows HBO understand the first part of the title for this review. However, what you may not know is how bad this app is. I’ll pose my issues as questions so maybe they are easier for the developers to understand. Why can’t I go to a main page of a show from the episode page? You have to go back and search for the show to get to all of the episodes. Why does the app crash 90% of the time when trying to download content for offline viewing? Sometimes even when it ways it’s downloaded it won’t play as well. 

I really hope there is a fix for these issues. Literally all other apps in the same area do a way better job. Way better. I’m a huge fan of HBO but this app is horrible

title: Surprised
review:
First of all, the content is top notch. Best original work of any network/streaming company, hands down. Everyone seems to agree with that. 

I’m just surprised reading all the reviews about the quality of the app. I’ve been using the app for years and have never experienced the kind of glitching users are experiencing. Definitely no more issues than any other app, which is fairly uncommon. I do have gig internet speed which is fairly reliable, so maybe that plays a part. Overall I’d say the design and functionality of the app has been great.

title: Nice app, few complaints.
review:
Even if I do love this app, I have some small complaints. I’m overall not a fan of the fact that I pause on my show, than it switches the episode I’m on. It’s also kinda buggy sometimes when I leave what I’m watching, or go back to my show. It puts me on a loading screen. Also, if I leave the app and do something else as I watch, my episode ends and the next one wont play, it’s not that bad. It’s not to big of a deal.

I really love this app and just ask that, you never remove friends from it. Or pitch perfect. I got the app just for friends, and I realized I really needed it. Thank you for your consideration.

title: Really???
review:
HBO has some of the best content ever. Better than any other channel, streaming service television channel. Why is there app so terrible? Even the network television apps are better than this app. And it’s too bad because I like so many of the shows and films that are featured on HBO but it is such a pain to watch them using this app. Get a grip HBO!

The interface is really bad. When you return to the app it automatically put you into The last show you were watching. But it doesn’t give you the option of seeing what episodes so often plays the episode you just watched. And to get to the episode you have to backtrack out sometimes you have to go and search for your show just to get into the episodes very irritating.

title: Glitch after glitch
review: This app doesn’t work. Plain and simple. All the glitches make it impossible to watch anything. I’ve tried watching on my phone, tablet, tv, nothing works. The roku it just reloads to the Home Screen whenever you try to play something. The phone or tablet, it just keeps making you sign in over and over whenever you try to play something and won’t play the show. I was able to watch one episode of something and then when the second episode went to load it just went to the log in screen over and over again. And yes all my devices and servers are up to date. I’ve tried all the troubleshooting suggestions on hbos website and online. It’s been a constant problem since I got the streaming services months ago. HBO needs a new tech team….

title: Good App but Fix Downloads
review: I like the HBOMAX App.  The content is great but the app doesn’t work well with downloads.  I travel a lot and like to download movies/shows, etc.  In order to watch the downloads, you have to have the wireless and cellular on, most times you can’t do that in flight so that’s not an option.  When I try to put my iPad in airplane mode and watch the downloads, the download stops playing and the app says no wifi/cellular connectivity.  Well, I thought that was the whole point of downloading —watch shows without the need to have connectivity, when there is no connectivity available.  If this could be fixed then the HBOMAX would be so much better.

title: Why do I have to use the app?
review: I miss using the old HBO On Demand. Ever since the transition to the app, I’ve been annoyed. It takes forever for anything to load. Fast forward and rewind are impossible. Not exaggerating when I say that. They are really impossible. Im currently staring at a black tv screen because (I forgot how glitchy the rewind is and I made the mistake of hitting that button) I got sick of waiting for the app to rewind my show. So I exited out of everything and now my regular cable won’t even work. Why did we go from a fully functional service to a mandated app? I should have the option. I will say that once a movie is loaded (and as long as you don’t want to rewind or fast forward) it works. Let me have my old On Demand back please!!

title: Want to download to stream when you’re traveling? Thing again.
review: This app is literally the worst streaming service app that I have used in my ENTIRE life. It’s literally still worse than streaming service apps from 5-10 years ago. The download feature is an absolute joke. Why does the app need to authenticate my account when I have no WIFI or cell service? That literally makes no sense and makes the app absolutely unusable and blocks you from accessing your downloads. Time and time again I give it a shot hoping that they actually solve the issue and the other bugs that plague the app, and I literally get disappointed and let down every single time. If this is made by such a big company, then why does it seem like the app was developed by an inexperienced child? What a joke.

title: worst app I’ve ever had
review:
this app is completely inaccessible. It is hard to download anything. I have to try multiple times and then it kicks me out of the app or takes hours to download one single episode. even if you finally do get something downloaded the app will not let you watch it. anytime I go to watch any of my downloads it kicks me out of the app every single time. this app can’t do what it was supposedly designed to do. 

those are definitely the biggest and most important issues but everything about the app is confusing and not at all user friendly. worst worst worst app I’ve ever had, not worth the hassle and I will probably be ending my subscription to HBO max. you’d think with the billions of dollars from our pockets they could at least give us a decent app.

title: Download Feature Still Buggy
review: Love HBOs content and the app seems to work for the most part, but the download features do not work. Many articles demonstrate other users frustration in trying to access their downloads and I have no idea why this hasn't been fixed. If you download content it should be accessible at any time without the app trying to use wi-fi or cellular, why would I get a cellular warning if I’m clicking on my downloaded content? More than a few times I’ll click on my downloads and immediately get an error. This is not a timeout issue or a problem with having too many downloads, there is a legitimate problem and it needs to be fixed…preferably before my next flight!

title: Animation is not nothing
review: HBO max is canceling underrated shows that deserved to be there even when they had already ended. Cartoon Network is getting kicked under the bucket because of discovery plus. The removed shows are some of my favorites and they just decided to throw them away into existance. Mao Mao pure hearts is a samurai cat with his friends to save everyone from the weirdest adventures. Victor and Valentino are 2 brothers who get into undead or bizarre situations. Ok KO is a story driven masterpiece about a kid wanting to be the best hero of a plaza, and summer camp island is 2 kids exploring a magical island. Why do you just kick these wonderful animations away? You didn’t even give a weeks notice to finish what we were watching. YOU DIDNT EVEN LET CREATORS FINISH SUMMER CAMP ISLAND. Let’s all just cancel our subscriptions until they bring the beloved back.

title: REALLY needs aspect ratio update for MAC
review:
I want to love it, I do. I have been enjoying HBO max on most of my devices these days and even though those have some issues too, its good enough to enjoy regularly. However, this MAC version has the most annoying forced apect ratio ever! It runs well enough for me but I almost never use this app becuase of how small the screen gets. A lof of movies use black bars to begin with, and when you add on the forced tiny aspect ratio it gets worse.

This is literally so annoying and has been here so long that it ruins the app. 1 star for that and another star because it works.

FIX IT! I feel like this is, probably, such an easy fix and it should be a priority too. How is this still going on?

title: Absolute JUNK
review:
This is the number one worst performing entertainment app. HBO has achieved perfection when it comes to consistent crashing of the app on all devices. They have done a fine job in making sure a streaming show will not stream without randomly freezing. To top it off they have ensured their login process is cumbersome and frustrating. I can only guess HBO owns several apps in the meditation space (Calm, Headspace, etc.) and are intentionally driving their customers to these apps to find the serenity they need after using this piece of junk. 

Seriously hasn’t HBO made enough money from GOT, succession and other shows to hire someone from Netflix or Prime. There is no shame in admitting you built a poor performing app and then go hire people with experience to build an app which is useful.

title: Laggy, slow, horrible super wide screen.
review:
I try to fast forward or skip any part of show or movie and it lags horribly and freezes. Please fully test updates before putting them out!! Please get rid of the super wide, wide screen. Started playing the movie, those who wish me dead, and once again huge black bars top and bottom. When all we get is a sliver of our screen to watch a movie it is seriously annoying!! Movie producers need to permanently get rid of this horrid format!!! If HBO has no way to adjust that then please give us a zoom function. Check out Netflix as there way to adjust zoom is perfect. 
  Update. Just like so many others, app just crashes every time when trying to open. Will have to cancel soon if not fixed very soon

title: Becoming my favorite
review: This app had a ROUGH start. Rough as in, I was wondering why HBO would sully their great name with such trash, rough! Through updates and time, the glitches have gone, the freezes and restarts have gone, I’m no longer kicked out, I can easily watch it on my TV with no problem and NOW that I can finally stream on my phone WITHOUT WI-FI literally everything I wanted from this app is a reality. Nobody has better content than HBO Max. Period. So not being able to watch it while I was away from home and/or wifi was a bummer. I have no complaints.

title: Mobile app crashes to the point on being unusable
review:
The main bug I am experiencing has to do with the app crashing. It will occasionally crash randomly but it crashes every single time I attempt to watch a downloaded title. Regardless of whether I access the downloaded title from the downloads section or by watching the episode before it and letting it auto play the downloaded episode. It does this regardless of my cell or internet connection. 

A milder bug has to do with the subtitles being finicky and occasionally not showing up. Usually they work but sometimes they will not not show even as I toggle them on and off.

title: Great content. Brutal app.
review: I have been meaning to review this app for quite some time. As I sit here waiting for the app to load on Apple TV I have the perfect opportunity! Of course the HBO max content is probably the best of all the major streamers but the app, at least on Apple devices, is as bad as it gets. The service is a couple years old now and I assumed the bugs would get worked out but I don’t think that is happening any time soon. It takes several minutes to load, and when switching profiles it sometimes takes too long to bother waiting. The download feature is also hit or miss (mostly miss.) It really shouldn’t be that hard for such a large company to provide a decent way to view their content. Hopefully HBO gets their act together soon.

title: HBO max has great content but the app is really buggy
review:
First, The app has some really great movies from tones of different genres. 
Secondly, time for the bad stuff the when watching movies and shows the forward and rewind buttons are terrible their is no press and hold and rewind faster. Plus it will take the app so long to load back up the movie if you do rewind. Now, when changing between genres on the Home Screen it takes way to long to load makes the app feel very old, outdated almost. When I downloaded movies for a plane trip it ended up giving me an error every time I tried to watch them. Like what’s the point of downloading when the app would not let me watch then with out network.

title: Worst App I’ve Ever Used
review:
HBO max has a great selection of movies and shows. But that’s the only nice thing I can say. Even if the app loads, which it often doesn’t, it’s about a 50/50 chance the video will actually play. I tried searching for the show Smiling Friends and it just gave me a blank screen with the search bar. 

It’s not any better on any other platform, by the way. Pretty much the only place it’s tolerable to use HBO max is on a computer. Even then it’s a terrible experience. I just wanted to watch tv on my PS4 and it would give me an “Error” message overlaid on screen, and even when the video was working properly(IE no error), the error message would not go away. Minimize the app? Nope, it’s still there. Close and restart? Nope. Still there. 

Do you want to rewind a few seconds for a joke you maybe missed? Good luck, because rewinding causes the app to short-circuit and outright stop working. 

I mean it when I say HBO max is the worst paid service I’ve used ever in my entire life. Sure, there’s a lot of good stuff available to watch, but most of the time I’m not even able to watch that stuff because the app refuses to function.

title: Downloads don’t work
review:
Tried to download some movies for a plane and everything looked good. When I tried to play, the app crashed, so all my 13h of plane were ruined. The second time I tried to download 3 GOT episodes and the first one didn’t get downloaded. Instead, I got a behind the scenes video… another ruined trip.

Also, when you send the series you are watching to tv and you let it play a second episode, it doesn’t get saved in the app. The next time you want to open it and skip an episode, you can’t do it from the home page cause it just lets you plan the one it thinks is next. In order to choose a different episode you have to look for the series in the browser and do it from there… Horrible user experience.

developerResponse: {'id': 29350746, 'body': 'Hey Nick! We want to make sure downloads work great for you. See this article for some common tips and tricks: http://itsh.bo/max-downloads. If you have any additional questions, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you. Thank you. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-04-23T21:39:28Z'}
title: Content is good downloads are bad
review: This would be a 4 star for me, but for one major issue for me.  Downloading shows to watch while traveling.  This has got to be the worse app to try and download shows to watch while traveling. Multiple times I have tried to download shows/ movies to watch and I have gotten an error where it’s says I have reached my limit on all devices for downloading.  The problem is I only have downloads on one device, they say you get 30 I get 7 and this message shows up.  I have removed the app multiple times and I still get this message.  Needless to say I will be canceling my subscription, we travel too much to not be able to download shows to watch.

title: It’s hard to believe how bad this app can be.
review: First, I’m actually really happy with HBOMax and have always thought it has had great content. The review isn’t for the service but for an app that is hard to believe something can be so poorly run and so unstable in the modern era. Both the iPad and Mac versions crash more often than not, the layout to even log in is pathetically bad, and as often as not I can’t even watch a downloaded show or movie because the app will simply crash or not start up. And let’s not forget that the Mac and iPad version both somehow lack full screen support and when I do get something to play I am afraid to touch it because it will more than likely crash anyway.

developerResponse: {'id': 27860010, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username simmyap where it asks for your Web Handle.', 'modified': '2022-02-05T06:32:51Z'}
title: I hate this app
review: I have never written a review in my life because i have never liked or disliked an app enough to be bothered to write one. This app changed everything because i HATE IT. The interface is counter intuitive and using it is annoying. It constantly crashes on me and cuts out of the internet even when other streaming apps will be completely fine. But the worst, WORST thing about this app is how garbage it handles being cast to a tv. When i’m using my chrome cast this stupid app is constantly disconnecting and buffering and crashing. Even when it’s running perfectly, it doesn’t save your progress in a show or movie, so when it disconnects you have to manually figure out where you left off. I wish I could burn this app in a dumpster fire.

developerResponse: {'id': 30730278, 'body': "Hi there, thanks for your review! We'd be happy to help you take advantage of the download feature. We suggest trying this workaround: Download content, don't watch/playback at all, force close the app, turn on airplane mode, then open the app. If you'd like assistance, please contact us on Twitter @HBOMaxHelp. Thanks! - HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-07-05T15:34:07Z'}
title: Too buggy.  Wont play offline
review: I want to love this app.  It seems a service for this price and the HBO name would deliver a product that blows you away.  The selection is great and when I’m connected to wifi or have a perfect signal I love the app.  My problem arises when I download content and try to view it offline.  90% of the time it simply won’t work.  It tells me I’m offline and can’t view it.  I delete the content and download again but it won’t play.  Offline viewing is what I really need because of where I work and have to view movies. I don’t usually have a signal.  I’ve played with the settings and even deleted and reinstalled the app with no success.  HBO, you can do better.

title: Has the studio ghibli movies!!!
review:
I am so happy I got HBO max!!! I got it initially to watch game of thrones, but then I found out it has all the ghibli movies and I’m now never getting rid of HBO, because my nostalgia and serotonin from the movies will be available any time! 

They even have a 30 minute ghibli nature loop that is beautiful scenic views from the movies paired with calming nature sounds. It’s perfect to fall asleep to, to have the the background, or just to watch for calming myself. 

I’m so happy I got this. I didn’t think any streaming service had these!! I’m so pleasantly surprised!

If you have any additional questions, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you.', 'modified': '2022-03-03T07:33:38Z'}
title: So glitchy …
review:
My husband and I like to download some shows to watch while we travel on buses and planes. We recently got HBO so only downloaded shows there for our most recent trip. Bad idea.

Some episodes we downloaded would corrupt before we watched them and wouldn’t play. Then the app just stopped working. It wouldn’t load and if it would it would randomly close especially after pausing. Finally, after it freezing again, I just deleted it and reinstalled. But now it says we can’t download because we’ve reached the limit, but it shows nothing. Yay. 

I am super disappointed and super annoyed. Switching back to using our other streaming services for the rest of our trip.

developerResponse: {'id': 28438952, 'body': "We understand how frustrating this can be and we'd like to look into this issue further with you. To have an advocate reach out to you, please fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username -jut856- where it asks for your Web Handle. Best, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-08T03:50:07Z'}
title: Good selection, but buggy.
review: Only gave 3 stars because the selection is decent but my issue is, if I’m using the app on a smart tv it will start buffering and lagging after a little bit which requires me to hard restart the app. Had this issue on 2 tv’s in the same house and I know for sure it isn’t my wifi because other apps do NOT do it. Also if I’m watching on my Xbox it doesn’t lag or buffer but after a while of continuous streaming I will get a full screen notification saying “cannot play title” and exits out of the app. Hopefully the developers will fix these issues and everyone else's considering it’s $9.99 minimum!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 27862650, 'body': "Hi, thank you for taking the time to rate and review. We strive to provide the best experience possible and we always appreciate feedback. We'll make sure to pass this on to the rest of our team. To share feedback or feature requests please feel free to use our feedback form here: https://help.hbomax.com/feedback", 'modified': '2022-05-27T15:13:33Z'}
title: Good catalog ruined by UX
review: Having an Apple TV latest generation was required to get HBO Max. Bought myself one. Updates after updates, the tvOS version brings as much new features than new issues. Scrolling has lost momentum and it’s now one item at a time. At best. Hitting back randomly takes you back to your Home Screen. The play button doesn’t play a selected item (?!). History is not saved correctly and you have to scroll (and remember) what was the last episode you saw. I don’t know how many people have multiple profiles vs. one profile, but it’s extremely annoying to have to select your single profile each time the app restarts. The overall UX of the app ruins the content.

title: Great content, buggy app.
review:
The amount of content on this app for me is plentiful and I never run out of movies or shows to watch. Also there are many HBO Max originals that I enjoy like Smiling Friends. But the app itself on mobile and apple tv has seem to become more buggy over time. The loading times are longer, sometimes the app randomly crashes. On one occasion an 11 min episode I downloaded was corrupted and when I went to play it only gave me the audio and just a black screen the entire show. 

So keep up the good work with the content but fix the app please.

developerResponse: {'id': 27709572, 'body': "Hi, we're happy to help. We have some troubleshooting steps here that should improve your experience: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. On your TV or connected TV device, please try: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-tv. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-01-28T00:55:18Z'}
title: Great content but…
review: As a streaming service HBO. Has the best content out there. The movies I want to see are available, even older movies. The original series are great and and they stream excellent documentaries. My issue is with the speed and the interface.  Try he app stalls on my tv and on all my devices a lot. I usually have to close and reopen the app to get whatever I am watching to play again and then when I reopen sometimes it starts from the beginning . I have learned to take a note of the timing.  The interface can be a little confusing sometimes. And the search can be a little streamlined to make it more user friendly.

We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username\nR1PC1TY where it asks for your Web Handle.', 'modified': '2022-02-22T06:26:00Z'}
title: App is trash. Nothing will load.
review:
For the last week it has been impossible to play anything at all. This app has always had its issues and lag but at least you could watch shows/movies most of the time. Now, you can’t watch anything. When clicking on a title, it brings up the 3 dots loading screen and just gets stuck. Fix this because otherwise this is a useless 1 star app.

Edit: HBO Max developers, rather than giving me a meaningless, generic robot response, why don’t you actually fix the app? I very clearly stated above what the issue is, there isn’t any other information to report. Again: no title will play on the iPad app. Nothing works. This is not an issue on the TV app, only on iOS. Please fix it. 1 star until it’s fixed.

developerResponse: {'id': 27859950, 'body': "Hi, thank you for taking the time to rate and review. We strive to provide the best experience possible and we always appreciate feedback. We'll make sure to pass this on to the rest of our team. To share feedback or feature requests please feel free to use our feedback form here: https://help.hbomax.com/feedback", 'modified': '2022-02-05T06:21:16Z'}
title: worst user interface
review:
As much as I’d like to use a tone that is befitting the UI and is needed to describe my disappointment in HBO, it simply wouldn’t get published so here goes nothing … 

HBO has got to take the crown when it comes to a well known, well established service to have the worst UI, ever. 15 second skip, really? Was it difficult to program a 5 or 10 second skip/forward? And searching for episodes for a particular show is a nightmare. Like, if I’m watching something and I want to see how many more seasons or episodes are there, you have to sacrifice a part of your brain to unlock that feature. 

The only reason I even watch some of their super limited selection is because it’s free with my internet service. I would never pay for HBO. Never.

developerResponse: {'id': 31261406, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - scammedbyhbo - where it asks for your Web Handle. Thanks, HBO Max Support.', 'modified': '2022-08-03T16:37:21Z'}
title: Scam artist
review: I have no control over when I can unsubscribe or delete my account. HBO customer service says they don’t have access to help me with it either. Why does the company I have an account with not have any access to my account? Because I used an apple phone to download the app? I have been told the only way I can unsubscribe is through apple. But guess what.. apple can’t access my subscription and it no where to be found.? Shouldn’t I have control over this after all it is my money right? After days of calling apple and hbo, customer service, tech support, and every other office . The only option I have found is to report my card stolen which is rediculous it has came to this just to cancel a subscription. This is a scam

developerResponse: {'id': 27840464, 'body': "Hi, we're happy to help. We have some great troubleshooting steps here that should improve your experience: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look. Thank you, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-02-04T04:52:52Z'}
title: Good thing they have good content
review:
If not for the content I would not use this app. Of all the “major” streaming services, HBOMax is by FAR the buggiest. If you navigate through the menus too fast, it freezes. Rewind too many times during the movie, it freezes. If there is a big premiere that night, you guessed it… FREEZE!! 

I gave it 2-stars because it did get me through most of the pandemic. They do have some great content and they had one of the better business models, with the same-day movie releases. But now that they will be moving away from that business model soon, who knows… But one things for certain; There are plenty of streaming services that are less frustrating than HBOMax.

developerResponse: {'id': 31304663, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review and share your thoughts. We would like to learn more about your experience. Please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you. Thanks. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-08-05T18:21:48Z'}
title: HBO Max App
review: So far this app was great to view things on my iPhone with movies and tv shows a lot to choose from but I have updated the app recently and before updating it there is a black screen issue. I tried uninstalling it and reinstalling it and nothing is working. It asks to connect to Bluetooth and then there is nothing but a black screen. I am using an iPhone 13 pro max and there is no excuse for this…please fix this HBO max. I only use this because it was free with my AT&T bill. I don’t see what could have happened on my end since it’s entirely free. Sorry for the poor review but there shouldn’t be stuff like that happening.

title: Do you even sort, bro?
review:
Have you ever wanted to sort a list of hundreds of items? Yeah? Me, too. Apparently the people at HBO have never thought it was necessarily. All I want to do is look at documentaries sorted by release date. Period. Not hard to implement, but this app has no sorting. Lame.

Also strange is that downloads straight up tank the app. It can’t give priority to data coming in for browsing for movies. I’m planning a trip, downloading a movie and browsing while downloading is impossible. It also attempts to download everything at the same time rather than in a queue. Add 7 items to the list and with a slow enough connection nothing downloads completely before you unwittingly wank away from wifi and have no complete downloads.

title: HBO, it is you not me
review: As an avid lover of HBO, this hurts me. This is the breakup I never wanted to have. There will always be a part of me who loves it, but this needs to be said. You have taken advantage of me too many times. You took too many shows off your platform, some of my favorites like umbre and beforeigners. But still I stayed. Back when I was a loyal customer, I used HBO go. I was told there was a new great app called HBO max that was better. But for an entire year while I paid for hbo, you removed hbo go and didn’t replace it on my tv for an entire year. I had no way to watch my subscription. But I still stayed. Then, your app never loads on my tv and I can’t even watch your severely reduced catalog. But no more. Today, I won’t stay. It’s not me HBO, it’s you.

title: Great catalog, buggy app
review: I travel frequently and it’s nice to download shows and movies on this app for when I am on a plane or otherwise in a place with no internet connection. However, I always have to have a second app with something else just in case, because this app is buggy and will crash. Crashes while away from an internet connection means that once you reopen the app it will stop working until you can get back online. So if you have an 8 hour flight and 4 movies for your trip, sorry, you better bring a magazine.

developerResponse: {'id': 32257456, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to talk to you directly to help. If interested, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-09-27T13:21:29Z'}
title: Holy man, this app is literally unusable on iOS
review: I literally never write reviews, so trust me when I say this is perhaps the worst app I’ve had the displeasure of using. It is 100% unusable for me. Last week tried using it on my iPhone 11 Pro, open the app, see the HBO logo, 2 seconds later black screen forever. No loading circle or anything. This week, brand new iPhone 14 Pro. SAME EXACT ISSUE. Open the app, instant black screen. How a multi billion dollar company can have a UNUSABLE app is beyond me. I’d rather you just delete the entire app and just let me watch a show in a mobile browser. But no. It just links to their awful app. If you are subbing to HBO to watch only on your phone, you are getting a 10$ black screen along with a 50mb useless app. DO NOT BUY.

title: Skip this one
review: Downloaded 6 hours worth of movies for my 7 hour flight. An hour and a half into my flight and halfway into my first movie the screen freezes. I try swiping out of the app and resetting my phone several times and then it no longer would allow me to get into the app. Then for a split second when it did finally let me in, I see all my movies I had downloaded were deleted and I again, can’t tap the edit button or get the app to function in anyway possible. I then spent the next 5 and a half hours of my flight scrolling through my photos, trying to sleep, briefly sleeping, and being bored out of my mind when I couldn’t sleep. Don’t waste your time on this app. Cancelling my HBO subscription.

developerResponse: {'id': 28536585, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - jamezilla - where it asks for your Web Handle. Thank you. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-03-13T01:56:46Z'}
title: Buggy buggy buggy
review:
After a terrible launch, at least they finally fixed the ability to fast forward/rewind/scrub (which used to completely cripple my tablet). 

These days I’m plagued by an issue where the “play next episode” feature just skips through each episode and marks it as watched. I have grab the play head control while the video is loading and move it to somewhere in the middle of the video and wait for it to start playing, then rewind it to the start - otherwise I can’t get any videos to actually play. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app hoping it might clear some setting in the app, but no luck. Borderline unusable app.

title: The content deserves a better iPad app
review: My HBO Max subscription has provided a pretty good amount of desirable content for the cost of the subscription. I am very disappointed though and the quality of the app itself. The interface flow and streaming capacity are substantially inferior to the Netflix experience. I have to download most episodes. In many parts of my home the bandwidth requirement is beyond the Wi-Fi capacity. I do not have the same problem with the other streaming apps I use. I suspect this technical problem could be improved.  The management of downloaded content is also quite inferior to other streaming apps.

developerResponse: {'id': 31698530, 'body': "Hi, we appreciate you taking the time to rate and leave a detailed comment about what you're experiencing. We'd love the opportunity to turn your experience around, and help find out what's causing the sudden glitches to occur. If you'd like, please fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username where it asks for your Web Handle. Our team will reach out to directly from there. Thanks, HBO Max Support.", 'modified': '2022-08-28T09:41:55Z'}
title: So Glitchy
review: I truly enjoy the HBO content. So many of my favorite movies and shows are on here. But lately I just cannot get it to work. It would take long to load, slow to register a selection and forget attempting to watch a movie. It would play 3 sec, freeze and then crash my TV. I thought it was a network issue but nope then I figured must be an update and nope all updated then I deleted, re added the app and still. Finally it would load after crashing my tv 5 or 6 times. Yeah I’m sorry, I can’t sit through that anymore . The frustration was real. I hope HBO comes up with a solution . For now, I will resort to different streams of entertainment that do not crash my TV.

title: These bugs need fixing!
review: There are tons of good shows and movies to choose from and the layout of the app makes it easy to use. BUT this glitching bug seriously needs fixing. When you’re downloading the app they claim that they’re constantly fixing bugs. I don’t think they’re focusing on the right ones. The app constantly starts loading when you’re in the middle of watching a show/ movie. You can’t even pause it, nothing registers it just keeps lagging. It’s really frustrating. And even when I eventually try to click home on my TV it won’t let me. Or turn it off. It just stays loading then plays, loading then plays… really annoying.

developerResponse: {'id': 31494416, 'body': "Hi there, thanks for letting us know you've run into this parental control hiccup. We'd be happy to have our team take a closer look at this with you. Please contact us on Twitter @HBOMaxHelp, and we'll provide further assistance. - HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-08-16T16:37:02Z'}
title: App is buggy and blocks content
review:
We had the full subscription and I download shows to watch when I go to my remote worksite with no Internet. The app started blocking anything deemed adult (the wire, sopranos) and said it was due to a parental controls setting. Buggy!!! 

Only had one account and no kids. There isn’t a way to adjust parental controls on yourself when you are the master account- everything is wide open. So I created another adult profile. Same issue. Created a kid profile. Adjusted the parental controls and gave the kid profile max content settings. Same issue. The wire and sopranos still blocked. 

Really frustrating as I spent a lot of time downloading shows and then it doesn’t work. Cancelled my subscription and DELETED the app…

title: The interface is great but I want a option for the resolution in settings
review: I love hbo max but it doesn’t allow me to choose on want resolution I want because sometimes it defaults into 480p because it didn’t let me decide if I wanted my resolution on high but instead bases on my internet speed but even if I have high internet speed it still went into 480p I wish you can offer my a button where I want my streaming quality higher and I know it’s possible because you have it In download’s thanks for listening and please make this possible

title: HBO Max app trying to login I’m stuck on Download screen
review:
The issue has been fixed! 

HBO Max app trying to login I’m stuck on Download screen. My HBO Max Subscription is billed through Verizon (FiOS), I tried deleting the app on all my iPads, now when I sign in via my Verizon provider account -> every time I try to open the HBO Max on all my iPads only -> it goes straight to download mode but, not on my iPhone. Error: You’re offline. Check Connection Completely useless to use on all my iPad(s) but works only on my iPhone. Please fix!
