If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-05-07T14:55:46Z'}
title: Great content, TERRIBLE app
review:
Like the rest of the reviews suggest. The content is great, the shows are top notch. But the app is a bismal. It is nearly impossible to download shows and movies to your devices as the app will crash with every attempt. When you finally can get it to work it takes 5-10 minutes per episode, when in comparison to other streaming services you can download entire seasons in half that time. The app through our cable box is only mildly better.

I hope HBO fixes this issue soon because it seems like a consistent complaint for everyone and they may lose a lot of their costumers who don’t feel like putting up with it anymore.

developerResponse: {'id': 28457743, 'body': "Hi there, we'd be more than happy to help! We have some great troubleshooting steps here that should improve your experience: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. You also may want to try restarting your network (modem and router) if you haven't yet. If those steps don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional, more detailed support to resolve this for you. Thanks! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-09T08:21:23Z'}
title: Unimpressed
review: I have a 2015 Samsung smart tv, don’t know if it’s the tv or what, but I have a hard time getting many of the old cartoons to play continuously. It either states in the foreground error but the show plays in the background or it just freezes. I even came across this problems when watching movies like Free Guy or Hitman's bodyguard wife. Well, it was good while it lasted, going back to something else that never gave me problems. Samsung tv is NOT a mobile devise. I’ve uninstalled and reinstalled the app on my tv and nothing. NO improvement. Why is other companies don’t have as much problems as hbomax? I can understand if there is inclement weather, but I have high speed fiber.  See ya!

title: Horrible User Experience
review:
The user interface is terrible. The self absorbed designers’  love for flat design is obnoxious. Navigation is not intuitive and you end up pushing on random things because you never know if it’s clickable. 

It’s also overly engineered for the sake of sending useless analytics back to HBO to keep an over abundance of people employed, in the hopes of gleaning a tiny bit of insight into our habits.  The result are that certain things randomly may or may not happen depending on the temperament of the internet or HBO’s servers.  One movie will play consistently over Airplay, another will work one out of twenty times.

This app, like many others, would be more reliable and better if the developer developed for their users instead of themselves.

developerResponse: {'id': 27862844, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username\nVirginiaBee where it asks for your Web Handle.', 'modified': '2022-02-05T11:48:43Z'}
title: Constant glitches not remedied by restart
review:
I’m stunned that HBO has such a terrible app in light of the budgets they have for streaming shows. The app constantly freezes up and nothing (changing wifi channels, force quits, restarting your device) remedied the situation. In the four days I’ve had the app, I have been able to watch ONE episode of one show. I’ve had all of the streaming services at one time or another. This is the worst. It’s even worse than PBS, which is really saying something.

The reviews here make it clear that the issues are universal. Someone “support” person posts a link to the same help page on every review left by a disappointed subscriber. I wish HBO would just fix the app and save that poor person the time.

developerResponse: {'id': 29305442, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to talk to you directly to help make sure downloads are working properly. If interested, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support.', 'modified': '2022-04-21T10:25:07Z'}
title: HBO MAX IPad App Offline Playback
review:
I have HBO Max on my Apple TV, works great and 5 stars.  I also travel and have started downloading shows to watch on the plane.  It is hit or miss that I can play videos I have downloaded.  Sometime it works, but most times not.

Seems that it wants to connect to the internet which being on a plan is not m really a good option.  Believe the app should know that I was a valid user when I downloaded it and not try to connect to the internet just to play downloaded content.  Tried Wi-Fi disabled, Wi-Fi connected to airplane network all with no luck.

Would be nice if it was consistent and just worked.

developerResponse: {'id': 29201732, 'body': 'Hi! We want to make sure downloads work great for you. See this article for some common tips and tricks: http://itsh.bo/max-downloads. If you have any additional questions, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you. Thank you. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-04-16T04:23:26Z'}
title: Great content, frustrating app
review:
HBO continues to have quality, highly watchable content. Sadly, this is delivered in an app with long load times, a buggy interface and most frustrating of all, a constant need to be connected to the internet.

This means that you can only watch your downloaded content if the app has a network connection. I’ve spent a good portion of several flights watching the app attempt to connect to the internet, notify me that it’s not connected to the internet and then enter the endless load cycle. Too bad.

HBO: hire the developers that make your competitors’ apps. I watch their content instead of yours; not because I want to, but because I’m able to.

developerResponse: {'id': 27815166, 'body': 'Good news! You can now use the Pinch-to-Zoom gesture to make shows and movies fill the screen on your iOS device. Download the latest HBO Max update and let us know if you have any questions.', 'modified': '2022-02-03T05:19:53Z'}
title: Great Content. Trash Viewing Experience.
review:
Update: Issue has been resolved!

I don’t understand how something as simple as adding double tap to fill the screen is not present here. You should be using apple’s built in video player if you can’t figure this out with your own custom one. Every other video streaming service has the option to fill your screen. Ultra wide aspect ratio movie…. Black bars on both sides and around. No excuse for that. This service is way too expensive for such a basic missing feature. Add that one feature and I’m happy.

title: Great if it works
review: The library has evolved and grown dramatically which was to be expected . As far as content it’s growing and getting better every step, my issue is it doesn’t matter how much great content you have if it doesn’t work. Constant freezing and if you pause for more then a minute you have to exit app and start all over . That and of all the other services I have the loading time and amount of time buffering is unbelievably ridiculous. Great content that’s a pain to watch makes it not worth watching which is why I still watch Netflix and Prime more . If you iron out these issues and make watching enjoyable instead of a chore I might actually enjoy the experience your TRYING to provide

title: Terrible playback!
review:
Great shows and movies offered on this app. When it comes to that, it is one of my favorites. The playback issues are beyond frustrating. I constantly get the playback failed message or just the dots across the screen like it is trying to load. I just don’t understand this because it is one of the best content wise. And they must have so many subscribers. It is as if this is bad on purpose or they are not doing anything to fix the issues because so many people say the same thing and have for awhile now. 
Just fix it already. Like how hard can it be nowadays.

developerResponse: {'id': 28673137, 'body': "Hi, thank you for taking the time to rate and review. We strive to provide the best experience possible and we always appreciate feedback. We'll make sure to pass this on to the rest of our team. To share feedback or feature requests please feel free to use our feedback form here: https://help.hbomax.com/feedback", 'modified': '2022-03-20T11:47:46Z'}
title: Love the platform but..
review: First, I will say that I enjoy having the HBO max as a streaming platform. There is a lot of content! My biggest problem is the size of the subtitles! HBO please please please do something about that! I like to have the volume low so I don’t disturb my husband as he sleeps, but for some reason HBO max volume is so different compared to other streaming platforms, that it’s far too low. I would typically rely on the subtitles, however they are so tiny you can barely see them. And you can’t edit it! I’ve looked online for “help” and while there are instructions, there is no option to change the size.

title: This is specifically Apple TV and Samsung tv Apps.
review: The content and price are excellent. However the app has lots of bugs. The audio will be fine for the pre show plugs and recap, but once the actual show starts…silence. I can get to work most of the time by toggle through audio sources.  But even that doesn’t work sometimes. It isn’t the receiver either as this is the only source that does that. Not live over the air antenna, not any other apps built downloaded directly to the tv or Apple TV. It didn’t used to be like this. It used to work flawlessly. I want to want your shows, but this bug makes it really frustrating. Please fix it as soon as possible.

title: Crashes all the time
review: Since the inception of HBO max the app was never that great but it worked. The recent update for the Apple TV is beyond worthless. There is no error handling and at the dip of bandwidth it just reboots. Also those stupid dots just hang the whole thing. I’m embarrassed for the engineers who built this, I can’t imagine a single person involved in development authorized it’s release. If I was paying for it I would demand a refund. In the two weeks since the release of the current version I haven’t been able to watch more than 20 minutes uninterrupted but every other streaming app has worked just fine. Just worthless, save your money.

title: Amazing…but in a terrible way
review: Worst mobile streaming app. I can’t believe a billion dollar media company consistently has the worst app on every device. -Downloads error out after a few days and must be re-downloaded. -After deleting downloads they still take up space in the phone storage. -Unfortunately, it often logs me out every couple of weeks. This isn’t usually a huge hassle but the latest bug is I can’t sign in again via my tv provider—it keeps giving an invalid request error message when I try to sign into my provider. So now the app is useless. I’ve tried restarting my device, deleting and reinstalling my app, updating my iOS, changing the default browser, and more. One star.

Please feel free to reach out to us here: https://help.hbomax.com/feedback to leave app feature requests. Thanks, HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-03-02T05:15:02Z'}
title: Please add Automatic Shut Off Feature-The episodes keep on playing, even after 5 hours!!!
review:
This app doesn’t have a stop auto play function. It’s extremely annoying as when I’m watching tv at night and fall asleep, it just keeps on playing. Not only does this make me lose place of what episode I was on, but this drains the battery on my device. I now have to set a time limit on “Screen Time” just to get it to shut off the app at night.

You should take a leaf from Netflix’s book, and add some kind of an “Are You Still There?” function to check if the person watching is still active after a certain number of hours.

title: OK content, awful APP
review: The content within the APP is ok, I mainly got this for 1 show and I’m not really seeing a reason keeping it when the show I want to see is currently off season. The APP is terrible, I can’t watch anything that I’ve downloaded. I’ve tried many different ways to fix the problem but nothing works. I’ve updated everything, made sure I was signed in and did a hard restart of my device. This is the only APP on my device with this problem. If I’m watching a show that I’ve downloaded and turn off the WI-FI mid show it will keep playing but if I stop it and go back to my downloads nothing will play while the WI-FI is off. I travel a lot and if this APP doesn’t work when I need it to what’s the point?

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so that we can take a closer look with you. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-08-20T04:40:01Z'}
title: Terrible when offline
review: This app has great quality content that I would love to watch when I travel. However, the OFFLINE downloads sometimes require internet connection to access, sometimes when I try to load a video the app just crashes, and when I set movies to download the night before a journey I wake up to all of them saying “failed to download”. I really want to watch the movies and shows that the HBO Max app has to offer, but it just won’t let me. I am constantly fighting with this app just to use the basic features. When I’m on WiFi, the app works fine, but when I travel it’s just a buggy mess. Please fix these issues!!!

If you're interested in having an Advocate reach out to you directly, please fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - Tholov - where it asks for your Web Handle. We look forward to finding a solution for you. Thank you! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-04-22T15:42:17Z'}
title: Stops playing!
review:
I downloaded this app to watch The Flight Attendant. Watched one episode on demand,  got hooked, but then had to buy the app to continue watching. 

Started watching the second episode from the app on my iPhone. I airplayed it to my TV to watch with my hubby. Half way through the second episode the sound went out. So I exited and restarted the episode multiple times on multiple days.  Although it would sometimes play on the phone it would not airplay. 

Gave up on that show. Started Mare of Eastown. Worked great. Weird maybe there was something wrong with the other show. Nope after 2 perfect episodes airplayed to my TV, episode 3 lost sound and would never play again!! 

Ended up purchasing the series on another service so we could watch! Now I’m paying for an app that works just long enough to get me hooked on a series. Then I have to spend more elsewhere to watch.  Maybe it would work just fine from the phone without airplay but my husband and I aren’t going to huddle over a phone to watch a show. 

I also tried and iPad and my Mac. Same issues.

title: Content good, app bad
review:
I am overall pleased with HBO's content relative to other streaming services. And it has similar pricing so I guess that is fine.

But the app is lacking. Volume is outright broken (always too quiet, way quieter at max compared to every other sound in iOS). There is no family sharing of the subscription; it already limits simultaneous streaming so why also make it impossible to use on family members' devices? Can't tell who you're logged in as without clicking the change icon. And search is by title text; I wish it had more advanced options because it's very hard to find content that isn't the popular in-your-face stuff.

title: HBO is TRASH
review:
This app is garbage. HBO, you can delete my reviews but it won’t stop me. This trash messes up every time they update the app. The app stops working when watching any tv series. It is supposed to keep playing from season one to season ten if you choose but every time they do an update it is weeks of the app messing up before it is fixed. You contact customer service and they are lost and confused. It’s old and it’s below any standard of HBO. 

My new review is this isn’t your dad’s HBO. The new movies are regularly garbage and something you’d expect from a free app not something you pay a subscription for. I’m guessing this is from the transition from being under new management. Well I guess screwing up CNN wasn’t enough.

We'd like to learn more about what is happening and see what we can do to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username, ajdjfjau oofies, where it asks for your Web Handle. Thanks, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-08-08T03:32:29Z'}
title: PARENTAL CONTROLS BROKEN!!!!!
review: Yesterday, I was watching a series and many movies normally until today. Today I came to see ALL CONTENT WAS LOCKED. Only three days ago I purchased the $10 plan and now the app is already glitching. When ever I try watching anything it says… “CONTENT BLOCKED your profile is blocked from playing this title because of parental control settings. Try choosing a different title.”     Another thing that concerned me is that I am not even logged into a child’s account nor have I made one. I have not messed with any setting to have done this. Next to every movie, show, and series, there is a locked icon. Once again, IT HAS ONLY BEEN THREE DAYS SINCE I’VE PURCHASED THE PLAN. PLEASE FIX THIS ISSUE RIGHT AWAY BECAUSE I DID NOT WASTE 10 DOLLARS ON THIS APP FOR NO REASON, I BEG.

title: What a frustrating joke
review: This app has sucked since day one and continues to impress with the latest update. It’s glitchy, it crashes constantly, it buffers nonstop no matter what your watching or how good your internet is. It doesn’t work right on Xbox, apple, roku, or smart tv. It blows my mind that such a big name would put out such a pathetic app and it seems like it’s just getting worse. It used to be a pain to use but since this last update it’s entirely worthless. It can barley load it’s Home Screen let alone try to witch anything. I have been hopeful that with time they would improve things with time but it feels like marketing seems to be a bigger focus than actually putting out a halfway decent app.

title: Specifically the app on phone
review: So for the most part I’ve liked the app in the few days I’ve had it, but I just can’t seem to get it to stop replaying the same episode. It won’t just keep going through and when I have to wait through adds at my current pay plan as is, it’s just frustrating when I wait through it just to see the episode has restarted. Even when I don’t click a specific episode and just click the title itself, it won’t let me just peacefully watch it through. This is a very annoying feature and makes it hard to enjoy.

title: Great app overall! Only one issue for me
review: I don’t understand all the bad reviews. This app has always worked perfectly for me on all devices. It’s amazing! The only issue I seem to be having since I just upgraded to an iPhone 13 Pro Max is that I can’t zoom the shows/movies to full screen like I could on my iPhone 12 Pro Max. It does zoom, but still has black bars on the sides. I’d like it to zoom completely full screen and go over the notch like it did before. But it’s not the end of the world. Overall this app is top notch!

title: Apple TV app is atrocious
review: HBO Max is maybe the best streaming service going around with the absolute best content and a deep catalogue, but that’s if you can manage to get into the app to begin with. I usually have to try half a dozen times to get into the app without it giving me an error or crashing and sometimes have to reset my Apple TV completely in order for it to work. Some times not even that will work and I end up just giving up and go to watch something else on a different platform. Paying $15 a month for this experience is insulting. The most expensive streaming service going around should not have such an absolutely horrible user experience. I would give the app minus 5 stars if I could.

title: The auto play issue
review: For some reason you can not turn auto play off on phone, tablet, or computer. I tend to watch a lot of HBO on my phone and I fall asleep then when I wake up I have no clue what episode I was on because I am a season ahead cause it just keeps playing until someone presses the pause button. I have no clue why this is a thing and hasn’t been made a feature yet but I hop there is an update in the near future that fixes this issue. Other then that I love the app and it’s great movies and shows to choose from.

developerResponse: {'id': 30381177, 'body': "Hi, we'd like to learn more about your experiences to determine how best we can assist - please contact us here hbom.ax/contact and our team will be glad to look deeper into these problems with you. Thanks for being a part of HBO Max! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-06-15T22:12:46Z'}
title: Love HBO but hate the app
review:
HBO is one of the best streaming services but one of the worst apps. Theres so many issues with the app that would make it such a better experience if they were fixed and I’d spend more time on here. I’m on an iPad Pro but from my experience most of these problems are on all versions. 

1. Video pauses whenever I do anything with my device like bringing down the control center, check a notification, even go to the home screen even though the app supports PiP. The video should keep playing even if I’m doing something with my phone like replying to a text. If I don’t want to miss something in whatever I’m watching I’ll pause it, don’t do it for me. Not sure if it’s intentional but this needs to be changed or even have an option in the settings. 

2. Some American movies will have descriptions in a completely different language, random. 
 
3. Let me pause what im watching with the space bar on my keyboard! Every other streaming app has this very simple feature, please implement it.

developerResponse: {'id': 31751348, 'body': "Hey there, we'd like to take a closer look at this episode cut-off error you described. So we can best assist you, please contact us at our help center: https://help.hbomax.com/us-en/Home/Index, and we'll get to work on a solution ASAP. Thanks! - HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-08-30T18:34:40Z'}
title: Please fix the bugs!!
review: All and all the app has a great selection for people. My problem AGAIN (I thought they fixed this already) is when watching a Tv series it will replay the episode you just watched and it also cuts the show off before the episode is over. I don’t know what happened because for the longest time these issues didn’t happen. I even created a new profile and it still does it so it’s not because I already watched the episodes. I’m just saying for $150 dollars give or take for a year subscription I feel like I’m not getting my moneys worth.

title: Nice Selection. Terrible App.
review:
Yo paying $15 for no ads on an app that constantly crashes or says “check internet connection” is starting to make a person hate this service. Other streaming apps (YT, Prime, Ntflx) are not having this issue. 

This always seems to happen on the shows that I am actually trying to watch, but if I test some other random show on the HBO app it works just fine. !?
Trying to navigate through season/episodes and general selections is a nightmare. Many have already went into specifics in other reviews. 
I don’t have a smart tv or am always able to use my laptop so I rely on watching stuff on my phone via hdmi and unlimited data. I know the companies don’t want us doing that and would rather we buy a big ol smart tv and pay a heafty monthly fee for crappy home internet. I just can’t swing it…A phone bill and subscription is all I can cough up right now and roommates split HBO. 
All we want is to watch Looney Tunes and the Sopranos on our phones. Is that really too much to ask??

title: Streams great on TV
review: I haven’t streamed HBO on anything other than my TV for years now, so I can’t speak to mobile device workability. I remember on my iPad it used to be a 10 for content, and around a 5-6 for app design, interface and performance. That said, the user interface for FireTV is consistently improving IMO, and it seems no clunkier in most ways than other streamers I use. And as to content with MAX and the Warner/Internat’l library - I’ve never been happier with a streaming service in that regard. Room for improvement? Always, but true of all things, non?

title: 30 downloads but I have none?
review: So I’ve had this problem for the last couple weeks of HBO MAX saying in order for me to download more movies I need to delete some that I already have downloaded because of the 30 max download policy. The thing is that I don’t have any downloads at all, I’ve deleted them all just to download one movie and it still says I have 30 downloads. So now at this point I’m paying for a streaming service that I can’t really even use. I’ve looked this problem up and it seems many people are facing the same issue. I don’t know how something as big as HBO hasn’t fixed such a simple problem by now. HBO if you want to keep your customers please fix this. I’m unsubscribing.

title: Downloading content is a joke
review:
Update: Warner media sent me a reply, but unfortunately they just sent a link to the FAQ page on downloads and none of the suggestions work. It is just a bug in their app that they need to fix. Sometime I click on the download symbol and the progress bubble appears but doesn’t show any progress for 30 minutes. (After putting my iPad on never sleep mode.) This week this happened with hotel Wi-Fi (10-13mbps) and with my hotspot (5g 80mbps). 

Of all the streaming services I have, HBO makes downloading content the most difficult. It takes multiple attempts and even then it doesn’t work. Then they expire fairly quickly and trying to redownload is painful.

title: Worst streaming app I’ve ever used. Seriously.
review:
Experience on 13 pro max:  
Wanted to download some shows for your flight? Too ####ing bad, you can’t use without Wi-Fi or cellular. Logs you out constantly. Near impossible to download anything, every download will fail multiple times, and even when they say they succeeded, half the time the app will just crash if you try to play them. The ones that succeed will “expire” within a week or so if you don’t watch them, and if you start an episode but don’t finish it will expire within a day. This is the most frustrating experience I’ve had to date with an iPhone app. 
Good shows, and movies, just make sure you have constant 5g with an unlimited data plan.

title: HBO can do better
review: I’ve been a HBO customer for decades.  As a child and into adulthood.  HBO has always been my choice of premiere tv watching.  BUT this app is terrible. Using apps such as Netflix and Prime, they put HBO underneath the bus.  To download and manage movie/shows on this app feels like years ago when streaming apps were still trying to figure out how this works.  Latest mishap on my part, downloaded a movie and circle 98% complete..but had to sit my iPad down for a second and accidentally hit the home button.  98% to zero..by accidentally presses one button!  You have to be kidding me.  Tempted to just call it quits.  Eager to watch this movie on my 3.5 hr flight and nothing.

If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-02-09T04:20:41Z'}
title: Buggy and won’t replay videos
review:
The service is good and I like the selection but the app is awful. Very buggy. I can’t get movies I’ve watched to play again - it “picks up” where I left off last time - the end of the movie, and just stops and goes back to the movie landing page. 

On tv series the next episode will also start and restart about 4 times, only showing the studio symbol, before it will play. I have the latest iOS and my app is up to date. Sometimes it will skip the next episode entirely, acting as if I had already watched it (I had not previously watched this series)

Please get the app fixed asap as the service is good.

title: Needed improvements
review: For one, currently watching Game of Thrones on the service, and the “Next Episode” option pops on the screen with multiple minutes in the episodes still left before the credits roll; and if I don’t cancel the “next episode” option within a few seconds, it skips to the next episode before the current episode has even finished. This is extremely annoying and I and my family would appreciate this be fixed so we can better enjoy the shows on the service. I hope someone sees this to rectify the problem.

If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - Blink74747474 - where it asks for your Web Handle. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-08-29T21:35:23Z'}
title: Very bad
review: I joined HBO Max and every problem you can possibly think of that a streaming service can have HBO Max has!…trying to stream through their app ,trying to login ,trying to watch on smart tv. First of all unless you have a brand spanking new smart TV you can’t even get the HBO Max app I tried on my three-year-old LG TV and cannot get the app then I read online that you can watch HBO Max through your web browser in your smart TV try that as well and it says my web browser is not supported, and know it wont let me log in even on my iphone because it doesn’t recognize my Internet provider …it’s almost impossible I don’t know how these people put out a platform like this that does not work!

title: The Smoldering Remains of Alexandria
review:
I used to LOVE HBO Max forbits wide variety of shows and movies.  This was by far my favorite streaming service for the past two years, until CEO David Zaslav came in and cratered it. Everything my family and I watch or were going to watch has been removed. Dramas are gone. Family and kids content obliterated. They cancelled the cartoons, including the upcoming Batman and the Bugs Bunny specials. They took down hundreds of episodes of Sesame Street, and what they’ve done with the unreleased Batgirl movie is basically art vandalism.  Why would they expect me to keep paying for this? There’s nothing here!

I cancelled my service.  Call me when you’ve fired Zaslav and undone his abominable decisions, and maybe I’ll come back.

title: Constant crashes or “video fails to play”
review: Content great But this is unacceptable in 2021 from a serious company. Update 2022: This is still the worst app I know by a major company. It hangs, it crashes, it’s often non-intuitive. It’s a ****ing embarrassment. That I’m far from the only one (SONY WAKE UP AND SMELL THE 2.8 AVERAGE REVIEW WHICH IS WAY TOO GENEROUS AS SOME REVIEW ON CONTENT NOT EXECUTION) makes it even more embarrassing. Not only do they stink, but they don’t care. Boycott them. UPDATE LATER IN 2022: This is the most embarrassing thing I’ve ever seen from a major company over this much time. ****ing thing crashes constantly. Mysteriously loses downloads. It’s written by morons for executive cretins. How it “earned” it’s pathetic 2.8 I do not know as it deserves the worst opprobrium one can get for corporate execution.

developerResponse: {'id': 27815145, 'body': 'Good news! You can now use the Pinch-to-Zoom gesture to make shows and movies fill the screen on your iOS device. Download the latest HBO Max update and let us know if you have any questions.', 'modified': '2022-02-03T02:57:23Z'}
title: UPDATED: Zoomed Aspect Ratio restored! 🥳
review:
I intended to edit my old review, but after I changed my star rating from 3 to 5, the text of my review disappeared.

My only real complaint of the old app was they had removed the ability to pinch-zoom in/out, so my giant phone was only able to show a small fraction of some wide aspect-ratio films.

I am VERY happy to see they have restored pinch-to-zoom and I can now watch HBO Max content in glorious full scale!

The content is an INCREDIBLE value, especially with in-theater movies available and an amazing back catalog from high quality media groups and creators. The AppleTV app has been fantastic since it launched, and now the iOS app can match that quality with some specific features tailored to mobile devices.

Bravo, HBO Max iOS devs, and thank you for responding to customer feedback and implementing requested features!

title: Good, but don’t use offline
review: The app is OK when connected to the internet. They should fix the issues with trying to watch downloaded content using the app while offline. If you are planning to download shows or movies to watch while traveling, when no internet connection is available, skip this app and find something else, as it will freeze and if you try and close the app and reopen you will be unable until you have an internet connection. Highly disappointed, as I travel quite a bit and this is the only steaming app that has issues, looks like I will cancel and stick with Netflix.

title: The app is not user friendly
review: Can there please be a way to continue watching the show your on rather then just a specific episode. It doesn’t actually keep track of the episode I’m on so I end up having to find the whole show to select the next episode. Then using airplay is terrible, one minute it’s working and then randomly it stops, some days I can lock my phone or do other things while it’s air playing and then sometimes I have to leave it open and not touch it or it’ll take 10 minutes to get it back up. You can’t fast forward or rewind either cause it just brings it back to where I started it. I avoid using this app it’s not worth the struggle.

title: Quality bad and seems very slow
review: After toying with paying yet another wack of money for another live streaming app I took the plunge . But the quality is not so great almost as if it’s pirated videos and it takes Forever to actually load ! And this is with vsat WiFi . So it’s not our connection . Reading other reviews and comments seems like many users of this app are having the same story . I think you really need to look at your app and spend the time in fixing these ongoing bugs . Whatever you watch it takes forever to open ! It keeps showing error messages and tells me I’m offline ! But I’m not ! I’m able to access other live streaming apps with zero issues

title: Inexcusable Bugs
review: In this day and age it is inexcusable for HBO to have an app that is so bug infested, especially considering how much we pay for service. Downloaded content to watch while offline is hit or miss. I have to babysit downloads because they error out. (There is nothing wrong with our Internet or device.) Once offline some downloaded content simply won't play no matter what I do. Other downloaded content gives a generic error. Some downloaded content keeps showing up in my library no matter how many times I delete it. Other times the app tells me to check my Internet connection even though there is clearly Internet on my device. Get with the program HBO.

title: Just a bad app
review: It really is just an awful app all around but for me the biggest frustration is how poorly it handles downloaded content. I have the newest update and a 2021 iPad Pro and downloads on this app have always been a problem and continue to be. For me with the newest app version with Wi-Fi turned off downloads do finally play but don’t ever pause your movie and let your iPad go to sleep because your movie watching just ended. After that reopening the app takes several minutes as it searches for Wi-Fi, once it says that there is no connection, downloads show occasionally but even when they do show you can’t ever click on them to play. Restarting the iPad does not help.

title: Can’t watch downloaded content on flights
review: I specifically downloaded episodes of Euphoria to my iPhone on the HBO Max app to watch during my 3 hour flight. The downloads were showing on the app before take off but when I went to watch the episodes during my flight the app took forever to load and showed the episodes in the downloads section, but they were greyed out and I was not able to select an episode to watch. Thankfully I had downloaded some shows on the Netflix app which worked seamlessly during my flight. Really disappointed with HBO; with the amount we pay to subscribe to HBO Max it’s ridiculous that the application does not function as promoted to customers.

title: Goes from bad to worse right when you need it NOT to
review:
What kind of an app lets you download videos for *offline* viewing, only to randomly/sporadically require an internet connection when you open it? Multiple times now, I’ve pre-loaded movies and TV shows, gotten onto a plane, opened the app and… it won’t load past the splash screen. No matter what I do, it won’t load. But as soon as I land and try again, boom, no problem, opens right up. Infuriating

Oh, the easy solution is to just open the app before taking off, right? I thought so too. But then the app crashed at the end of an episode, which means I had to reopen it, and… hosed. No more watching anything until after landing.

The app is also sluggish and feels bloated. Tapping or swiping on things always feels like it registers a half-beat later than it should. Not going to bother specifying which phone model I have or what version I’m on — no other streaming video app I have behaves this way, so there’s no excuse

Get it together

title: Glitchy, crashes constantly
review:
1 star just for the fact that the streaming service is good, if I was just rating the iPad app I would give it 0 stars. 

The app is extremely glitchy and constantly crashes. I use the offline download function a lot and it takes 20 minutes to download one 30 minute show. Ask it to download a movie, it just crashes the whole app. Don’t even think about queuing up multiple titles to download. It’s not my internet either, because my other streaming apps like Netflix and Disney+ download multiple titles seconds on the same device. 

For such a “premium” product, you would think they would pay more attention to usability.

title: Worst Airplane Streaming App Out There
review: This app consistently fails me during flights or while on airplane mode/no connection in general. It lets you open the app and play your show, but if you so much as pull down the control center to change the brightness or volume, the app will crash and will not open until connected to wifi. If you leave the app after opening it while on Airplane mode, it will break and not allow you to watch anything until connected to wifi. If you connect to any wifi connection whatsoever while on airplane mode on the app, once disconnecting from the wifi the app will break as well. Any changes in screen or connection breaks this app. Terrible.

title: Bugs keep crashing my tv
review:
What’s going on here?  Since having HBO Max for a couple of months now, I feel that a virus/bugs were the cause of my tv that was was less than a year old to crash.  I bought a new tv last week and I already need to replace it because of this app (in my opinion).   

Between the tv screen constantly going completely blank, the constant freezing, the app closing itself out, the time it takes to scroll through the movies/shows because it takes so long for everything to load, constantly losing volume (no, the tv is not on mute), and constantly having to unplug my tv for it to “reset”, I would never pay for this app the way it is.  If my phone provider didn’t pay for this, I would have canceled my subscription last month.   I never had any of these problems until I started using the HBO Max App. 

It’s a shame, too.  HBO Max offers great tv shows and movies.  If only it didn’t keep crashing my tvs!  

Please, fix this buggy issue, HBO Max.

title: Show interruptions
review: The HBO app is very annoying to use. Every time I watch a show, I get interrupted about 10 times about “streaming cellular data” or wifi. It drives me crazy. I keep having to change my settings over and over. And there is nothing wrong with my wifi- it’s definitely an app issue because none of my other streaming apps do this and my wifi works great. I also cannot exit the app without the app still playing the movie. Yes, the app has lots of shows and options to watch but it’s almost not even worth it if you can’t watch the movie or show without being interrupted every 5 minutes.

title: Don’t bother downloading anything
review: App seems to search well, load well, everything, minus the actually watching part. I use this on my iPad mini 5 with Wi-Fi, downloading episodes for long car rides for my son. I spent time downloading, really expecting to be able to renew them after they expire—but they don’t! I’ll select renew, it’ll say it’s renewed, but then the episode won’t play and to “try again later”. If I attempt it more than once, the app crashes and will load up saying I’m not connected to internet when I am. I usually end up having to delete the episodes and download them again to rewatch them, which defeats the whole purpose of doing it all in the first place.

title: Fix episode re racking..
review: I used to love this app and all its programming, but since this last update a lot of the shows I watch over and over like Rick and Morty, Big Bang Theory, and Silicon Valley are not starting the episode over when it reaches the end and automatically advances to the next episode. So I watch season 2 of Rick and Morty today and let's say tomorrow I decide to watch it again we'll ever episode will have to be rewound to the beginning in order to watch it, it will only play the last few seconds of each episode and skip to the next and do the same thing if I don't restart every one each time I want to watch them..

title: By far the worst streaming app
review: This app is in need of a serious overhaul. Movies take up to an hour and a half to download, and 90% of the time, you’ll need to redo it at least once cause the last 1/10 of the download always errors. Also, when going between the different pages within the app like “search”, “home” and “profile” the app doesn’t save where you are so you are constantly having to re-type in the movie you’re looking at or try to find it again on the Home Screen. ADDITIONALLY when a download FINALLY finishes downloading, there’s still a high likelihood that when you go to play it, it’ll say there was an error in the download and you’ll have to redo it again.

title: Better than average content but inherently racist
review: I started watching United Shades of America today. The show is excellent. However, HBO Max automatically places subtitles on it. At first I was confused, because this is the first time I’ve had an HBO Max show automatically show subtitles. Once I had played a few episodes, though, I realized the subtitles only played when W. Kamau Bell speaks. I checked the subtitles setting, and it was set to “automatic”. Why would subtitles only come on when a black man was speaking? What’s more, why would the speech of a perfectly articulate black man whom I had no problem whatsoever understanding require subtitles? Like Tucker Carlson, I’m just asking questions.

title: Trash App Fantastic Content
review: This app is TRASH. No picture within a picture function on iPhone, mean while all my other streaming apps have said feature. The app is absolutely buggy, particularly on the fire stick. To how atrocious the app functions, it’s a bad mark on a company I hold in such high regard. HBO content is in matched. HBO was NETFLIX before NETFLIX existed; premium content since the ‘70’s. But man the app is utter TRASH. I NEVER write reviews. So the fact that I took time out to speak poorly of my top 2 content providers; NETFLIX is not to be dethroned, speaks to how bad the user experience is for this app on all platforms.  Spend the money HBO and upgrade the experience yesterday, it’s that bad.

title: Lack of content
review: This is a great app and good streaming service but there is some lack of spark for some of the franchises. Competitors such as Funimation & netflix would be better because there is no expectations and their content comes from left field. When HBO pitched more superhero stories in Snyders vision it was cool cuz it felt like the Bruce Tim JL cartoons coming to cinema. When I saw more of web pandering in a circle with other drama content I felt that this wasn’t the streaming service I could enjoy watching for a yearly service. I am sorry to say but I feel disappointed.

title: Good options, not so good app
review: I love the content HBO produces, but I don’t feel as though the app functionality and experience reflects the same quality. I have a Firestick and the app crashes often and/or has glitches that make it very frustrating to use. It starts new episodes before previous episodes are actually over and you can’t actually finish the episode. Plus in rewinding or fast forwarding, sometimes it just starts a new episode. It’s the weirdest thing but also the most irritating. That’s only a couple of issues I’ve witnessed. Great show selection, I just wish the overall experience was better.

title: Good Catalog ≠ Good Service
review:
They have an amazing lineup of shows so they feel they have zero need to innovate, fix the app, or listen to any feedback at all.  The app is literally so horrible I cannot put it into words. They took away downloads and added commercials to the base version, I upgrade to the download/commercial free version and they did not even upgrade my account. They forced 8$ out for the rest of the month, and instantly charged 16 for the new month of upgrades, without even changing my service. The app is absolutely identical as before. Still get ads, still cannot download. 

Was told by an HBO employee to delete and redownload and thats the best they can do to help me. MOST WORTHLESS STREAMING COMPANY

title: Downloads won’t play unless connected to Wi-Fi
review: Downloaded a couple of movies to watch on my flight.  None of them would work unless connected to Wi-Fi which defeats the purpose of downloading movies.  I did google searches on how to correct the issue and followed the instructions from HBO Max on how to fix but kept getting errors stating “cant play title”.   My flight was 2 legs so I removed the app and downloaded again after the first leg. Re-downloaded the movies and experienced the same issue.  Luckily I had also downloaded movies on Prime and Netflix which have always worked without issue.  If you want to watch movies on a flight without Wi-Fi then HBO Max will be a huge disappointment.

title: This app is amateur hour
review:
I’ve literally never left a review for an app before. HBO is such a good service with so much great content and I want to cancel my subscription because the app just straight up doesn’t work on ANY platform. 

It crashes after 50% of the interactions in the app (like, any interaction at all). It won’t play offline unless you specifically leave the downloads page open before you go off WiFi. It stops playing mid-stream and closes out…just because, why not? 

I’m sure the devs worked super hard on this. It’s not an easy app to build. But every other service has figured it out by now - why not HBO?

review: I have no idea why everyone is saying "Ew this is terrible! It keeps crashing" I think its pretty good? I'm watching on the tv, usually with parents but there are no problems. +Don't blame HBO for whatever Euphoria is and how it ended, cancelling your subscription for it doesn't help anyone. I'm sorry if you don't like how it ended, but I imagine it was interesting. Try not to be so negative, they try the best they can developing this app. Keep doing what y'all do, the app is fire!! 🌸🌸

title: 1 star for app functionality
review: HBO Max has a great catalogue and content, obviously. I’m mostly giving this such a bad review because the app itself is notoriously buggy (to the point that it’s a meme on Twitter), which is unacceptable given its price point. Skipping forward or back 10 seconds actually means waiting 30 seconds, because the app takes forever to rebuffed everything, and often it will rebuffed in horrible quality before finally adjusting back to normal. And currently, I can’t watch most content on the app using my iPad, and this was not resolved by going through the troubleshooting (checking bandwidth, resetting device, redownloading app, etc.) or by reaching out to their support team.

title: Persisting Issues
review:
Boggles my mind that HBO somehow can’t get  software engineers to help with all of the issues, that according to reviews from now and even a year are the same. The buffering issue apparently has also been from the start, so better servers anyone? 
If I click on a title, 90% of them buffer endlessly, screen goes black, and then never play, even with a strong connection or trying the app on different devices. So yes, the app has great content, but I’m unable to see the majority of what I would like. There are so many other small nitpicks issues that I dislike about the app, but being unable to even see the majority of titles is the main concern. Absolutely horrid app.

title: Full screen is back!
review: The only issue I’ve had with this app was when the ability to make the videos fill the screen was taken away. Well I just noticed that it was added back! You can now pinch-to-zoom to make the movies and shows full screen! I love the content that HBO Max has to offer and now I’ll be able to enjoy it so much more when watching on my iPhone . Thank you so much for listening to our feed back!

title: Great Catalog, Always Something New
review: I’ve been using HBOMax almost since it came out, and have still not run out of things I want to watch. Their ability to always get the newest movies is really nice, and I enjoy watching them with my family. We recently watched Matrix Resurrections all the way in Hawaii, where all the theaters were closed. On top of this, I’ve now watched South Park more times than I can count on my fingers, and I’ll probably watch it through again!

title: Worst streaming app ever
review: It doesn’t do what it’s supposed to do. I constantly get “unauthorized” error message. My subscription is paid for another 15 days, my password is correct. However I cannot access the content. I wait for a few hours and it works again. Also other problems with usability are “my downloads” section. If you are in airplane mode, you get access “my downloads” section. If you have a slow cellphone data connection, the app tries to load the online contents. This takes forever. While trying to connect to HBO servers, it only shows a logo. A good app should always show the Downloads section even if it is trying to load the main page.

title: Issue fast-forwarding and replaying series in iPad Mini iOS15.1
review: I love HBO Max, but I also love rewatching Friends over and over. I have two issues currently, one when I fast forward an episode in order to skip to the next (might want to add a button for this by the way), and I’ve already seen the next (as happens with ALL Friends episodes), it fast forwards all of them until it resets the app on its own. When this happens issue No. 2 pops up, there’s no way to pause the fast-forwarding. It leads me to have to close and reopen  the HBO Max app sometimes 3 times, or restart/turn off and on my iPad.  Please fix these bugs! Thanks and happy new year!

title: Downloads
review:
Tried to download 2 movies. Waited two hours for one to complete and got halfway through the 2nd (Wi-Fi was not the strongest) before I had to move on. Where the 2-star comes from is I thought I’d be worry-free and have a movie for my flight, pulling the app up before I get on and it shows “no downloads on this device”. Now, paired with apple not very friendly with how to find how to turn on cellular download, HBO doesn’t provide “how” either. So now I’m stuck with nothing. My fault for not checking a 3rd time before leaving my Wi-Fi area, but stinks I am also not able to do it on the fly either now. 

Have a wonderful evening.

developerResponse: {'id': 27814926, 'body': 'Good news! You can now use the Pinch-to-Zoom gesture to make shows and movies fill the screen on your iOS device. Download the latest HBO Max update and let us know if you have any questions.', 'modified': '2022-02-02T22:50:49Z'}
title: Rotation Bug and No Full Screen
review: This app is extremely buggy and has been for a while. It often will lose my place in a show if I leave the app to view a notification. It also has starting having rotation issues when I launch a show where is disappears off the edge of the screen (while audio still plays). Only way to fix it is exiting the app entirely and relaunching. Also, the inability to do full screen makes many shows (especially all the low-light DC comics shows) maddening to watch as it frequently results in a black box around the video. PLEASE fix these glaring problems.

title: Just some problems, but overall pretty good.
review: For me this app is works really well, but there are some problems. I would like to be able to watch a movie or tv show in picture in picture. Now, this worked when I tried a couple of months ago, but since then it has not worked. Today I tried to watch the Harry Potter movies, and it wouldn't allow me to use PiP, but when I watched them a couple of months ago, it worked. Also, it lags a little bit but overall I love the app.

title: Cant watch on mobile
userName: i really dont like hbo max
review: I installed HBOMAX on my smartphone as a way to enjoy my shows on the go. When installing the app they fail to inform you of how inconsistent and buggy this platform is. Luckily, my “enjoyment” is paid through a provider. If this was not the case, i would have canceled my subscription months ago. Whenever i try to open the app i am faced with a screen telling me that i have to put my username/password into the sign in to continue watching, however, it fails to take me to the sign in screen, leaving me in an unending loop of “try again.” This service may have an incredible selection of content, but it puts no effort into the delivery. Its as if they want you to suffer.

developerResponse: {'id': 32064156, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review and share your thoughts. We would like to learn more about your experience. Please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you. Thanks. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-09-16T17:27:27Z'}
title: Nothing but buffering.
review:
Seems the iPhone only place this app works halfway decent. 
The best catalog you can ask for out of all the streaming platforms, but the buffering.. It makes a app that could be amazing straight dog water. I went as far as to run a internet line directly to my tv, I have the fastest internet you can probably get in Cincinnati and it still buffers. It’s a constant buffering. It’s all over every place you can review. That’s everyone’s complaint and they have reason. Wanna watch House of The Dragons? Or Game of Thrones? Well you can with HBO Max you just might miss some stuff because it’s buffering and jumping spots. Come on HBO. Do better, before all your subscribers leave you.

developerResponse: {'id': 31681776, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - DonS. - where it asks for your Web Handle. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-08-26T16:24:28Z'}
title: Content Great. App Needs Work
review:
From a steaming perspective no complaints. 

The App? Struggling. I travel and like to download content from time to time. This app doesn’t appear to have any clue about downloaded. When I’m not on Wifi it tells me to change my settings to stream over cellular (it’s already set to stream that way so not sue what else to do). Apparently, the only way to watch downloaded content is to turn off cellular. Even then, when I try it asks me if I want to go to the downloaded version. Again, not sure why it’s asking. I was in downloaded content to start with and if I wasn’t, shouldn’t that be obvious?

title: The anime problem
review: The movies on here are beautiful and very popular but when i was going to watch the movie spirited away I was so excited until I realized HBO max had the dubbed version so I quickly thought that if I go to audio settings I could have the Japanese audio with English subtitles but there wasn’t any choices I’m really disappointed because I like watching the original version. I would be very happy if I were to have the original audio. Other than that the app is lovely and convenient

title: Somehow, the new app is even worse than the original app!
review:
HBOMax recently updated their Apple TV app with a new UI and layout.

Unbelievably, this app is worse than the original app. It’s very slow to load at launch and it’s super, super buggy. I basically have to force quit the app and restart it EVERY SINGLE TIME I USE IT.

This is ridiculous. It’s shameful that a billion dollar media company has such a garbage app, when this app is literally the main store front for its customers. 

___________________________________________

Every time I launch the app I have to select a profile, even though there’s only one profile and there’ll only ever be one profile. You can’t get any information about what you’re watching, unless you stop the video and back out to its show page. Ridiculous. Now, subtitles are automatically on, every single time you start a video. This is maddening. It really makes me hate this app. HBO seems to have designed an app purpose built to provide their paying customers with the worst possible experience.

Thank you, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-04T03:16:31Z'}
title: Still the worst for someone who charges so much
review:
I don’t write this lightly, Multiple phones, multiple years, multiple setups, always terrible when air playing. 

Because you’re forced to with multiple devices, you have to air play. And sometimes it works great and other times it will just freeze when the screen locks the program freezes, or when a notification comes in. 

I’ve escalated this multiple times to HBO and this last time the help was so atrociously bad that I just dragged it out to see how terrible it was, 3 weeks later they’re still asking if my issue has been resolved and I keep telling them no and they keep suggesting nothing.

developerResponse:
{'id': 22560100, 'body': 'Hey! 

We definitely want you to have the experience you paid for. 

Please reach out to us at help.hbomax.com/AppReview and someone will be in contact to help you out. 

Thank you! ', 'modified': '2022-02-07T22:01:34Z'}
title: Trash
review:
No matter what device I play the app on or stream it on or whatever version it is, along with highest speed internet this TRASH app will always buffer every 30-60 seconds completely ruining the watching experience... very sad I paid for this for a year!

Update: Still garbage app, you’re lucky to get 1 episode or a movie to play in it entirety, only to receive the “oops something went wrong” making you restart the app only to have it happen again within 20-30 seconds. It doesn’t matter if it’s on Wi-Fi at home or another Wi-Fi or whether it’s on Xbox, iPad or ps5… the only good thing the app has is it’s content which I end up waiting to rent or purchase from other streamers….. TRASH TRASH TRASH!!!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 27814292, 'body': 'Good news! You can now use the Pinch-to-Zoom gesture to make shows and movies fill the screen on your iOS device. Download the latest HBO Max update and let us know if you have any questions.', 'modified': '2022-02-02T21:44:00Z'}
title: NO Zoom feature…Why?
review: I enjoy the content and think the app is ok as far. Yes improvements are needed but it’s ok and content is amazing. However, why in the name of consumer enjoyment did you remove the zoom feature? I mean, I get it you want to streamline but allow for the option to zoom in and fill the screen should the user wish to do so. I wish to do so. All your competitors have the fill screen feature but you decided to remove it. WHY WHY WHY. Who is calling the shots at the app development? Fire that person and get up to date want people want. Thanks

title: Corporate Mega-Mergers Strike Again
review:
For those of you who don't know, Warner recently got merged with Discovery, and in the process, a whole mess of things happened.

I would highly suggest checking out Adam Conover's (the person who made Adam Ruins Everything) video on it, as I am currently too disappointed in the whole situation to properly explain it. The short summary is that HBO Max removed a bunch of platform-exclusive shows (including the absolutely incredible "Infinity Train") because they didn't want to keep paying royalties to the people that helped make it so successful.

Remember: when big corporations win, we all lose.

title: The latest version is very buggy…..
review:
Ever since the app was updated to the newest version in the past month, it has been incredibly buggy. Here are my 2 biggest complaints: 

1. The app has stopped updating in my “Up Next” queue in the iPad TV app. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling, but nothing changes. I have so many streaming services, using the native iPad TV app is the only reasonable way I have to adequately manage the amount of content that I am watching. The present lack of connectivity in this regard is quite troublesome. 

2. I will randomly get error messages when picking out content to watch. Every time this happens, I have to close the app and reopen.

developerResponse: {'id': 31326231, 'body': "Hi, thanks for the review. We have some great troubleshooting steps here that should help with your app crashing: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact, so we can take a closer look. Thanks, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-08-08T03:51:01Z'}
title: So close yet so far
review:
I love this app. It’s a stress reliever and entertainment provider-when it wants to function. Unless the app is having the time of its life, it will refuse to work. Here’s the flaws: 
 
1. It will say that you have no Wi-Fi connection when you actually do at random times. There is the heavenly airplane mode but turning it on to watch a show kinda ruins the flow. 
 
2. Crashes. Hoo boy. It’s crashed 3 times in 5 days. Whether you get kicked out of the app or forced to restart it, they’re a complete nuisance. 
 
3. Not a functionality-related issue, but too many movies and shows get removed each month. Peacock exists but still. 
 
4. Sometimes not a single button will work, as the cherry on top.

 It’s kinda sad. The app is incredible, but that’s because of the stuff that ya can watch. If this had mediocre or even bad shows I’d one star this for sure. Plz fix. Maybe it’s just me but I dunno.

developerResponse: {'id': 23316982, 'body': 'Hi there! We released an update to our Apple TV app to resolve the issues you have been experiencing. Please update the app in your Apple TV App Store and let us know if there’s anything else we can help you with.\n', 'modified': '2022-05-02T22:24:00Z'}
title: ALWAYS buggy
review:
I’ve never experienced this many bugs/problems with a streaming app on Apple TV. I have them all. Sometimes HBO gives me an error message for every show that I click on to “contact my tv provider” …for my HBO Max app? That doesn’t even make any sense. & then I just have to wait for it to start working again. Since I am not being provided the full months service that I pay for because of their bad software, will I get even a partial refund? I highly doubt it. Really thinking about just canceling this subscription to be rid of the frustration. 

Your software engineers need to be FIRED! THEY’VE SHOWN THAT THEY ARE NOT COMPETENT FOR THIS JOB. 

Hire a better team. Your app ratings are getting lower & lower every month. I wonder how the stocks are doing. There’s so many awesome shows but people can’t even watch! Such a shameful waste of time & money for you & customers. 

I’ll change my rating when I’m able to use this app for the month that I actually pay for.  Not random times when your bad software allows me to use it.

If you have any additional questions, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you.', 'modified': '2022-04-10T05:42:06Z'}
title: HBO Max app crashes constantly
review:
This app is total garbage. It crashes constantly while trying to download shows. Even worse, sometimes the download seems to work, but then you discover it doesn’t (playback error) when you want to start binge watching a new show on a long transatlantic flight. At which point it is too late to do anything (other than to switch to Netflix).

There are lots of websites out there with recommendations on how to solve these crashes, including 1/resetting your router, 2/ checking if HBO’s servers are online, 3/ restarting the app, 4/ logging out and back in, etc…..

None of this has EVER happened to the Netflix app. It is shameful how bad this app is.

title: EDIT: Downloads are working now
review:
Streaming works, but whenever I try to download something, it eventually stops and throws up an error message. My wi-fi isn’t the best, so being unable to download titles to watch without my connection being weak or dropping is massively inconvenient. (Sent again because my connection dropped and I wasn’t sure it went through the first time.)

EDIT: They’re working again. Maybe I just wasn’t close enough to the router. Again, my home’s wi-fi isn’t great.

title: EDIT: They actually fixed it.
review:
The company actually listened and brought it back. Love the content and the streaming quality is awesome. Up to five stars for quality and actually listening to feed back. 

Original:
Can’t do full screen video on the phone. Can do it in all the other video apps. I pay for it, if I don’t care about a little notch out of the screen it’s my prerogative to leave it cut out. Give back full screen.

title: WORST APP EVER
review: It’s a moot point because they have a captive audience.  But it’s insanely hard to navigate, has counter-intuitive controls, and has a ridiculous feature that on some smart TVs renders voice commands from Google Home, Alexa, et al, useless. If you tell your home speaker simply to play a show, you then have to manually select which profile in HBO Max to use. I even deleted down to having only one profile and it STILL does it. Another HUGE shortcoming is that if you try to run your TV’s sound through an HDMI cable to your AV/Home Theater receiver, it’s completely scrambled. It sounds like mosquitos arguing with each other. Just read some of the other reviews. A truly shameful performance by HBO.

title: Very buggy app devalues the content
review: Look, there’s no question HBO has some of the best shows and movies out there on the all. But wow this unfortunately makes the watching experience sub par. Using the ios app on and iPhone 12, I use airplay to cast the show to my smart TV. The show starts in a different language setting every time—switching between Spanish and English with and without the audio description. To change it sometimes I have to select a different language to get it to play the one I want (ie clicking Spanish=Englishman. It also doesn’t auto play the next episode when you’re air playing.

title: Serious battery consumption
review: While the app has improved in the last year or so in that it doesn’t crash or stops responding as it frequently did in the past, something changed in one of the recent updates that’s making the app use up a lot of the battery charge. Generally approximately 80%. No other app including other streaming services apps use even half this percentage on my phone for the same usage time. I hope the developers are looking into this and that it’ll be addressed in an update soon.

developerResponse: {'id': 32172456, 'body': "Hi, we have some great troubleshooting steps here that should help with your app crashing: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support, thanks. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-09-22T13:12:46Z'}
title: Good content, terrible app
review:
Much like other reviews have said, the content itself is wonderful, but the app is a buggy, unusable mess. When I play any content the visuals freeze up but the audio continues, making movies and shows seem more like podcasts with slideshows that change between still images every five to ten seconds. This happens on my iPhone and iPad running up to date HBO max app and using up to date iOS. 

It also crashes often. Once or twice an hour I’ll get an error, and then I’ll have to log out and back in again to get it to show anything at all. 

Also, sometimes I can’t even log in at all. When logging in through my cable provider it sometimes tells me that I’m trying to use a secondary account when I’m the primary account holder. 

This app is tremendously infuriating and I’ve pretty much given up on using it. It’s a shame because I really enjoy HBO’s content and want to watch it on my mobile devices. The app makes it impossible and it’s such a waste.

title: Worthless for offline streaming
review: I find programming on HBO captures about 50% of my viewing…when I’m connected to WiFi. Trying to watch downloaded shows while not connected, however, is an exercise in futility. Having just returned from a two week road trip with rare access to WiFi, my slate of downloaded episodes of Flight Attendant, CB Strike and Hacks sat frustratingly out of reach as the app simply spun interminably or, in brief moments of optimism, finally opened, only to state that I don’t have anything downloaded. What’s the point of being able to download programming if they can’t be accessed offline?

title: Changed from 1 to 4
review:
Content is great, app does need some help, but… initially could only see a sliver of content. After reading through developer responses they mentioned a pinch to fill content feature. It took some work but I was able to get the content to fill my device. 

I changed from 1 to 4 stars because it is clear that development is taking an active role listening to users, fixing bugs and improving the overall experience. Thanks! Keep up the good work!

title: good app ig
review: when trying to play videos it will take a bit so start and if i try to fast forward while the intro is playing it kicks me off the app. once it’s playing it’s fine but also it takes forever to get INTO the app. it says that i’m offline and i’ll click check connection over and over and it never works. every other app i has works and it says i have wifi so it’s def just this app. prolly gonna get rid of it when euphoria ends,  i watch on iphone 8+ btw

title: Good service bad mobile app
review: The service is great it’s got tons of shows and movies I’ve been wanting to watch on it. The only issue is on mobile the app is very buggy, it takes a while for the app to load when you switch pages and trying to download something is a pain as it takes forever to register, also trying to delete downloads takes forever to register too, other than that not many problems besides a downloaded show or movie sometimes crashing the app.

title: Love the App, but….
review:
I have been using HBO Max since it came out, because of my Cable Provider account. I have been able to watch some great content. But, I recently had to change my password with my Cable Provider, so I went to re-log into HBO Max. All it would do is cycle when I would click on the provider sign in part. 

I deleted and loaded in the app again, twice. Same issue. I was able to go into the computer and log into HBO Max. The phone is not letting me in.  Please help.

We look forward to working with you. HBO Max Support Team', 'modified': '2022-08-19T18:32:33Z'}
title: Horrible
review: I have several various streaming apps and the HBO one is by far the worst! It is so unreliable and finicky! I like to download most everything I watch but that in of itself is a major pain on this app. I can usually only download 1 or 2 episodes at time, where as on other apps, I can download an entire season at once. And then when I try to watch downloaded content, forget about it. I spend the better part of 20 minutes jacking with the app to get the downloaded content to play before I say screw it and delete everything to just turn around and stream it! It’s so frustrating and for me defeats the purpose of having the app!

title: Great content but very poor offline experience
review:
I would rate the content offered on HBO 5 stars, but if I were just rating the app itself I would give that about 1 1/2 stars.   

Like most streaming apps, this does have the option to download content.  Planning ahead, i have often done that prior to many airline flights.   However, if you are not already logged in before you lose cell service, the app will not log you in.   

Even worse, although I do log in prior to take off, the app will often freeze up while watching downloaded content and then log you out, so now you cannot log back in mid flight 

Very frustrating and annoying.    I do not understand why they would make content available to download but then make it impossible to access it offline.   Hopefully this can be addressed and fixed in future updates, because other than this glaring flaw, this is a great app with great shows

developerResponse: {'id': 29870702, 'body': "Hi, we have some great troubleshooting steps here that should help with your app crashing: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thanks! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-05-20T15:53:11Z'}
title: Love/Hate Relationship
review: I am totally into several of the streaming shows, there are just so many to choose from.  Content is amazing, but good luck being able too see it.  The app is incredibly buggy!  I like to use my lightning to HDMI adapter, but this app hates it.  Sometimes it plays and other times tells me that it cannot play to check my connection.  Of course I am connected to the internet and can close the app just to relaunch and it will work.  Other times it will get little tiny white and green bars all over the picture and then eventually distorts the picture.  Again, I close the app, go back in and like magic the picture is restored.

title: Freezes and won’t load very often
review: I tried to watch a series and it keeps freezing in the middle of the episodes.  I have to constantly close and reopen the app, start back at the profile page and select the episode again.  It tells me I have to use my cellular data when I’m connected to the WiFi in my house.  I usually end up having to restart my phone just to get the app to come off of the blue hbo max main screen when that freezes as well.  Find another series on another app bc I would have given up on the series if I wasn’t already into it so far.

The issue is that when I click on an episode to watch it loads really slowly and then when it finally loads it goes to the end of the episode like I already watched it and I can’t get it to go back to the beginning. I have tried deleting app and reinstalling, logging out and back in, checked the internet speed and that was good, updated my tablet. It’s frustrating.

title: TV Provider Issue
review: I can’t even sign in using my tv provider. It just sits there loading for minutes at a time. If I close the app and try again, it just starts to load and doesn’t even give me the option to try and sign in. Deleted the app and tried again, still not working. Thankfully I can just use my Apple TV or laptop, but not being able to have it on my phone is inconvenient. Surprised to see that so many people are having the same issues. You think a platform carrying such popular shows would have it together, but I guess not. Due to the fact that I can’t even sign in, I have to give one star.

title: Endless loop of error messages
review:
After the recent update, I can now download with greater ease which is a big improvement. Playback of those downloads, however, is an endless loop of "you have no Wifi, change your settings" *goes back and checks that settings for cellular streaming are on even though this is a downloaded title that shouldn't require it, settings are fine*
I return to the download page, hit play and I'm back to "you don't have a Wifi connection, change your settings" to play a title that I've downloaded. Goodness, so many bugs!

If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - Annieokaley - under Web Handle. Thanks! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-07T15:25:28Z'}
title: Crash, freeze, slow
review:
This app has many bugs, it freezes and stops playing video while the captions continue to play, it crashes often and is frustrating. It loads slow, and going from menu to menu even loads slow. Even accessing the basic navigation moves slow. Every click takes a minute to register, and once it does start to work it will keep going as many times as you click it.  Finally I do not even attempt to watch trailers anymore, as it always crashes the app. I hope HBO is working on these issues because I am not the only one writing this exact review. 

I have no issues with the content, but for the price of the app, I would expect a better overall product. Wish I could rate the app aside from the content. I give the app 1 ⭐️ and the content 5 ⭐️’s. 

HBO please I’m begging you to fix this app, honestly I’d rather have HBO than stars or showtime but I’ll switch if I have to. 

Thank you

developerResponse: {'id': 28401862, 'body': "Hey, thanks so much for letting us know what you've been experiencing. title: Not good
review:
Love the content but my god this app on all platforms is frustrating to use. Impossible to load anything on great wifi. Sometimes the audio is off from the picture and makes me feel like I’m watching a foreign film dubbed over in English. Freezes and messes up the device I use it on for the day. This app has made me loss precious days off my life due to the many problems it produces. I am not mad, just disappointed. Let me know when you have learned your lesson and fixed the many issues so I can enjoy your content in peace. Enjoy your weekend, but please come Monday be focused and determined to make a change for the better.

Love,
A Friend in Need

title: App doesn’t open on my iPad
review: I’ve updated the app, restarted and reset my iPad, deleted and redownloaded the app at least 5 times, and I’ve done everything in every order I can think of. No matter what I do it doesn’t get past the loading screen. I have super fast internet speed so that’s not the problem. Every other streaming app loads everything incredibly fast. Even when I delete and load the app again if finishes downloading in a matter of seconds the app just refuses to open for some reason. Seems like a major glitch and it’s incredibly annoying to pay for HBO and not be able to watch it because their app is so flawed.
