title: Content good. Offline viewing bad
review:
Love the content. Plenty of good programming to choose from.

The app itself is pretty bad, especially when trying to watch downloaded content when offline, at least on my iPhone. Each time I’ve attempted this (on a flight) it worked ok until I paused the show. The app then freezes up and won’t let me restart the show. Shutting down the app and restarting my phone doesn’t help. I have to wait until I land and can go back online, I guess for things to sync up, before I can resume the program. So it’s useless when trying to view offline.

developerResponse: {'id': 27814927, 'body': 'Good news! You can now use the Pinch-to-Zoom gesture to make shows and movies fill the screen on your iOS device. Download the latest HBO Max update and let us know if you have any questions.', 'modified': '2022-02-02T22:51:06Z'}
title: No Full screen= not watching.
review: Yea the app is cool and all and the contents and variety of old and new movies and pretty decent and come out crisp all the time. But it’s like for certain shows I just can’t full screen when watching something good like the Godzilla and King Kong movie cause it’s smaller than what it’s usually is and just doesn't look or sit right when viewing. So pls lmk if I just gotta delete and redownload or something cause it’s just annoying and makes it pointless to have it isn’t being fully optimized. And add the Og episodes of Top Gear.

title: RIP HBOMAX
review:
HBOMAX is my favorite streaming service. In such a miserable, unjust, nightmarish world, it is one of the very few sources of joy. HBO’s original content is as compelling as its always been, and the services library of classic and modern, art house and mainstream films brings me back to it over and over.

But, as I already said, we live in a miserable nightmare reality, and now it turns out that David Zaslav is just stripping WB and HBO down to auction them off to the highest bidder. Ill miss it when it’s gone.

title: worst app among major streamers
review: This: when the app asks you to rate it, you say yes… and the app fails to take you to a rating page. Like its brother on appleTV, the hbomax iphone app is FULL of bugs, crashes constantly, and is unable to find its own content.  EASILY the worst app of the big streamers, YEARS behind. impossible to remove or add shows to lists reliably. you screens become crowded with cruft, bad shows you can’t delete from “watching”.  the app “traps” you in cul-de-sacs that are impossible to get out of no matter how much you press BACK.  Simply astonishing how a huge company like HBO can systematically destroy their own brand hundreds of millions of times a day, simply by cutting corners on app QA.

title: Never actually works
review: Every time I go to watch anything or try and download something to watch offline the app says that I have no internet connection. This occurs when using both cellular data and wifi. The app will let you load in and browse (so you are obviously connected to the internet) but as soon as you go to actually watch a show it will pretend to load then kick you out and say you are no connected to the internet. The only “solution” is to delete the app entirely and redownload, and I say “solution” because after maybe 2 shows you will run into the same issue and have to do it all over again.

title: Worst APP ever / Greatest selection
review: First this app has the GREATEST selection of movies and shows for the price each month. It’s absolutely my favorite movie streaming option… the only issue is that the app only works like 30% of the time… on both my smart TV and my phone…. Most of the time I have to screen share from my iPhone to my TV because the app never works… I have tried it on several TVs of several brands and it NEVER works… it makes me want to cancel my entire subscription because what is the point in having all these options when I can’t even watch the movies or shows…

title: AWFUL technical and customer support
review: The app does not work on my tablet. I’ve spent hours on chat support, hours e-mailing and repeating the same cut and paste “troubleshooting” steps, spoken to a dozen different people and still have not made any progress whatsoever. I signed up and first spoke with customer support Feb 28th. Several days were spent chatting and e-mailing with various support team members before my case was escalated for further review. Again, the same basic troubleshooting steps were asked of me, the same questions that I had already answered regarding specs/app info/software/internet etc. were asked and answered. They haven’t responded or updated since March 9th. It’s now March 24th.

title: Comes with my phone plan
review:
I was able to watch it for one day and now it keeps saying that my subscription cannot be verified. I have a valid unlimited plan that comes with HBO max and an iPhone 13 pro max, and I cannot even watch it. There is a forum full of people with the same issue. Please fix.

I was contacted and given the same advice that I found online. I had already tried it all and guess what, it didn’t work. The last email I got told me to call AT&T. I refuse to spend hours on the phone with someone who has no idea what I’m talking about or has no way to help me. So, I’m still stuck with a useless subscription that refuses to verify. Thanks.

title: Going backwards
review: Up until a few weeks ago this was by far my favorite streaming service. Recent changes have been disappointing. Now there is a lagging between screens and while streaming. All of a sudden now there are these dots that spin at the bottom of the screen while stuff takes forever to load. HBOMAX streaming at the beginning was awful but eventually smoothed out and was always reliable. Now we’re back to lagging and opening it three times before it works.  This combined with the recent catalog changes have me contemplating cancellation.

title: Worst Streaming service I’ve ever used
review: I would give only one star but I enjoy HBO’s content. I have never wrote a review for an app before but I’m hoping that this will be a wake up call for HBO to get on top of their crap. Sometimes the app switches languages after I have paused the show and will refuse to go back to English even when English is selected! Sometimes it will automatically turn on the descriptive audio for blind people, other times it will flat out refuse to play something. As I write this review, I am staring at my tv with the HBO max opening screen as it tries to pull up anything for me to watch. THE APP IS CRAP!!!

title: It’s working fine for me
review: I am mostly using this app on my iPhone and on my iPad a few times. I know there are a bunch of reviews saying this app has a lot of issues. I have yet get a single crash. I have no problem downloading and watching said content when away from wifi. I don’t have any notable complaints outside the ui could be better. Maybe I just got lucky or they fixed the app.

title: Buggiest / Jankiest Experience on this Store
review:
There is malware that loads faster and plays better quality content that this piece of garbage. Everyone who built this should be ashamed that the content their teammates produce sits and is (rarely) played on such a heap of crap. Downloading almost never works unless you are next to a router. Playback is impossible—which kind of defeats the purpose of having the downloads. Dunno what AT&T was playing at when it thought it could drive up revenue by making everyone hate the mobile experience of its flagship channel and content producer… 

Also—Apple should be Infinity ASHAMED of itself for giving this app the “Editors Choice” laurels.

title: You force your users to download an app that doesn’t work
review: This is literally an accessibility issue. You clearly did not think about your users nor speak to them. Sometimes you need to go and manage your account and you don’t want to download an app just to manage your account. So here I am with an app that doesn’t work for an account that I now can’t manage because you needed to force me to download the app. What if I didn’t have the data what if I needed to cancel credit card or change your credit card because I’m going to overdraft it?These user journeys were obviously not thought about or edge cases. This is so disappointing.

If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Best, HBO Max Customer Support", 'modified': '2022-02-06T20:41:45Z'}
title: Good shows, awful streaming
review:
HBO has an incredible pick of movies and shows to watch, but the streaming app itself is awful. I use the HBO app to stream to my TV and it routinely will change language settings completely on its own while i'm watching something. Or when the show starts, the English settling is selected but it will play Spanish. I'll end up having to choose Spanish for the audio to play in English. 
Half of the time when a new episode starts, it will play the recap from the previous episode and then stop playing completely and I have to reboot the app to get it to work.

Thanks, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-05-12T04:17:40Z'}
title: 5 Stars for Selection, 0 for Playback
review: I would love to watch more in this app but 90% of the time I try to watch a show or movie, it tries loading for a few minutes and then gives me a playback error. I restart the app, restart the device…nothing works. The rare times that I can get something to play, it buffers every ten seconds. This happens regardless of whether I’m watching on my tv, iphone or ipad. I keep the app updated and my wifi speed is high. Very frustrating and a shame because HBO has some good content. I don’t have ANY issues streaming on other apps. Newer isn’t always better: the old HBO Go app worked perfectly!

title: Not worth the headache!!!
review: This is the second time I’ve canceled HBO Max this year through my Apple account because it won’t let me open the app on my AppleTV …as soon as you click on the icon for HBO Max it opens to a purple screen then goes back to the main screen on the Apple TV…I tried deleting and re loading it…still same problems…so unless I find the time & patience to call or email them I payed for a month and maybe got to use it for half that!!! Very frustrating when you get into a show and can’t finish after paying for a subscription!!!  Not worth the headache!!!

title: Videos do not play
review:
There's a nice set of content, and I've liked the way that categories are set up to find it. Just one problem: I can't actually watch anything.

Recently, I've lost the ability to play videos on my iPad (though a different app on my TV works fine). Videos go to the start screen, hang indefinitely on a studio logo, then sometimes eventually close without a clear error message. Tried many shows, restarting iPad, and even deleting app and reinstalling it. 

Some bugs can be worked around, but in a video service, playback isn't really optional.

title: Good but a few things
review: I like the content, I tolerate the price, but what i came to critique is the screen pausing when you shrink it down or changing subtitles or language. It feels like a chore when going between apps and it just pauses. Another thing is autoplay. The minimized screen disappears when the episode ends, while on other apps they’ll just queue up the next episode. Lastly the lack of a next episode button, one that you can push if you want to skip the episode and not have to scroll to the end to do it.

title: No ratings ?! that means a lot of time lost !
review:
If there is something that I really don’t want to happen is to lose time watching some trashy movie. Our deal is simple : I pay your subscription and you, in return, will provide me some (just a few) good movies a month.
The worst case scenario is to pay and lose time at the same time (actually, even if the service will be free in a short period I’ll lose my interest after watching a few movies that make me consider that it was jus waisted time.

Conclusion/suggestion: bring back movie ratings (preferably from those IMDb like sites!

title: App needs to be fixed
review: I like the content on the app but it doesn’t work the greatest with iPad or an iPhone. Anything else it works fine but wish they get it fixed for other apple products. I did all suggested fixes but they don’t work. It used to last year but around Dec 2021 it hasn’t worked. Waited for updates but they haven’t made any difference. Video takes forever to load and when the video finally plays it’s at the very end. You have to pause it quickly so you can rewind it to the beginning which is extremely frustrating.

Thank you, HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-02-06T12:21:35Z'}
title: Doesn’t handle offline content well
review: The app works if you want to stream shows while connected to the internet. However, once you are offline, it takes forever to open while it is searching for internet. It then goes into what appears to be offline mode where you can see what you downloaded but it hangs up and never plays the downloaded movie. This makes that feature useless and leaves me wondering why I even have the app since every time I have internet I can just watch the show on some device connected to the internet…

Thank you. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-01-31T15:17:03Z'}
title: Can’t watch downloaded content
review:
How have you still not fixed the issue with watching downloaded content when you don’t an internet/cell connection. 99% of the time I want to watch downloads is on a plane- but the app won’t even open correctly without service. It completely defeats the point of downloaded content. Fix this!!!

Update- I received a “developer” response with a generic link. It still doesn’t fix the fact that I can’t open and watch downloads without first having an internet connection. I am doing everything your webpage says to. Fix the issue and stop pretending like your faq is a solution.

title: App won’t allow me to login
review: I’ve enjoyed the app,  but a recent bug won’t allow me to even attempt to login. Too bad, as I’m paying for this through a cable provider. I spent 30 min on chat with 2 different agents who clearly don’t know how the app and website work. I was told just login through the browser on my phone. Well the browser will only send you to the app when you attempt this. And the app is still not working. I’ve already uninstalled, reinstalled, and made sure IOS is up to date.  Yet I get the spinning circle of death when trying to login. Very disappointed in poorly-trained customer service.

title: Love it but..
review: Overall great app! Wonderful selection, has all of my favourite shows and movies. One problem though, we can’t pull up a small window of the show while we do something. Like I’ll get a text and go to answer it while I'm in the middle of an episode, and it disappears. Same thing with if I touch my screen, it either pauses or clicks off of what I'm watching. I love this app and it’s not a big deal if this doesn’t get fixed. Again, brilliant app.

title: Constantly tells me I’m not on Wi-Fi
review: Looks like this is roughly the same problem lots of other people are having. And no, I’m not going to go fill out a customer feedback form. The catalog of content is very good, but the app is very frustrating. Sitting in my home with very strong Wi-Fi and blazing fast Internet, which easily supports high resolution video streaming on other platforms, I constantly see the HBO app begin to buffer, followed by it kicking me over to a screen saying there’s no Wi-Fi. Bro, there’s plenty of Wi-Fi; your servers just can’t keep up. Either buff up your servers so they don’t lag, or fix the app so that it doesn’t mistakenly assume my Wi-Fi is out.

HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-02-09T03:36:53Z'}
title: Horrible app.
review: This app has been a ridiculously bad experience. I subscribe to HBO through my tv provider (xfinity). The provider says HBO max comes with my subscription. The entire thing takes me in circles between a token and sign in at xfinity then a token and sign in to the app on the streaming device and then cycles back around into a never ending loop. If I want access to this, I have to pay for it in addition to my cable subscription cost for the premium channel. Terrible experience trying to get this as a replacement for HBO Go and because of it, have decided to cancel both the app and the premium cable channel subscription and leave HBO completely!

title: Adding my disappointment
review:
Love the programming, but we pay $15 a month and can’t get a decent app. Shows constantly freeze (watching Station Eleven, we’re maybe 10 minutes into the episode and it’s frozen 10-15 times). None of the other streaming apps I use do this. They just keep giving the same cookie-cutter response, as if it’s people’s phones or internet connection that’s the problem, when it’s been happening for months and months. 
The UI is terrible. Navigating is cumbersome, especially individual episodes. They haven’t improved this at all. 
When are they going to start listening to our feedback?

If you have any additional questions, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-08-23T06:09:34Z'}
title: Can’t access downloads
review: There are so many frustrating things about this app. The biggest is the lack of connection and bugginess. I can be connected with 100mgs and the app will say I’m not connected. Worse though is I download shows to watch bc of the connection issues. You can’t get to your downloads though. The app continually says, you’re not connected. Why does it matter if I’m connected if I’m trying to access my downloads?! I should be able to access my downloads in airplane mode. It usually takes at least 10 minutes to get to your downloads, if all. I would rate it 0 stars if I could.

title: Doesn’t play well with AppleTV
review:
Looks nice, but when I launch the app the developers have decided they want me to hear their startup sound. 

Dear dev team: if I have music playing on my AppleTV, I do not want you to stop, duck, or otherwise interrupt my flow. As it stands, I was interrupted launching the app and decided my music was more important than looking for something to watch in your app. 

UX tip: if music is playing, it’s on purpose and I’ll stop it myself or let you stop it when I start watching one of your videos. 

Please play nicer on my devices and don’t interrupt my flow. Maybe I want to enjoy your app by adding shows to my queue whilst also enjoying the music *I* want to hear. 

Otherwise, the app looks gorgeous generally and the catalog of videos seems bottomless. I hope it gets better when Discovery+ gets merged in, rather than more terrible. 

Cheers!

title: Very Poorly made app lets you watch 20 minutes and then want you to get back online
review: So the only reason why I got HBO was so that I could watch movies on my iPad when I go to places without Internet connections. For the last month or so I can only watch 20 minutes of the movie and then the app wants me to get back online. I need to end my HBO subscription and I would warn everyone unless you’re going to watch it at home only don’t waste your time on HBO and don’t waste your time on the stupid app. Hopefully since the new iOS 15 version is out maybe they’ll do an update and the movies I have downloaded will not keep cutting out.

review: I just downloaded the app and I must say that it lacks many fixes.  I can't watch an episode or movie without the screen stopping saying that my internet isn't working when it is.  It took me almost two hours to watch an episode and leaving the app and logging in again, paying almost $ 15 a month and not being able to watch well at ease is a total scam.  they should work more with the app.

title: Buggy and frustrating
review: App is okay but if your streaming from your phone to your tv it automatically skips to next episode 30 seconds before the end of the episode and you end up missing the ending. And a lot of times you have to disconnect the stream and restart because it says can not play at this time super annoying when your just trying to binge. There’s no way to report the bug to the app or HBO max so I figured here was the best place. Other than the selection is good and usually has newer movies out before anywhere else.

title: Why did I buy premium?
review: I upgraded to premium so I could download shows and watch offline but every time I try to download more than one thing at a time, the app closes.  I’d like to download by the season but if I have to sit there and wait 10 mins for each individual episode, it’s a waste of my time, and battery (bc I have to keep the app open)  I really enjoy the original shows and the movie selection, I really don’t want to stop subscribing but if the problem isn’t fixed for offline users, this is a waste of my money and I’ll just cancel.

title: Great service, terribly buggy app
review:
HBO max has great content. Let’s start with that.

But, this review is about the app, and the app is embarrassingly buggy for a major company. The interface is fine, when it works. But it just stops responding frequently, like it will scroll but not allow me to select anything. Or, it just won’t get past the loading screen when I open the app. Or sometimes, the player gets out of sync when I’m playing content, like I’ll hear the sound but the video is frozen. 

Guys, please fix it. You are better than your app.

title: Kept freezing on TV, removed tons of shows
review:
Back before HBO removed a ton of the shows many adored, I would watch it a lot but one thing kept stopping me many times, it kept freezing up TV, I couldn't even turn off the TV. 
Now, they just go and remove a ton of shows and cancel projects?? I was excited for the news of a 'The Amazing World of Gumball' movie. But now while removing a lot of animated shows, mainly from CN, they cancelled projects too that would've been amazing to see. Summer Camp Island's director even thought his show was cancelled and not removed!!
Hoping they fix this whole thing and bring the shows back.

If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - stockman95 - where it asks for your Web Handle. Thanks. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-08-24T23:45:06Z'}
title: Great variety of movies but app crashes often
review: I love the variety of movies and shows available. Some movies that are brand new only to HBO. But…I have never has more problems with a streaming app than I do with this one. The app force closes on you often and will say this a device doesn’t have internet connection but is connected to wifi and Data. Once you have tried to download something it glitches and when you finally play the movie or show it sometimes refuses to play it. If it weren’t for the streaming service on my tv’s I would want this service at all because it is truly crap.

title: Zoom in feature on mobile app seems weird
review: Recently, i was having problems with the zooming in feature, what happens is that i was watching a movie and there were black bars on both sides of the screen, but when i zoomed in, it was not filling up. I didn’t have this problem before, but now it’s kind of bothering me and i’m leaving a 4 star review because it’s a good app, but I hope that someone can get this issue sorted out.

title: Killing their own app
review: Half the reason I even bought into HBO Max was for the variety of animation available and the high quality creative original shows like Raised by Wolves and Summer Camp Island, but lately they’ve been pulling these shows left and right for tax write off purposes and destroying the livelihoods of artists and creators to maximize profits. It’s disgusting and leaves many of these shows with piracy as the only avenue to watch them anymore. I would rather directly support the creators of these shows by watching their shows legally but I have 0 brand loyalty to Warner/discovery, I’ll be going wherever their talent goes next, bye bye.

title: Great content; lousy app
review: Love HBO shows, but the app is maddening. It’s extremely inconsistent. I can watch a few episodes with no issues. Then there will be several days in a row where I can barely make it through an episode because it’s buffering so badly. It gets especially glitchy towards the end of an episode. It’s almost impossible to watch sometimes. I’ll switch from the app on my smart tv to AirPlay from my phone. Sometimes it works; sometimes it doesn’t. No issues with my internet or other streaming services. It’s insanely frustrating.

title: Using on iPad is a pain
review: 4 stars because my only complaint is that I’m forced to use in landscape when on my iPad. I use my iPad for art, so when I open a streaming app it’s usually just to cast to my tv. I know that turning my tablet 90 degrees is not a huge deal, but it’s still irritating when I don’t have to deal with it on any other streaming service. DEVS: please consider allowing either orientation for those of us not watching on the device.

title: Excellent. Apple TV functionality is fine.
review:
App works fine both on Apple TV 4K and iPad Pro 5th generation 12.9. No complaints. Streaming is never interrupted or slow. Content is superb.

I have read many of the recent reviews.  You can’t pan HBO for your lack of knowledge on how to use. Many complaints have nothing to do with this app. Rather issues are with settings on personal mobile devices.

developerResponse: {'id': 30359920, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for taking the time to share this experience with us. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly for in depth help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - hsubbsiekns - under Web Handle. Thanks! HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-06-14T20:31:50Z'}
title: App usability and functionality is garbage
review: Worst app on planet earth I would rather pay Netflix and every other platform $50 a month than use this garbage again. I downloaded movies for a flight, they don’t load. I pay for internet and try to delete the app and redownload it - “connection error”. I go to hbo max on safari, doesn’t load. Meanwhile every other service loads fine and it lets me download the app so clearly I have service. ABSOLUTE garbage who ever created the app needs to be fired sorry. We’re in an age where everything can be streamed it shouldn’t be this much of an issue. If I could give 0 stars I would.

developerResponse: {'id': 29611200, 'body': "Hi there, we have some great troubleshooting steps here that should help with your app crashing: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-tv. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thanks! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-05-07T13:56:21Z'}
title: Outages and Bugs
review: The HBO Max app is very buggy on an Apple TV, often at peak viewing times (for instance. 7pm on a Friday night, or when The Batman is first on). Every ten minutes, if that, it’ll suddenly quit and blame *you* for the outage (“Check your internet connection” — hmmm, we have a 1GB WiFi signal that works beautifully with literally every other steaming service …) This is definitely an HBO server-side or app error. It’s getting annoying. I think HBO is becoming the victim of its own success — too much demand, not enough server or dev resources. Getting this right should be a top priority for them.

developerResponse: {'id': 28409898, 'body': "Hi Aaron, we're happy to help. We have some great troubleshooting steps here that should improve your experience: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-04-16T21:39:25Z'}
title: Worst streaming app ever
review:
What can I say that hundreds of others haven’t already said. This app is an embarrassment to modern streaming technology. How in the world can a company with so much money make something so incredibly crappy? Is it on purpose? Is it a practical joke? Get it together HBO. The users of this app are actually PAYING FOR THE CONTENT WE CANT WATCH!!

UPDATE: after taking the advice of the “developers” comment on every single review, no matter what the complaint, none of it works. Your app is terrible. Get your %#*! together. This is absurd. There is zero excuse for how unworkable and bad this app is. 
My one star review remains and I’d give you zero, were it possible.

developerResponse: {'id': 28641987, 'body': "Hi, we're happy to help. We have some great troubleshooting steps here that should improve your experience: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. You also may want to try restarting your network (modem and router) if you haven't yet. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-18T11:58:14Z'}
title: Offline?
review:
Follow-up: issue resolved.

I was literally in mid-episode when it simply quit and told me I was offline. Which I am not. I checked the app on another device and got the same message. I checked my connection to confirm and I was not offline. Now I can’t even get the app to launch in any of my devices. All other streaming apps on all my devices are working fine. What gives???

title: Privacy is not an option
review: As many people know we live in a world full of scammers and internet thieves. One of the options is regular people can use to fight off those people is a VPN. HBO Max does not allow VPNs and therefore doesn’t work no matter what country you’re in. In my case, I tried using in another country and the account was IP locked and could not be reset even after logging out of all profiles. I attempted to use it again when I got back to the US and it still wouldn’t work. If you plan on using a VPN or moving to another country don’t buy this service or use this app. It’s a waste of time and money.

developerResponse: {'id': 27730858, 'body': "Hi Dave, it’s really important to us that you have a positive experience with HBO Max. I'd like to dig into what happened and find a solution. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - DaveRocky21 - where it asks for your Web Handle and also provide us with your previous case number, if you can. We look forward to working with you. Thank you. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-01-29T01:59:49Z'}
title: Terrible stream and customer service
review:
Lots of buffering and error codes that appear. 

I couldn’t enjoy a movie for a whole month. Contacted a CS agent and they blamed me and my internet when I went through all their advice: restart modem, call your internet provider, update your smart tv. I did all of that and nothing was wrong, all other streaming services ran perfect like Disney+, Netflix, Hulu,etc. I ask the agent if there was anything they could do to help me… anyway I can get a month free because I paid $15 dollars (overpriced) and couldn’t watch anything? They told me no so I cancelled the subscription. 

Company only cares about the money!

developerResponse: {'id': 27359129, 'body': "Hi, we're happy to help. We have some great troubleshooting steps here that should improve your experience: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-tv. You also may want to try restarting your network (modem and router) if you haven't yet. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact, so we can take a closer look with you. Thanks, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-01-10T23:29:26Z'}
title: Don’t Waste Your Money
review:
This is the worst streaming app on the market. The sound doesn’t load sometimes. It takes forever to load and buffer. Streaming quality is horrendous and never catches up. It’s like watching TV in the 90’s. Before someone thinks anything, it is only this app. I have a brand new high quality TV, the newest version of Apple TV and all the other streaming apps work perfectly fine. 

The selection of shows and movies are great, but you can never watch them or it’s painful to watch them because of poor quality. If HBO wants to the digital age with their app they need to invest more in the backend developing.

developerResponse: {'id': 31578090, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that you have a great experience using HBO Max, and an advocate would be happy to reach out to help you directly. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - sir luigi - where it asks for your Web Handle. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-08-21T22:53:08Z'}
title: App needs some work
review: I love HBO max, it has a ton if great movies and shows, but the app needs some fixing. I don't have the best wifi but its enough to run all the other streaming services just fine, but for some reason HBO max is always laggy or just not even working at all. Also im not sure if this is just me but the download speed seems incredibly slow. I remember I was right next to my router and it still took like half an hour to download a 2hr movie (during the half hour download I received multiple errors telling me the download had stopped).

See this article for some common tips and tricks: http://itsh.bo/max-downloads. If you have any additional questions, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact. Thank you! HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-06-02T15:45:01Z'}
title: Great App… Unless you want to actually watch anything.
review:
What good does an entertainment app do if you can’t watch downloaded content when you are not connected to the Internet?  

In preparation for an airplane trip, I downloaded several episodes of a favorite show so I could watch then on the flight.  As luck would have it, the plane’s Internet service was not functioning properly, and the HBO MAX app will not (apparently) allow you to launch the app without Internet access.  

I knew this had been an issue with the app several versions ago, but put my misplaced optimism that the issue(s) had been resolved.

developerResponse: {'id': 29073479, 'body': "Hi, thank you for taking the time to rate and review. We strive to provide the best experience possible and we always appreciate feedback. We'll make sure to pass this on to the rest of our team. To share feedback or feature requests please feel free to use our feedback form here: https://help.hbomax.com/feedback", 'modified': '2022-04-10T05:30:18Z'}
title: Who is paying for this service???
review: I decided to join for a month and paid for the basic plan. I assumed that nobody would be dumb enough to pop ads during the movie I wanted to watch. Boy was I wrong! It seems like it stops every 15 minutes to play an ad… Why am I paying for this service and being blasted by these utterly absurd ads… How does a company justify treating their customers like this? And how does such a company keep their customers?!?!? They bilked be out of $9.99 for this “service”, but won’t ever see another penny from me. How did “services” like this become worse than cable! When is enough enough?

title: Does not allow sign in with provider.
review: I’ve had this app for a very long time with no issues. Last week the app signed me out on its own accord and I am unable to sign back in. Whenever I click “sign in with provider” the three spinning dots appear and Nothing else happens. I’ve updated my phone. Restarted it. Reinstalled the app several times and the issue persists. There’s no support info available for this issue other that “reinstall app” leaving me unable to use the app altogether.

developerResponse: {'id': 19834861, 'body': 'Good news! HBO Max is now available on Roku streaming devices. You can download the HBO Max app from the Roku Channel Store by searching for HBO Max.\xa0Once downloaded, you can choose to sign in or subscribe. If you have any questions, please let us know. HBO Max support is available to help 24/7.', 'modified': '2022-05-16T11:47:06Z'}
title: Downloaded Titles
review: When downloading still very crash heavy. As in set one title to download and if you opt to select as little as one other title the entire app crashes. The download feature itself also rarely ever seems to work. I always get a notice of “do you want to stream over cellular connection” when I attempt to watch and it 100% does not work fully offline like you can on other streaming apps for title downloads. Of note, all of these issues have been persistent since launch.

title: Hbo max kills animation
review:
To go from one of the best streaming services to one of the worst in a matter of days is quite something, and y’all managed to do it. 

Removing animated shows that took years of work with no regard for the creators and artists who worked on it to save pennies in the business world? Y’all should be ashamed of yourselves and your cruelty towards your former artists and creators. They deserve better.

I was considering subscribing to watch these shows again, because by god does infinity train deserve it, but instead you’ve lost a customer’s wallet and respect. I’m sure there are plenty others who have or will follow suit.

developerResponse: {'id': 31567656, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your interest in HBO Max content. As the newly formed company of Warner Bros. Discovery, we will eventually be bringing HBO Max and discovery+ together. As we take steps to deliver an even better streaming offering, we will be at times modifying our available shows and movies. Thank you! ^HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-08-20T15:44:10Z'}
title: Disappointed with this platform’s treatment of their animated content
review: I considered HBO Max to be my favorite streaming platform in terms of variety of content. That is, until I was watching one of their Max original animated series and out of nowhere, it and a bunch of other animated shows were purged from the platform without any warning. Not even a “Last Chance” notice or anything, just gone. Didn’t even get to finish it. From what I understand, not even the shows’ creators were aware of this until it happened. Unless you’re a diehard for Euphoria or whatever, I’d strongly recommend streaming elsewhere.

developerResponse: {'id': 30443481, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username jmcdaniel821 where it asks for your Web Handle. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-06-20T05:29:11Z'}
title: Awesome content, questionable app
review:
HBO produces amazing content and acquires the rights to stream great movies. However, it’s extremely frustrating to deal with an app that almost never works. While there are innumerable small but manageable bugs, the biggest are:

Airplay - Frequent  connection issues that are not a problem for other apps on my phone

Airplane mode - Even if I have downloaded all  episodes and set my phone to airplane mode, the app frequently gets stuck on the loading screen and will not load any content until I connect to Internet

An advocate would also be happy to reach out to you directly for more in depth help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview Thanks! HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-06-17T15:46:40Z'}
title: Paranoia spoils app
review:
This is a needy app. It invalidates downloads without notice, and fails to play downloads because it can't connect to the internet. Don't bother loading up anything you want to play beyond today, because it will invalidate the download very quickly. This has got to be due to HBOs paranoid fear that you'll somehow actually get the value you pay for their service.

Also, it limits you on the number, not volume, of downloads. So forget about downloading your kids 15 minutes shows for vacation watching, it will eat up all your downloads allowed.

Worthless app burdened by corporate paranoia.

title: Great content, buggy and a technical disaster
review: I have had HBO Max for a while and like to download content for my travel.   Sad, there is a consistent inability to play any content that I spend time to download.  It either errors out, or deletes the downloads I have had in my profile, or wont renew.  It’s constant, it happens all the time, and for the past 10 trips there isn’t one where I haven’t had a show error out 1/2 way into it and then I am unable to watch the rest, or where all of the shows I downloaded haven’t been playable.   If it wasn’t included in my AT&T phone plan I would have cancelled long ago.

developerResponse: {'id': 28514252, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username kch019 where it asks for your Web Handle.', 'modified': '2022-03-11T11:36:58Z'}
title: Glitch central
review: I have watched a few movies and series on this app and so far it has so many bugs and glitches it’s sometimes painful. The app will not open on my phone and it just has three dots and no amount of restarting or rebooting has helped it just works or doesn’t with hours between. Then a streaming glitch where it’ll freeze and hiccup when fast forwarding or rewinding or pausing and I’ve had the same glitch on my tv, phone and laptop. My internet connection is great and other streaming services don’t have this issue.

If you have any additional questions, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you. Thank you! HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-05-07T16:45:20Z'}
title: Frustrating
review:
This has got to be the worst app of any streaming service I use.   It constantly crashes every time I try to download content for offline viewing. I’m lucky to get one short episode downloaded before it crashes several times in a row, even after force closing it between attempts. 
  It’s hard to believe with all their resources they can’t seem to get this app  fixed. It’s been a ongoing problem for a long time. 
  I really don’t need a reply from customer service giving me “helpful hints”. None of them work, it’s just a poorly written app that they can’t seem to get fixed.

HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-05-07T15:08:19Z'}
title: Hbo Max
review: I live in Mexico and basically surrounded by a bunch of mountains so my internet is trash but i have no problems with other streaming apps like Netflix or Disney plus, i even play smash brothers online and it works good sometimes so i can be shure that the app developers are far away from how good hbo’s catalogue of stuff is because as a huge batman fan i wish i could see everything without having problems with everything like i try to download something and the app freezes i try to skip or change something and it takes so long sometimes I just watch something else on other apps

title: Criterion Collection too if you can find it.
review:
I had no idea that HBO Max has many Criterion Collection movies as well but you wouldn’t know this unless you got lucky and happened to find this. It’s not one of the Hubs like Studio Ghibli or DC Comics but it should be. 

One small nitpick here: you need more titles with Audio Description. I’m not visually impaired but I watch many programs while doing errands and I cannot always see the phone screen. I’m sure I’m not the only one.

title: Skips from beginning kg movie to the next video or end of movie. Plus it takes forever to load.
review: There’s been a chronic issue when trying to watch content. Either the video takes 20+ minutes to stop buffering and actually play your content, or the video buffers for 20+ minutes and immediately goes to the very end of the stream so you have no chance to begin the film or show. This happens when there are no issues with the internet connection, in the same room as the router, and no other issues watching content on other streaming services.

developerResponse: {'id': 28306822, 'body': "Hi, we have some great troubleshooting steps here that should help with the app crashing: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-01T03:35:12Z'}
title: i hate it.
review:
Honestly what kind of app, only lets you view a movie if you download it or use wifi. that alone makes the app feel old. also even when i’m connected to wifi, which i use my wifi all the time and never have problems. the app glitches while using it. Also downloading half the time is a bust. error message after error message. this is lame. 

update. i almost felt bad for leaving a bad review. (the first app so bad that i actually left a bad review on it) FINALLY got the app to allow me to download something, went to view the show. app crashed. 3 freaking times. good quality. NOT.

developerResponse: {'id': 27502025, 'body': "Hi, we're happy to help. We have some great troubleshooting steps here that should improve your experience: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-01-18T04:45:24Z'}
title: Keeps changing languages after episodes
review: So this is a new problem. I like to watch South Park a lot on Tv through my iPhone with Apple Air Play. After an episode finishes the next one starts in what sounds like Spanish or a similar dialect. Ether way when I go to the app to select English it is already set to that yet it’s playing in another language. I have to close the app completely  to get it to play in English again. Weird new bug honestly. Thanks for hosting one of my favorite shows though. (South Park)

title: Much better for battery since update
review: I used to have significant performance and battery issue with the app, but since coming back to it recently, it's been much better. Some things are still a little weird, like how content reloads pretty much whenever I switch apps, then switch back, even fairly briefly, but that's very minor compared to the other problems that they seem to have fixed.

title: Latest Update?
review:
Suddenly, the app has changed format in the last week sometime (?) and the change is not an improvement. For example, if I’ve downloaded a series, it no longer tracks how much of the episodes I’ve watched (with a bar underneath) nor does it list the Season or Episode number. Information about the episode is also not spaced so that you can see it all—weird. 

This app has never worked smoothly, but now it’s more than irritating—it’s maddening. Why can’t it be a pleasure to navigate with all the resources available to HBO or Discovery or whatever IT people are responsible?

title: Good content, terrible app for offline use
review:
If you fly frequently for work, you should pay for another streaming service. If you download titles then ever connect to:
A) An airline’s wifi
B) A VPN (even with the app closed)
Your downloads will immediately become corrupted and you will not be able to watch any of them. Enjoy your 6 hour flight without access to any of the content you diligently downloaded ahead of time. I have contacted the app help desk and got the typical response. This is a major bug that the dev team should be working on.

title: I’m canceling service because of the app.
review: I’m telling this to you in hopes that you fix it so that I may return. But what use is having HBO if I can’t actually consume any of your content? Back in the day, this app used to be decent, and then you insisted on using your own player, etc etc. Now it’s hot garbage. I travel - that’s when I get to watch shows, on my flight. But my download success rate is like 15%. And the rest of the time it just crashes. Seriously, sit everyone who worked on this in a room, and fire them. Then start over. It’s that bad.

developerResponse: {'id': 29073445, 'body': "Hi, thank you for taking the time to rate and review. We strive to provide the best experience possible and we always appreciate feedback. We'll make sure to pass this on to the rest of our team. To share feedback or feature requests please feel free to use our feedback form here: https://help.hbomax.com/feedback", 'modified': '2022-04-10T13:58:26Z'}
title: Return to the Old Poster Selection UI
review: The content is great and the last update does so far feel more efficient. But please go back to using Apple’s Poster UI in your selection screens for the Apple TV’s version of the app. The new purple highlight rectangle is obviously a choice for other TV OS that use a remote with regular buttons. But the Apple TV remote has a touch pad, the two do not mix well. The purple rectangle feels restrictive and slower compared to before the update. I don’t feel a great browsing experience in this version. Please consider going back on that single choice.

We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - Eddieuscg - where it asks for your Web Handle. Thank you. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-02-14T05:24:52Z'}
title: Terrible customer service, terrible app.
review: Works for a few days, then displays “not available in your region yet”. I live in NJ. Same message on iPhone and Xbox. No, I am not using a VPN. Yes, I deleted and reinstalled app. Same problem when using cellular data or Wi-Fi on Xbox. I’ve called customer service several times. Once I was transferred to T1 help, then disconnected, no call back. Then called backed, told case was escalated, would contact me. I received an email a few hours later asking me the same questions I answered on the phone. That was three days ago. App still not working. I just wanna watch my shows that I pay for.

developerResponse: {'id': 27901461, 'body': 'Hi there! I want you to know that we are working on improving our offline viewing feature for you. We would love to hear more about your experience so we can really dig into this situation and work towards a resolution. We would appreciate it if contacted us at help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username Poop2000 where it asks for your Web Handle. Thanks so much!', 'modified': '2022-02-07T17:03:11Z'}
title: Do better.
review: I’m pleased that the service, in general, crashes less, so I’m giving it two stars instead of one. As far as the app goes, what’s the point of downloading content if you can’t watch it offline without logging on first? I downloaded a few episodes of Succession to watch on an airplane. It didn’t work, so I paid for airplane internet to see if it would get it going, but to no avail. All I could see were STOP symbols displayed over each episode. Compared to every other streaming app that I use, this one is leagues below the rest.

title: Great contents but horrible offline mode
review: This has overall good contents but very bad experience when going offline (no internet connection) and trying to use downloaded contents. I could only access the downloaded contents once while on the air plane. Somehow the app was not able to load. It got stuck every time while trying to load the app. I even tried restarting the app and my phone, nothing worked. I am software engineer myself, and this shouldn’t be hard to implement (unless there’s some legality that I am not aware of).

title: A fatal mistake
review: Because this app automatically opens when trying to do anything in the website on a mobile device, it is impossible to sign into HBO max on your tv.  It is also not an option I sign in directly on tv.  As big as a company HBO is I would think they would be able to think of things like that when creating an app.  It is absolutely a horrible flaw that drowns out any positive review for this app, all content and UI is in the shadow of this massive flaw.  If you do not own a Pc or laptop, you will have to go down to your local library real quick and sign in there.

title: HELP!!!
review:
This is what I call a desperate cry to HBO “please get it together”. I love the content but have recently lost my mind using this app. I’m not sure what’s happening in your product & Engg department, but I find it hard to believe that there is a lack of resources to build an app. 

I am paying for the subscription and keep getting an error that the APP can’t validate my email address or subscription. The app keeps resetting in a loop and giving me the same message. It’s like I’m stuck in a horror movie where the scene keeps repeating. To escape from this nightmare I did what I could.

Troubleshooted by closing, deleting, and reinstalling the app. Still does not work, same issue. Software is up to date. 

Not only has this app been EXTREMELY SLOW now it is UNUSABLE!

Do I see user retention problems in HBOs future? Yes, because they can’t get the app to work. Every other streaming app works fine. I’m canceling the service if a fix is not pushed soon.

developerResponse: {'id': 27815107, 'body': 'Good news! You can now use the Pinch-to-Zoom gesture to make shows and movies fill the screen on your iOS device. Download the latest HBO Max update and let us know if you have any questions.', 'modified': '2022-02-03T02:50:29Z'}
title: They listened to my review!
review:
This has potential to be a 5 star app. The content is always amazing and I love how new movies are on it as well. Not being able to utilize my whole 13 pro max screen is very disheartening. Pinch to zoom is all this app is missing. Please add this feature in a software update. Please!!!!

UPDATE: you can now pinch to zoom to make it full screen! Thanks HBO MAX! Now you get 5 stars!

title: What Happened?
review:
This app has been working great until recently. Wei open the app, I get a message that says it cannot verify my subscription, that my user name or password are wrong. When I click OK, to correct it, I keep getting the same message. There’s no way to correct the problem.

Update: called custom service, and got it resolved within days. Thank you HBO!

title: Can’t access downloads
review: There were no probs at all while using at home in US. Then I had to travel and downloaded new Fantastic beasts movie on my device. Just when I watched like 3/4 of the movie, it just froze. In tge middle of my flight. Even after I landed and could access Wifi i cant watch my downloads,the app says that I am out of the region but still watch my downloads though 🤷🏼‍♀️🤷🏼‍♀️🤷🏼‍♀️ while no probs at allll with my netflix downloads. Netflix will be my go to on travels then.

title: Poor performance
review: Of the different streaming services this one has been consistently the most unreliable for me and I’m considering dropping the service. Says cannot play videos more often than it actually plays and I have to click on a title maybe 15 times before it plays and restart the app multiple times. Near every time a new episode starts playing for a series, it will stop playing and says it cannot play try again later. It’s just not reliable for a mainstream streaming service. Hands down my least favorite for how often I cannot play videos.

title: Are you kidding me
review: Every time this needs an update it completely stops working. It even stops working on my smart TVs as well. And some genius decided that the sign in through the web browser should be a frickin redirect button to the App Store? What idiot made that decision? If there isn’t an option to sign in then don’t make it seem like there is one. Do you people not test these things before sending them out? I wouldn’t buy a car if it only worked once in a blue moon. And I wouldn’t use a mechanic if my car stopped working AFTER they worked on it. Save your money and just pirate.

title: Fix the app
review: HBO is a big name in premium entertainment. That’s what makes it hard to understand why the app is so sub par. The selection is great, price is right, the presentation and interface are all on point. It’s the technical bugs that are a problem, specifically that the app continually fails to recognize a functioning internet connection. I can click the same episode of a show more than 20 times to finish an episode because of the frequent crashing. The quality of this application does not reflect the strength of the HBO brand.

I’m always trying to watch Expensive movies and I can watch on the big screen

title: Do the developers use their own app?
review:
This app kills me. Have to sign into the TV service several times a week to properly use the app. And it’s not clear what the issue is. You have to spend time figuring out how to sign in or why there are suddenly ads in the shows. 

Don’t bother downloading content to watch on a flight.  The app won’t work offline. Not sure why they provide the option to download things. 

And, subtitles turn on randomly. They won’t stay off. Leave the app and relaunch it.  Subtitles on. Next episode. Subtitles on. Holy Cow!

title: App keeps crashing.
review: It keeps force closing whenever I try to watch season 1 episode 5 of Euphoria. It was working fine for the previous ones. It played other titles fine, but now it keeps force-closing or saying “try again later” when I try to watch anything. It also won’t let me log in to my iPad nor my mom’s phone (since we have a family plan). I’m afraid if I log out, I won’t be able to log in either. We have this service through a provider (Spectrum), yet it redirects us to the create account page when we try to log in through a provider. Please fix asap.

title: Downloaded shows do not work when offline
review: I downloaded several episodes of Raised by Wolves. Watched about half of the second episode about 30 minutes into my flight. The app became unresponsive so I restarted it. While in airplane mode the app would never get past the purple splash screen. Tried restarting my iPad twice, killed the app and restarted. Never gets past the splash screen. What is the point of downloading shows if you can’t watch them offline?!?!

title: Content restricted error
review: This app is suddenly blocking all content due to parental controls. I have verified no parental controls were in place, turned them on and allowed all ratings, turned them off, updated the app, deleted and reinstalled the app all to no avail. I have deleted all profiles, tried recreating new adult profiles, created a kid profile allowing all ratings and  I still cannot watch any content. HBO support redirected to Apple support but I have no parental restrictions there either. I turned this on, allowed all ratings and turned it off again.  No action will allow any content to be viewed.

title: Customer Service is AWFUL and unprofessional
review: I reached out via chat function today because my streaming hadn’t worked for over 24 hours. Instead of helping me, the person decided to waste my time asking about the troubleshooting I’d already completed, then said they would forward my information to a “Specialize Support Team.” Note specialize not specialized! Based on his refusal to provide a response time or a refund and his constant yup reply, I’d say they’re not based here in the States. This was confirmed when I called in. Don’t have issues because the customer service is not service at all!

title: Constant loop
review: *** they fixed it****Something is wrong with the app DIRECTV had emails that were crisscrossing so I had to start from scratch but it won’t let me go into the app and update my password it just goes in a loop and says that’s not the right password over and over and over again. I’ve tried to kill the app and rebuild it I tried to go online and just go without an app but it always comes back to the app that goes in the loop and won’t let me reset my password.

title: Where’d it go? 😡
review: If you’re wondering why I’m giving you a bad review, it’s because you did something that literally broke my soul into seven pieces. WHY DID YOU HAVE TO TAKE DOWN HARRY POTTER!? The reason I watched HBO max in the first place was the HP movies, fantastic beasts and where to find them, and in 2022, the secrets of Dumbledore. I get that it’s kinda an old movie, but so many people LOVE it. Its such a good series. Plz plz PLZ put it back. I don’t know what I’ll do to watch HP again. It’s infuriating that you’d take down this series, of all of the older movies on HBO MAX. Except for this inconvenience, it’s an ok app ig.

title: Poorly Working App
review:
A key benefit of having the app vs using the website is the ability to download videos for offline viewing. However, and the same seems to hold for the iPhone app, you need to have a connection in order for the app to load and verify that you have downloads. If you try to watch downloads when there is not a wifi connection the app throws an error saying a connection could not be established.

Additionally, the media controls do not work for the app and a good portion of the time the app is stuck in 4:3 format, even if you enter full screen.

developerResponse: {'id': 31611487, 'body': "Hi, please try these troubleshooting steps here that should improve your experience: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. You also may want to try restarting your network (modem and router) if you haven't yet. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. ^HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-08-23T06:38:17Z'}
title: I was expecting better
review: While the app does allow you to access HBOs content, I was disappointed at its performance, vis-à-vis communication with the streaming system. For me, it regularly freezes during playback, buffering the content. Often it hangs altogether, forcing me to reselect the show I’m watching. When this happens it often looses its place, making me find where I was manually. This happens with fast and slow internet connections, albeit worse on slow or varying connections like a hotel or a car.

title: Not Worthy of HBO’s Standing
review:
While I'd read the casual comments claiming that the HBO Max app needed a top to bottom rewrite, I'd never seen it as that bad. Nevertheless, my recent experience was a HUGE disappointment.

In preparation for an international flight to Crete (11 hours total), I downloaded a season of The Leftovers, the available season 4 episodes of Westworld, and several other series I was eager to catch up on.

Imagine my extreme disappointment to learn that, in order to play each DOWNLOADED episode, the app has to check in with HBO's servers first. This meant I could watch nothing on the entire flight over, and only one episode that I'd queued up for the return flight back. Oh, and while I was on my 10 day vacation, I had to find an open WiFi connection for each episode I wanted to watch.

Good thing I'd also downloaded Ted Lasso in the AppleTV+ app, which worked flawlessly.

title: Not Buggy For Me
review: In fact, this was the only streaming app I could get to work without incessant buffering on an iffy wi-fi connection at a cabin in Alaska. Sleek design, though it can be strenuous for some older TV’s. Would like to thumbs up and down (even if it doesn’t affect recommendations, just for my own memory or to remember I watched something), but besides that—keep up the great content HBO

title: Love HBO, app has problems
review: I don’t want to speak for other devices. HBO max works great on all my other platforms. But when I use it on my apple products, I have nothing but problems. Mostly it freezes, then needs to be reloaded and will usually freeze within an episode of whatever it is I’m watching. Thought it could be connection, but I’ve had the same result on multiple different networks. I could speculate that it’s an apple issue, but I don’t know. I only know the app doesn’t work the way it is supposed to and improvements need to be made to keep it from freezing.

title: App jumps directly to end of episode
review: In the last two weeks, I have had trouble playing videos on the app. Regardless of whether I have ever watched a particular episode/movie, playing it results in the app freezing for several seconds, and then jumping directly to the last few seconds of the program, and initiating the “play next episode” sequence. If I am able to pause it in time, then I can rewind it and play from the start, but otherwise it goes to the next episode. I have tried removing and reinstalling the app, shutting down and restarting the iPad, etc., to no avail.

title: Why Download Content That Needs Internet To Watch?
review: I regularly have to work out in the country where there is no internet, no wifi, and no cell service. I download movies/tv shows onto my iPad to watch at night. Most services work great but the HBO Max app has to be intermittenly refreshed through internet or cell service or the downloaded movies stop working. What is the purpose of downloading movies if you need internet/cell service? I have given up on using the download feature because it does not work consisitently.

developerResponse: {'id': 31875565, 'body': "Hi there, we understand how that can be frustrating. We do however have a workaround for this you can try: download content, don't watch/playback at all, force close the app, turn on airplane mode, then open the app. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at our help center: https://help.hbomax.com/us-en/Home/Index. Thanks! - HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-09-06T18:17:46Z'}
title: Downloads?
review: This app is the absolute worst. Its as if once you entire an airplane and try to access your downloads, the app completely crashes. It will take 25 minutes just to open and load the download screen, then your unable to select anything you’ve downloaded. It happens on every single flight and I’m never able to watch the stuff I downloaded. Netflix is so seamless. It has been happening for month on multiple flights. The minute you get off the plane, it will work. What’s the point of downloading!!! Fox your app. No wonder you can’t compete..

title: Terrible App
review:
I downloaded this app so I could watch movies when I don’t have access to Wi-Fi. I downloaded several movies and it will not play any of them.
I called to see if there was a known bug or if I had possibly done something incorrectly with the settings .  They were as confused as I was as to why it wasn’t working. They could offer me no help and no explanation. So it was a useless call. 
Everything is up to date and this has been an ongoing issue for months with me periodically trying to see if it magically works. 
The plug should seriously be pulled on this app…it’s awful!!

title: Zero consistency
review:
The app it’s self is very buggy. I can sign into the app with my email and password. When I enter the same information in a web browser I am told my email address or password is incorrect. It would be nice to have a service that consistently works since I am paying for it. 

At this point I am considering canceling my subscription as this is not the first time something like this has happened. 

Please take the time to look over the customer reviews and fix the issues. There is a reason why this app has a 2.8 rating out of 5 stars. Sub par at best.

review: Downloaded some episodes to watch offline on a long plane ride…got on the plane and even though the episodes are showing up in the downloads folder they will not play unless my device is connected to the internet. I downloaded the app solely for this purpose and if doesn’t work properly this app is useless to me. I tried a number of different fixes suggested both by HBO max help center and others I found from several other people online who seem to have the same issue. Nothing worked.

title: I love HBO but this app is killing me!
review: Absolutely love HBO and the shows they have to offer, but for the love of god I cannot download anything on this app at all. The only reason I got this app on my phone was for airplane rides. Unfortunately, this is my 3rd time traveling and attempting to download content for the plane ride. The download meter starts and then simply just never moves or makes any progress. I’ve tried downloading at home on WiFi and on LTE but nothing. It just doesn’t work and it’s a shame.

title: NOT WORTH IT
review: I’m getting HBO max for free and even then it’s not worth my time. It seems to work fine but the movie catalog resembles Netflix at times. I only seen King Kong vs Godzilla and the new matrix movie. Everything else this app has I don’t care for. Seems the new movies have stopped coming in. I wanted to see the new bill and Ted movie and it’s not even on here anymore. I thought it made its premiere on HBO max few years ago??? I don’t understand why they take off movies and add others? They have limited storage on their hard drives or something? That was one thing I hated Netflix for and now it’s done on here again.

developerResponse: {'id': 23317288, 'body': 'Hi there! We released an update to our Apple TV app to resolve the issues you have been experiencing. Please update the app in your Apple TV App Store and let us know if there’s anything else we can help you with.', 'modified': '2022-05-11T03:39:33Z'}
title: Constant Can’t Connect Errors Since Redesign
review:
I’m so fed up and about to cancel because I’ve barely been able to use the service since the redesign for Apple TV. 

Ever since the new “new” app, about 10-15 minutes into anything I watch, the app stops with a Can’t Connect to HBO Max error. Every time without fail. I retry and the same thing happens. It’s gotten so tiring I just don’t use it anymore and I see no reason  to keep throwing money at a non-functioning service. 

I am on the ad-free plan and I feel like ever since they tried to change the service  to serve ads for lower tier customers, it’s been trash for their premium paying customers since. It’s not fair we get a broken experience because your coders cannot deliver a functioning app. 

You are not the only streaming service, for goodness sakes, steal some people who managed to deliver functioning apps for the others and have them fix this mess. It’s so frustrating!!!

If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thanks, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-04-21T04:56:17Z'}
title: Literally no “play” button on every show
review: After working fine for months, the app is suddenly unusable. The “play” button has disappeared from any and all content, making impossible watch anything. The option to download a show remains but even once download, shows cannot be played because the “play” arrow is nowhere to be found. I’ve tried restarting my phone, logging in and out, uninstalling the app, but nothing fixes it. This issue has apparently been happening to other users for months and has yet to be addressed. Ridiculous

title: We need Shareplay now!
review:
It has been a few months since Apple introduced share-play to the public. Few apps that support this like apple music, apple tv+, Disney + and etc, are already bringing the magic of sharing movies with your love ones. However, this app still doesn’t support it. BRING IT ON!!  

Other than that, one of the best streaming services BY FAR.

title: Seriously need to repair this app.
review: I haven’t been having issues with this app until recently. Certain titles it just won’t load but I can play them on other devices like the Roku and fire tv. Also today I literally had 2 HBO max app icons on my Home Screen and they both worked to open the app! That’s the strangest thing I have ever seen. Picture in Picture is no longer working either. I last used it maybe back in October/November 2021. Please get it together!

title: Sign in with provider
review: Love this app. Content is great. But I had gotten a new phone so it logged me out of the app and I cannot sign back in. I can’t get past the loading icon after you click sign on with providers. It does not get past that screen. Just keeps loading and loading. I’ve deleted the app and downloaded it again. Still same issue. HBO please fix this!!!!!  I know someone else with the same exact issue. This needs to be corrected

title: App stopped logging in!
review: As a 20+ year subscriber, I was so happy when HBO came out with an app that I can use to access my HBO favorites.  I used to love app so much, but last week it logged me out and won’t reconnect.  When I hit the “connect with cable supplier” button it just spins.  Doesn’t even as for my credentials.   I’m super frustrated as I am recovering from surgery and was looking forward to having HBO to watch.  I spent over an hour with HBO customer service and no one was able to help me.  Promised a follow up email , but nothing yet.  I know it isn’t my account as the app on my appleTV works fine.  Boooo!

title: Garbage app
review: Without question, the worst app I’ve ever downloaded. It simply doesn’t work; 9 times out of 10, I cannot watch anything. It gives the same error almost every time and says to contact them if it persists. It can barely load anything over even good wifi. Most ridiculous of all: I often cannot open the “downloads” page when I’m offline. It says I need to have a connection….to view content I download already. What is the point even? Developers must start over from the beginning. There has never been a worse media player.

title: Great content, currently buggy
review: This has some of the best content but this latest iteration is very buggy. Can’t see the content, messages stating the login criteria is not correct only for it to be correct when I close the app and return to it, it gives the three dots showing it is trying to load the content only for the three dots to go away and then no content appears.

title: No Support Response to Problems
review:
After reading a review from LAST YEAR that covered all the frustrating app issues (very , very slow functionality, occasional crashes) it is clear that no attempt has been made to address these problems. 

Yes, the content is pretty good, but I’m resenting the amount of time I am forced to watch spinning dots EVERY time I click. It’s so bad that I often click again. This app doesn’t come close to the easy navigation of Prime or Netflix. Will likely be dropping the service if it continues.

title: Horrible app
review: I really enjoy HBO in general. They produce great content and always have a nice selection of rotating movies. Their app in the other hand is awful and I’m surprised they haven’t made more of an attempt to correct this. Movies don’t download after repeated attempts and then eventually they do after you spend a load of time retrying. Many of these attempts lead to the app shutting itself down. Then there are issues playing downloaded content when an internet connection isn’t available. Lack of an internet connection is why I download programs in the first place!

title: App bugs?
review: I believe this app has bugs? every time i try to launch the app, it pops with can’t verify ur subscription and says to try again but when i press try again it does it once again. i have logged into my account from other devices and there seems to be no issue. i’ve tried deleting the app and re-downloading it and there’s no success with fixing the issue. can’t log in from the website either cuz it default launches the app. the app horrible but the service is great i suppose .

title: Severely decreased efficiency
review: There is a bug for the iPad mini that didn’t used to exist.  Movies and even HBO’s own series take forever to load for viewing!!!  I don’t mean download, I mean just to view!  Most times they don’t load at all!  This is happening for the last month or so.  The app works fine on my iPhone as do other streaming services on my iPad mini, so this is definitely an HBOMax app issue with the iPad mini.  Please fix or go back to previous versions that didn’t have this most irritating and frustrating bug!!!

title: Great content, confusing UX
review:
I love the shows the app provides, but it can be super frustrating to use. The seasons in a multi season show are only differentiated by bold or not bold. 

Upon completing an episode, it seems just as likely that it will restart that episode as it is that it will play the next one.  

Also, to get to the menu of episodes, you have to navigate to the “more episodes” which may or may not land you in the season you’re watching currently.  

We just enjoyed a binge of Luther but watching them in order took a lot of extra work. Possibly because we switch from our Bedroom TV to our outside TV but other viewing apps seem to know what’s next without so much manual labor.  Thanks for the shows though!

developerResponse: {'id': 28323067, 'body': "Hi, we have some great troubleshooting steps here that should help with your app crashing: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-02T01:11:48Z'}
title: Worst streaming app out there
review: It crashes constantly making it pointless to download. You can’t even watch the shows or movies that you’ve downloaded because the app will crash. You’ll get random error messages and have to keep closing and re-opening the app. After the app crashes, it’ll start whatever you were watching from the beginning only. Good luck remembering the exact time stamp. 2 years since the launch of HBO Max and they haven’t fixed this dumpster fire of a streaming app. These problems aren’t new. They’re just not getting fixed.

developerResponse: {'id': 27358786, 'body': "Hi, thanks for the review! We're always looking for ways to improve the app and streaming experience for our customers. Thank you, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-01-10T22:53:18Z'}
title: Glitchy, Slow to load, no Picture in Picture feature
review: I subscribed to be able to binge watch Sex and the City but quickly learned it’s not as easy to binge on this app as others. The app is super slow to load and somehow skipped me through a bunch of episodes? Also there’s no Picture in Picture feature which is a huge bummer when you’re trying to binge on your phone since you can’t open other apps. Hope they fix these things soon or I’ll probably have to cancel it :/

HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-05-07T16:19:44Z'}
title: Decent Menu UI but terrible reliability
review:
Where to start. It came a long way from its beginnings but it’s got plenty of room to grow even with the April 2022 release. Issues I’ve noticed so far:

-Doesn’t keep the right play state on MyList between devices including when you finish a series. -Sometimes it’s loading screen stays there with moving dots on certain in demand or high peak titles and doesn’t error out or give you status
-Sometimes home doesn’t reload or refresh even with background refresh on. You have to terminate app and relaunch
-No ability to save offline like Netflix for portable viewing at least temporarily for trips
-No ability to filter or sort by audience rating with a search
-No ability to thumbs up or down to reduce some terrible recommendations
