You also may want to try restarting your network (modem and router) if you haven't yet. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. - HBO MAX Support", 'modified': '2022-09-23T01:23:23Z'}
title: Horrible app to download episodes
review: First off, no option to download all episodes in a season. I have to download each episode individually. While doing that, the app kills itself if I queue 3-4 videos for download at a time. I was using 1.2 gbps internet. All pending downloads start again from the beginning. After some time, it logged me out of the app and I lost two of the three somehow downloaded episodes. This is horrible. I had a long flight in some time and I couldn’t download my favorite episodes.

title: Used to be the best.
review: I used to use this app for EVERYTHING. It has dozens of properties that I adore, but ever since merging with Discovery, it’s not only been removing content that fans adore, but removing content that has been exclusive to this platform and have no other way of watching it. On top of that, it has made Cartoon Network remove content of shows it’s removed from their own channels due to licensing conflicts, and canceled dozens of projects that are almost completed for tax returns. This platform needs a change of management, and FAST.

developerResponse: {'id': 28636874, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We want to make sure that using HBO Max is a great experience for you and an advocate would be happy to reach out to you directly to help. If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username hbo max stinks where it asks for your Web Handle.', 'modified': '2022-05-10T21:33:34Z'}
title: The worst streaming app
review:
It is just terrible. Sometimes it just won’t play anything. Sometimes it randomly adds narration when you don’t want it. It really doesn’t want you to watch something someone else in your home has already seen. It just freezes up when you try to start something over. Three more updates since the review above and it still doesn’t work at all half the time.

I am back with another review. I literally cannot use the app today. This thing is the worst.

developerResponse: {'id': 28409945, 'body': "Hi Sammy, thank you for taking the time to rate and review. We have some great troubleshooting steps here that should help with your app crashing: itsh.bo/troubleshoot-mobile. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact so we can take a closer look with you. Thanks, HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-06T23:13:16Z'}
title: Hardly ever works
review: The content on the app is great, if you could actually watch it! It takes forever to load when it wants to work. Other wise it’s constantly crashing or freezing. It takes forever to register any movement while looking at what to watch. If they fixed all the issues with lag and crashing it would be perfect. One star because of how frustrating it is to try to watch anything on it until it’s fixed definitely not worth paying for.

If you're using a browser to stream, please try these steps: http://itsh.bo/browser-playback. If those don't work, please reach out to us at hbom.ax/contact for additional support. Thank you. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-01T05:06:19Z'}
title: SLOW SERVICE?
review: What’s the point in paying $10-$13 a month just for it to lag on my Mac book and to not load on my iPhone? I’ve used other apps and the internets fine, but it takes so long to load or for me to even get to watch anything on HBO. Not to sound like a Karen or anything, but seriously- if we’re all paying money for this can’t we get decent servicing? I’m thinking twice about my subscription right now and just revoking it. Not worth it to spend money on something that doesn’t work it’s worth.

title: Auto play
review: Loving all of the adult swim shows. Only problem I have with the app is that auto play always cuts off the end of an episode short so I can’t ever watch the full ending. Turning off auto play is an option now but then either way I’d be getting up every episode to hit next or stop from auto playing

title: App is buggy
review: HBO gets an A+ for content, but the App though. You really need a functional app to watch the content. Downloads have to be able to work when you have no connectivity; otherwise, why have the downloads? And why have the ability to download, but not actually be able to download? The app works rarely with this. If I am not downloading, why do I need the app most places? I have cable; HBO is actually in a lot of hotel rooms. I don’t need the app except for this type of functionality.

title: Could be easier to navigate.
review: Content is great but for the price I wish the app had more user friendly features like ‘resume from the beginning’ and ‘skip to next episode’ buttons to better navigate the episodes we want to watch. Every click seems to take a couple secs to process, sometimes the skip intro button pops up at odd times.

title: How is it so bad?
review: I know that HBO has to have enough money to throw at tech so that the app won’t be so bad. But why won’t they do it? It’s almost unbearable to use it. I watch as much as possible though my add on on another service’s app but some shows are not available there and I’m forced to use the Max app. Will it or won’t it work this time?…Is always the question. Like why am I always randomly logged out and then get messages that I don’t even have an account? I have to uninstall and reinstall this app a lot.

title: Fallen from the Top Spot
review: in the last few weeks, HBO Max has removed a huge portion of their own shows, including the incredible Infinity Train, despite fully owning these titles. It’s a confusing and hurtful decision for users and show creators, and i can’t support the company any more. at the beginning of the year, I would’ve called HBO Max the previous best option for streaming. Now, it’s easily one of the worst, because no other streaming service has gone out of its way to hurt so many people and subscribers.

title: “Downloading” isn’t an actual thing
review:
Great shows and network.  Trash app.

I usually watch my shows on my hour train commute each way, which equals cell service going in and out, so I use downloads on my streaming apps every day.

Not sure why it still tries to stream over cellular data when I’ve supposedly downloaded it.  When I turn off cell data on my phone, I try to play my download and it tells me “Can’t play title.  We’re having trouble playing this video.”

Even when I get back into cell service or Wi-Fi, the episode will still give me that message every time.  I have to delete the download completely then try again for hopefully a different result.  Happened for 3 of the first 4 episodes of the current season I’m watching.

The only streaming platform app this happens with.
Trash.

title: Good content, terrible app.
review:
I like the content available on the app, it’s just that the app doesn’t work well. It is the worst pay to watch streaming app I have used so far, and I have used most. I have used it with Xbox, fire tv, roku, and the vizio platforms. Similar problems with each. Hangs up, especially when going to commercial, kicks you out of video, and audio desyncs. 

Good content, poor app.

title: Downloads don’t work when offline
review:
Downloaded some filma for a flight on my iPad. The app just crashed and wouldn’t show anything. It got stuck on the loading screen and after 15 mins it just said: you are offline, check connection. Well I was on airplane mode, without wifi… of course I am offline, that is the whole point.

After the flight, I checked the troubleshoot that HBO gives you. I did what was there and the app simply didn’t work.

Netflix has this figured out, so why can’t HBO?

title: Yikes
review: For what you pay for this streaming service - you would think it would work as good as other companies. But nope. Using this on my iPad on a plane - it took nearly 10 minutes to load my downloaded shows. Additionally, when (on Wi-Fi) I click the download button on an episode, the app crashes immediately. When I reopen…I’ll click the download button again and it’ll work. Frustrating app to use for traveling.

title: Good Selection, Struggle with App Execution
review:
The service has a good selection of movies and shows that has stayed strong, the app on the other hand leaves a lot to be desired. 

On both iOS and Apple TV, the app struggles with loading times, continue watching feature doesn’t hold the correct place around 50% of the time, and recently streaming has been crashing. All of this has consistently gotten worse and not better in recent releases

If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username - isaac rollins - under Web Handle. Thanks! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-03-08T23:11:57Z'}
title: Who made this app? A 7th grade coding class?
review: This is by far the buggiest and glitchiest streaming service app I have ever used. It constantly freezes even when I’m the only person using the wifi. Fix the bug with this app and then it might be worth using. There are some great shows on the app but it might take you two hours to watch a thirty minute episode with all the freezing that comes along with the app. Do better Hbo I’m not paying to watch three purple dots come across my screen for an hour straight.

title: Amazing
review: I'm not sure why this has such bad reviews. It's always worked perfectly for me without any problems. The only problem I have with it is that the downloads only last 48 hours. To me, this is quite unfair and pointless as it's literally a download- it's supposed to stay downloaded. Other than that, it works great!

If interested, fill out this form: help.hbomax.com/AppReview and include your username jveulens12 where it asks for your Web Handle. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-08-13T12:48:22Z'}
title: Latest Upate
review: The latest update has messed up playback for downloaded episodes/movies. Now I’m only able to watch downloaded content if I’m on wifi or put my phone into airplane mode. Prior to this I was able to play over cellular (even with stream only on wifi ticked on in the settings). I’ve tried deleting/re-installing, signing out and back in, playing with all the playback setting without success. Not sure what this latest update did but I hope there’s a fix soon!

title: Customer support not responding
review: You updated the app and now it does not work at all. I have reached out to customer support 4 days in a row. I have done everything they asked me to multiple times and yet I am not getting any response from the support specialist that is supposed to be working on my case. I contact them again and they tell me there’s nothing they can do that someone else is working on it and they marked it as top priority but still nothing the app will not let me download or stream anything.

We look forward to working with you. HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-06-26T01:42:38Z'}
title: Still Horrible
review:
Received an email with the link to complete a form. I completed the form and received an email but it wasn’t in a language that I could read. Well that’s not very helpful. What a waste of time.

Update
I called HBOMax and their Custer service was wonderful and resolved my issue.

title: Consistently Terrible App
review:
App is horrible.  If you can find some other way to watch the catalog do it.  Some menus don’t have back or gone buttons, forcing you to quit the app.  Downloads expire in 14 hours, then 20 days, then are expired and there’s a bug preventing you from redownloading.

The worst part?  The app requires internet to start, otherwise will just hang on the logo screen.  So much for downloading videos for offline viewing.

Find another way.

Thank you! HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-05-21T14:24:02Z'}
title: **Update** Issues loading on Apple TV
review:
I have attempted to update, restore Apple TV. As well as update and delete and reinstall app. Every movies gives an “hdmi” error. All other streaming apps work just fine.

I received a response from the developer, which I do appreciate your time, however they just gave me directions to do exactly the same steps that I preformed and clearly stated in the review. Was hoping for a little more of a personalized response that recognized the basic troubleshooting steps had been preformed.

title: App crashes constantly
review: I got this app a couple months ago when I first got HBO max and I only got it for South Park and a couple other shows. But now I am cancelling it because the app whenever trying to download shows it crashes constantly and it has never done that with any other streaming app. Goes to show how poorly made the app was and how the developers don’t care if it crashes when people are trying to enjoy the platform.

title: Extremely upset
review:
I really enjoy the shows on this and that’s the purpose of the star but I cannot watch for a solid episode without my app telling me it has no Wi-Fi connection and to switch to cellular data.
 I’ve restarted, removed the app so many times and it still does it. This is the only app I am have internet connections with. It’s extremely fustrating. I enjoy it so much quality is amazing, when it actually streams its great. 
Not really sure what to do, I looked up ways to fix it but none work.

Thanks, HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-04-22T04:59:17Z'}
title: Downloading is awful
review: I paid extra for the plan that allows downloads and it barely works.  You have to try multiple times to download before download begins, if you try to queue multiple items the app crashes, and if you accidentally click on an item you downloaded, you only have 48 hours to watch.  There is also no option to download an entire season.  You need to download each multiple episode.  The content is decent but the IOS app is flawed.

title: Just ended up deleting the subscription.
review: Loved the app while it worked for the first few days! Would have given 5 stars; but for some reason it blocked from watching shows rated over R on the app. All the adult settings were off and never touched as I was the only on the app. Contact support was no help telling me to just turn off the adult settings when I sent them screen shots of them being off. It ended up blocking my on my tv as well, but there was nothing to turn off. 🤷🏼‍♂️

title: Very mediocre app and very buggy
review: When compared to other streaming platforms, hbo max really has nothing going for it besides DC comics media. The subscription including ads adds more than any other service that I’ve ever used. The app itself is super buggy and videos won’t play at all sometimes even after multiple hard resets. I’d give it one star if it weren’t for some of the quality of these shows such as peacemaker and Harley Quinn.

title: Great app but only works half the time
review: I love being able to watch the great shows and movies that HBO max has to offer.  The problem is that the app only works about half the time.  It seems like I see more of the three loading dots than actual programming.  Also, the downloads don’t work.  I read somewhere that you need to have Wi-Fi in order to view your downloads.  That seems pretty stupid.  If I have Wi-Fi then why would I download it?

title: Disappointed
review: The app is very glitchy when you cast to tv from you r phone. When you cast when English subtitles are enabled the tv shows Spanish subtitles even though English is selected. The controls freeze and the only way to unfreeze them is to reboot the app. Also when you download movies or episodes from the app to watch on a flight the app doesn’t allow you to watch the download content because you are “outside the region” where you can use the app. Ruined a very long flight for me.

title: HBOs “creative direction”
review: I love HBO Max specifically for its animated content and originals. But the recent removal of many unrated animated shows has got me questioning if I will keep my membership. Discovery made a poor choice removing 70% of HBO’s creative team; if they continue to remove original content for profit purposes, they will loose many devoted customers. I preferred this streaming platform for its diverse selection but pirating is always an option…

title: Great at what they do have but horrible company
review: First off what they do have on the service is great but the company took a lot of big important titles off of the service so they could claim them as business loses and not pay royalties. If those titles are not put back on at least some of them in waves this service has no hope they got ride of some of the best movies and shows that really set them apart from other streaming platforms

Thank you. HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-06-30T00:50:11Z'}
title: Issue with the mini player
review: You have to be playing the show to engage the MiniPlayer, but then it stops playing the show. Annoying flaw that should be easy to fix. Also this is just fine as far as amount of content. It’s a premium subscription service so why you don’t get access to all of the stuff on paramount plus is confusing. Oh well.

title: Buggy app
review: The app itself is not the best experience. On the iPhone it lags and runs slow. On the Apple TV it’s an even bigger mess. If you click a particular episode from the Up Next section, it loads the app and doesn’t start the episode. If, then you exit the app and open the episode again, this time it works. Also, I’ve got a few Apple TV’s, some older than others, and the app works on some, but opens and crashes on others. Overall, annoying and not a good experience.

title: Great content, not so great app for iPhone
review: I downloaded the app to my phone so I could download episodes and watch them later. App worked great at first on my phone, and the movies and shows available on the app are wonderful. I have zero issues watching anything on the app on my tv, however on my phone it acts as if it will open an episode then crashes. Hoping this improves soon 🤞🏻🤞🏻

title: Usless in offline mode
review: I travel a lot for work and therefore stream a lot on planes. Hbo max has been the worst streaming app on planes so far. The app glitches in the middle of watching a show and then either goes in some kind of "slow mode" where every command including starting the app takes 5-7 minutes of it says that i have no downloads to watch offline which is obviously false. The only way to fix this is to go back online which means the app is usless for the rest of the flight.

title: Crashes when downloading movies and no IMDB rating
review:
I was trying to download multiple episodes of a TV show to watch offline and the app crashes every time I download more than one episode at a time. So it took me 10 times longer to do my thing because the app is buggy.

Another complaint is that the app doesn’t have any user ratings for movies, IMDB or any other. No way to have any reference before actually watching.

title: Episode downloads crash, movies don’t ?
review: Overall the app works ok for me for playback, browsing content and downloading a movie to watch later. The big problem is downloading ANY episode of ANY tv show/series. Instant crash. iPad Pro with latest iOS, app is up to date. This has been happening on previous app AND iOS versions also. No app update has resolved this. AppleTV app has worked just fine for me, it’s the iPad app that crashes like a test dummy.

title: App does not work. Support does not respond
review:
I have an apple iPad mini. When trying to play a show or movie, it skips to the last second and marks the show or movie as played. I got in touch with support. They told me to restart the app and my device five times. I did. Then they stopped responding.

 I’ve tried emailing twice to get a response but they’re now ignoring me.  It’s been 11 days. I’m paying for a service and not getting that service. It’s time to cancel and tell anyone I know to avoid subscribing to hbo max.

title: Downloads now fail; previously would not play downloads in airplane mode
review: Seems all you can do is live stream with this app. For the past year, I could not get any of my downloads to play in airplane mode… it would just error out. I’m on an airplane, kinda defeats the point of downloading. With the latest update, I cannot even download… The downloads start and maybe 1/8th in, I get an error that there was a problem during the download. Some testing should happen before you push to the AppStore.

title: Could be a LOT better
review:
This is one of my least favorite streaming apps. I feel like the issues can be fixed fairly easily. 

Here are a few things I can think of that are bothersome 

-When streaming from app to a TV, every time I open the app it reloads twice before I’m able to press anything

- When watching a show, it redirects to a separate page for each episode instead of simply playing the episode

- When an episode is over, instead of being able to just press the next episode, I have to go back to the shows main page 

- I’m not able to go to a shows main page via the playback screen. I have to type in and search for it

title: Good but could be better
review: Just a few bugs IMO. The apps PIP performance is lacking. If I’m watching a series the app closes between each episode. Meaning I have to return to the HBOMax app and restart the show each time. It also pauses when you switch between the app and pip (not a huge deal). It seems to forget my closed captioning preferences every time I exit or minimize the app as well.  Again good but..

title: Worst Investment HBO ever made
review: This app and it’s gross glitches will begin to negatively impact this company’s profits. It’s obvious HBO’s execs and developers have little regard for consumer experiences while using this app. If it isn’t crashing it doesn’t work at all. Consumers should boycott the app until HBO’s developers are held accountable for delivering the crappiest streaming app on the market! This company only cares about profits not the terrible experiences it’s consumers face attempting to stream on this useless app. Developers aren’t even responding to consumer feedback because they don’t care. Disgusting.

title: Great content, frustrating app
review: Love the content, top notch…but it’s hard to watch on both TV and app when it says it’s losing connection to wifi constantly or it stalls out when loading content. Im not having these issues with any other streaming app and even when I change the options to allow cellular, it doesn’t switch over. Please fix!

title: buggiest app i've ever had
review: the catalog is amazing, some of the movies i've always wanted to watch are right there for me. but the issue is the app itself. it's the buggiest app i've ever owned; from playback and miniplayer issues, to the movies freezing just about every minute, there isn't a second where i DON'T have an issue. i wanna be happy with having it, but it's so hard when i can barely watch anything without having problems.

title: Extremely buggy fix your app
review: Hbo clearly doesn’t prioritize user experience for the app. Downloading episodes is an awful experience - if internet is interrupted at any time the download will fail. even something as simple as scrolling down a list is frustrating because the list will reset and you might accidentally click something you didn’t mean to if you’re used to a snappy experience on other apps like Netflix. Hbo dedicate some more resources to fixing your application.

title: Incredibly glitchy
review: I’ll download episodes and often I’m unable to watch the episodes because it says I’m offline. Granted, I can navigate throughout the app and download episodes while supposedly offline but I can’t watch them??? After force closing the app 3-4x, I’ll re-open it, it redirects me to my profile, then the homepage and then I’m magically back online. If I didn’t have a free membership, I would’ve given up on this already.

title: Terribly buggy iPad app
userName: Sick and tired of this problem
review:
Lately this app has been so glitchy. It automatically goes to the end of an episode I haven’t watched and I have to manually rewind it to get to the beginning. It doesn’t remember where I am with next episodes either. 

I also find it ridiculous that this app has no on-screen volume control. Hopefully these issues can be fixed!

developerResponse: {'id': 29459627, 'body': 'Hi, thank you for taking the time to rate and review. Please feel free to reach out to us if you need assistance: hbom.ax/contact. Thanks, HBO Max Support', 'modified': '2022-04-28T23:53:33Z'}
title: Please stop logging me out.
review:
So I really like movies and shows available on HBO Max. I’d like to say that it is my favorite streaming service. I’d like to say that. 

After the 65th time I’ve had to log out of my account and then back in on my TV (which is a whole process involving bad websites and codes and 17 step verification) I have decided that if you do it again I will no longer use your service. 

You clearly don’t want me to use it. I sincerely want to, I want to use HBO Max…… stop pushing me away. 

Googled why this keeps happening and the first thing I see is a Reddit post about this and there is hundreds of people saying “same thing here” but still no solutions. 

Frustrating customers and even logging them out so that they can’t use your service is a crazy way to sell a product.

Fix this issue.

So I would much appreciate it if you gave all these reviews about how massively BUGGY  your app is some very deep consideration. And  try and make your app better because this app is just not it for me or for many other people.

And if I even tried to log back in it will keep on saying my password is wrong even though it’s right. It’s not bad but I’ll give it a 2 for poor service.

title: Offline issue’s
review: I'm always traveling for work and the app works great when connected to WiFi but when you're on a plane and you can't use wifi it's absolutely terrible. You download shows to your device and it takes forever to open the app and it's so buggy if you can get it work. Please fix this issue! A lot of over streaming services will know when you're offline and will instantly show you the shows that you've downloaded with no issues.

I’ve deleted the app the reinstalled and still it doesn’t work. What more can I do at this point???

title: Great content bad app
review:
A lot of good content but don’t try to download anything for later. If you try to download a serie you will need to do it one by one and the app only lets you do it one by one (if you try to do more than two the probability fro crash is 100%) most of the time the app crash with just one file 
Is awful to fight every time that I need to watch something

title: Serious bug issues
review: Yes you get to see movies and HBO series exclusives but this has got to be one of the worst operating apps when streamed on Roku. Anytime you pause a show and return to press play it either skips ahead to the very end and you have to rewind it all the way back to where you were or it just won’t play at all and remains a black screen so you have to go back to the home menu and reopen the app. And reopen the show and find where you were in it. Just frustrating

title: Greed.
review: HBO Max was my favorite streaming service because it had it all. My absolutely favorite animated shows were HBO Max originals. Summer Camp Island, Infinity Train, Close Enough….. I also respect the artists that created these shows. They created something so fantastic. And HBO Max just made sure that years of their work would never be on a streaming service again (very important in this day and age) so they could write them off for TAX PURPOSES?? Disgusting, cruel, and greedy. I’m done singing your praises, that’s for sure. And I was a super fan.

title: Mediocre at best
review:
*update* 
I followed the link provided by the developer which instructed me to do all of the things I’ve already done that did not work. Again, this is a very poorly functioning app, expect to have to uninstall/reinstall on every device every time you’d like to watch. It will still shut down on you during your show. 

Very frustrating app. Stops on its own frequently, lots of error codes, has to be completely closed and restarted EVERY time you want to watch. Usually has to be completely uninstalled and reinstalled to work. Continue watching is almost always in the wrong place. 

I use the app on multiple devices so it’s not the device or internet connection, it’s the app that is so buggy.

Also very hard to find continuous episodes to watch.

review:

I have to delete the download and then fight with the app to download the show again.

I even cut my WiFi off to see if it was my server but it was most definitely the app.  With 5G coverage the app still stopped my show mid stream and said there was no connection.

title: iPad issues
review: When watching on my IPad (which is up to date) and my HBO Max app is up to date, I’m still having trouble watching shows. I have to download each episode, movie, etc, in order to watch it from the beginning. Please fix this issue!! When the app first came out, I had no issues, but in the last 6 months it’s been horrible.

title: Content is great, app itself is garbage.
review: Trying to do anything on this app is like pulling teeth. It takes forever to boot up and in the time it take to download a single movie I could have downloaded an entire series on Netflix or Prime Video. Downloading also occasionally causes a crash which is always fun. It’s a shame because it has some of the best content in the streaming world.

title: Signing in to your WiFi?
review: First of all I love using hbo Max. I have it on my tvs and that’s it. Well I wanted to use it on my phone and it having put in my WiFi provider and there information? That have nothing to do with the streaming service itself and is ridiculous. I don’t know my WiFi account number. It’s all under my bf name. This should NOT be part of the process to set it up in your phone. This honestly made me dislike hbo. The only reason I’m using it at this point is for my kids

title: Buggy and freezes
review: The app continuously denies the user the ability to watch more than one episode or movie offline.  It goes to the splash page and just runs a flashing cursor.  As soon as I get in range of WiFi, it works again.  I freezes in the middle of episodes also.  The app is a steaming pile of garbage and I’d expect better from a name like HBO.  Considering canceling my subscription because I wanted to watch movies offline on airplanes.

title: Worst app ever
review: We live in an age of hyperbole. But when I say this is the worst app ever, I genuinely mean it. And—appallingly—they actually charge money for this service. It works about half the time or less. When you open it, it usually hangs and won’t open. Then, when you try to download a movie, that only works about half the time too. I have other premium movie channel apps—every single one of them works better than this garbage. Pathetic. And brazen to charge people money for it.

title: Good content, poor app
review:
The good: 
The content, selection and user interface are all good. 4-5 stars. 

Scrolling through items works well, search works well. The last watched and sync across devices works well.

The bad:
There is something wrong with (I would suspect) the network/internet handling on this app. The app not only is glitchy on loading video, and sometimes must be restarted, but also messes up the internet connection for other apps. When I have the app up (in the background) other apps will have connectivity issues. Other iPhones and devices on the network are fine, and I’m confident that it started once I added this app to my phone.

title: Disappointed
review: HBO makes such quality content but they need to hire someone new for their app design. First, after I download parts of a series, it doesn’t put it in order. Totally random display order but that’s okay because as soon as I try and play something it crashes. I have yet to watch a downloaded show. Second, the lay out misses opportunity to make navigation easy. You have the whole column on the left. Use it for quick access to things like downloads.

I would not recommend this app. I’m so disappointed with how it functions.

title: Frustrating App
review:
We like the content on HBO… well most of the content. You kind of struck out with that “Just Like That” series.  But the app is so buggy that it wont even let me open it on my apple tv. Had to delete it and redownload it and now I can’t restore my purchase. 

Makes me want to cancel. And you won’t like me when I cancel.  

Love the DC hub but what’s up with not renewing the second Justice League Snyder cut movie?  You guys thought, “this first Snyder cut was way too successful. We cant risk too much success. Everyone would want to watch us and there is no way this app would support that….

But seriously, fix the app or I’m canceling. Not paying for something that won’t let me access it.

Tons wrong with this and too long a story to go into but please fix. This issue started with your previous update in August and now occurring again with the update you just pushed. Pretty stupid to keep pushing updates that’s ruining your rating on stores. Love the content HBO puts out but if this crap keeps up I’m unsubscribing. Fully!

title: So glitchy it will drive you nuts
review:
Content gets an A+

Delivery of content gets a C-.  The app is slow and glitchy.  It often takes forever to load (connected to file Wi-Fi).  Often it just conks out an says “no connection” at the top even their there is clearly a mobile connection.  

MOST FRUSTRATING OF ALL is that you can download shows to watch while in transit, for example on a plane, BUT when you go to watch while in airplane mode the app will not open.  What good is a download if you cannot watch it while traveling?  The same feature work on platforms like Netflix—it’s amazing that a company as big as HBO with so much to invest (and to lose) would put out a half baked product. 

Your content deserves better .

developerResponse: {'id': 31494648, 'body': "Hi there, we'd be happy to get you back to watching South Park without any interruptions! If you'd like additional assistance, please contact us on Twitter @HBOMaxHelp. - HBO Max Support", 'modified': '2022-08-16T16:53:03Z'}
title: How is this app so bad in 2022
review: HBO has great stuff and is worth the sub but this app won’t let you watch what you paid for.  Interrupts you to ask whether you want to use cellular or WiFi even if you’ve only ever used it with WiFi.  Unable to cast without extremely lagging performance or just straight up kicking you out of app.  Took an hour to watch a 20-minute South Park episode.  Freezes when going through library.  Super buggy and poorly-made app.  Just use your computer or tv.

title: New update problems
review: I was a big fan of the app until the lat update. Since then, I’ve noticed I can’t play downloaded shows while offline (which defeats the purpose of the download). Also, I’m no long able to keep watching my show in the mini viewer when I exit the app, which I liked to do to multitask by sending a quick text while keeping the show running. Overall seems like negative changes were made with the latest update.

title: Super Glitchy
review: This is by far the worst streaming App I have used. It isn’t user friendly at all. Then it is extremely glitchy when trying to watch shows on it. Forget downloading anything to watch it offline while traveling. I personally travel a lot for work and the download function is incredibly frustrating. Other top streaming Apps download and offline watching work seamless. The developers need to do some serious work to fix this.

title: Offline Watching Impossible
review:
I travel quite a bit and this app used to be great. The content is the best I’ve seen, and I love all of the classic films through the TCM hub. 

But over the past month, it has been TERRIBLE. It struggles to download content, as it can’t seem to handle queueing more than one download. Once I try to watch the download, typically on a plane with absolutely no access to the internet, it often won’t open, stops responding mid film, or completely crashes. EXTREMELY annoying

title: Didn’t even know I had this
review: I love it because there are things that I can watch like Mare of Eastowne which is close to where I’ve lived my entire life amc I’m 56. Hate the price however but ever since AT&T took over Dtv I’ve had nothing but problems. But still great programs 4. me

title: Great Content That I Can’t See
review: HBO has some of the best shows around along with some of the biggest movies, but I’ll be damned if I can’t see half of it. Anytime a scene is dark, I can’t see anything no matter how bright I make my screen. I don’t have this issue with any other app, so I assume it is not my phone. Whatever the reason, I watch HBO on my TV, unless that app is crashing or won’t load. Trying to watch anything on my phone is pointless.

But the shows and movies are the best. It really is unbelievable that HBO has such a low functioning app.

title: Airplay crippled almost to the point of unusable
review:
I loved Netflix, too, but when they raised their price AND disabled Airplay, I dropped them.
For some reason, HBO Max is also nearly impossible to stream to Apple TV without restarting every device in the house several times, and then will stop working mid-show anyway. Grrrrr.

I’m using an iPad Pro that supports airplay with Apple TV completely, until I choose an HBO show. Love the content, but it’s infuriating to use.

title: Won’t play movies
review: All of a sudden the app has stopped playing movies on my iPad Mini 4, yes completely updated both software and apps. When you start them it just stalls at the very beginning with the three dots just continuously going over and over again. But when I go into a series it will play those. HBO get your app straight we pay a lot of money do use it and we aren’t being able to play any movies.🤬

title: Not a good app for projectors
review:
The sound works when it’s just on my phone but once I connect it to my chromecast it doesn’t have any sound. I know it’s not my end either as I can stream other apps with sound to my chromecast just fine. Idk what’s wrong with this app. Disappointing. At least I didn’t spend my money on it.

Update: The sound works on my tv with chromecast just fine but doesn’t work on my projector with my chromecast. Can’t hear anything and don’t know how to fix it either. Bummer

title: Pls don’t take hacksaw off
review: Because I watch it the first time a month ago and I literally search every where couldn’t find it if you take it off it will be lost to time you can’t watch it no where else and no one can so pls don’t

title: Service value is great. The app is very bad.
review:
Catalogue is fine. The app has sooo many issues. I was unable to play downloaded movies without internet. What’s the point then? I am in Norway, so I understand why default audio is Norwegian if available. But why does it say that english is selected? And airplay/chromecast support is so bad. Managers cant design apps! Let proper engineers and UX experts do their job.

And before you send me troubleshooting links and all - Disney+ and netflix have been working since day 1 in Norway. And HBONordic was working.

title: HBO
review: I like the app and pretty much everything about it. I just wish they would show movies like they originally started when I signed up the ones that are at the theater. I miss that and I hate the guy that took him over for getting rid of it.

review: I just downloaded it to watch euphoria and other amazing shows! Unfortunately I’m running into a problem where it keeps telling me playback isn’t available without WiFi and keeps shutting me out. I have to constantly switch the WiFi and streaming cellular controls and it still won’t help. PLEASE FIX!!! Otherwise it’s a great app!!

I let my subscription lapse to see if that would let me switch and now i cannot subscribe at all. I love the shows and movies the app has access to but i hate how often there are adds. Maybe someday in the future I will resub if they fix this problem.

title: App itself needs a ton of work
review: I’ve had the app less than 24 hours and it has completely crashed 3+ times (which really doesn’t happen on virtually any other app) doing different things on the app each time (aka separate occurrences, not just doing the same thing over and over again). Very buggy and slow at times. Not a 1 star because the content selection is good.

title: Terrible, and a bunch of fake 5 star ratings
review:
Great shows, ridiculously bad streaming from this app. None of my other streaming service apps are this slow and buggy. I’ve barely gotten through 15 minutes of a movie and already it’s paused over and over again, struggling to connect and buffer, interrupting my watch experience. 

Also, HBO, nobody is fooled by the shockingly blatant fake 5 star ratings of this app. Those usernames are all highly suspicious and lazy attempts to inflate the poor rating of this app.

title: Stability issues
review: What’s with all the stability issues?  The app freezes up and then won’t restart unless there is an internet connection. Been trying to watch a couple of movies I downloaded and I cannot get through an entire movie on the plane. As soon as I pause or change something blimey the brightness, the app crashes and won’t restart until I’m connected to the internet

title: How can I say it?
review:
Buggy, it needs internet connection or it’ll punish you by logging you out.

If you download something you get 30 days to watch it, if you try to renew your show it won’t do anything after you tap on renew. You must close the app each time in order for it to show “renewed”, from this point you’ll have to stream whatever you downloaded anyways because it won’t let you watch it without an internet connection, which beats the whole purpose of DOWNLOADING it!!

Don’t try to go around their rules and delete  all your shows and downloading them again the app will force you to stream it anyway.

Last but not least there has been people reporting bugs for over 2 years and they just don’t seem to care, look at the app ratings.

title: Downloading is practically impossible
review:
I thought the reason that downloading with this app sucked so much was maybe because my iPad was older and didn’t have a ton of gigs. But after getting a brand new iPad with the highest amount of gigs, I realize, this app is total crap. 
   Every time I fly, I like to have a good show or movie to watch. But the HBOMAX app crashes or takes an insanely long time when dealing with downloads. 

   Please fix this!!

review: The app constantly has new bugs especially when watching offline. First when watching offline the app has a connection error. When I decided to delete the app and reinstall my downloads were gone so I decided to download them back only for it to say my downloads are already full. Even though my downloads are empty the app refuses to let me download anything else. PLEASE FIX THIS BUG!!!

title: How is this app still so bad?
review: The only saving grace for this app is the content itself, but actually streaming shows and movies is like pulling teeth. The app is not user friendly, the audio doesn’t match up with your actual selection (English, English with audio description, etc.) so it’s a complete guessing game, and the app is constantly crashing. It’s a struggle to even rewind something without the app completely shutting down.

developerResponse: {'id': 27814952, 'body': 'Good news! You can now use the Pinch-to-Zoom gesture to make shows and movies fill the screen on your iOS device. Download the latest HBO Max update and let us know if you have any questions.', 'modified': '2022-02-02T22:53:46Z'}
title: We Want Full Screen
review:
Honestly this is the only reason I can’t give it a 5 Star Rating.  We use to have this option.  It’s been over a year now since it was an option.  Please bring it back.  

What’s the point In having larger screened cell phones in todays age if we can’t utilize the whole screen?

title: 4 stars
review: i dig the selection, other then that HBO needs to be supporting the shows, all of them that they are currently sharing or have recently taken off the ‘menu’. the online app still needs a little work, getting better but not yet netflix level of easy.

review: It’s a good app but when I first had it it was billed through Apple but then one day took me off and started billing me through the website. And I wouldn’t mind but I like to have receipts and when you get billed through the site there’s no receipts or order number. But now the problem is I can’t put the billing back on Apple so it’s apart of my Apple subscriptions

review: Absolute garbage app. Demands you sign in when you launch even if you’re already signed in. Your list of things to watch randomly disappears and reappears. Profiles for other household members randomly disappear and reappear. Developer needs to throw it out and start over. Or maybe just consider new career because they’re not good at this one. I will probably not renew my subscription despite liking a lot of their programming because the app is such a giant middle finger to users.

Don’t waste your time trying to download this app unless you like watching a black screen!

title: Great selection, extremely buggy and unreliable app
review: Love the selection of movies and series on HBO Max. However, the iOS app is extremely buggy. I always have a very hard time downloaded for offline watching - can only have one episode downloading at a time or results in an error. Movies 9 out of 10 times never download offline - I just get error after error. Really wish they would fix this issue as it’s been going on for over a year now.

title: Constant issues
review: For a company that has tons of $ to pay for content HBO/Warner has one of the worst mobile experiences. The app crashes often. Downloaded content often does not play. The app doesn’t recognize when viewing is through wi-fi. The biggest issue is when you’re expecting to view your downloaded content - and either it plays sometimes, doesn’t play at all or stops playing after your start watching.

title: Terrible app
review: Good content, but the app is still trash and super buggy. I would also really love to disable the thing where HBO shoves its latest content in your face with an annoying pop up and tries to force you to watch it RIGHT NOW instead of whatever you came to the app to watch. Devs need to stop yelling people in the comments to fill out some stupid form and fix their terrible app. HBO Devs should be embarrassed by this terrible app.

title: Doesn’t use native player
review:
Wish they’d stuck to the native player on Apple TV. The cross-platform(?) implementation is frustrating, hard to use, and breaks platform conventions.

——

Update: I’m glad to see they’ve listened to their user base and have rebuilt the app with more native UX and features. Thanks, HBO!

title: Piece of junk
review: Signing into this app took us 30 minutes and almost led my husband and I to divorce. This was the 3rd or 4th time we tried to sign in and the only reason we stuck with it this time is because we were dying to watch a few particular shows. Going from ranging angry to watching Peacemaker confused my psyche. It’s fixed now but this experience has been so terrible that I give the app 1 star. I really expect more from HBO (especially for $100/year WITH ads).

title: Wont work anymore
review:
Hello, I have tried uninstalling this app, and everythng. It wont get me past the loadng screen at all. I have waited 30+ mins to get past the loading screen and still nothing happenss. It happened after i tried signing in with my service provider and thats when everything failed.

Overal i have not had any problems with the app up until now. It does have great movies, but now i cannot even get past the loading screen (with the 3 dots).

title: Great programming. No problems with app.
review: I love the HBO Max app. The programming is great. I've had no technical problems and I can watch on my iPad at caste to my smart Sony TV. I am surprised others here have experienced glitches.  My use comes free with my DirectV subscription to HBO. Really good original programming, including Hacks, with Jean Smart.

title: Great Content Terrible App
review: The viewing content is great! Good movies, good shows, great documentaries. However, the app itself is so full of bugs that at times it’s almost useless. Glitchy, your settings don’t save between Wi-Fi and cellular. Plus the app crashes completely when trying to download content. Very frustrating! If the app was of the same quality as the content I would be giving a five star review.

title: Scam
review: App will make it hard for you to sign out and in of different account. Payed for my account on computer just to be having trouble signing in on the app… it keeps trying to link to my old account, being misleading. Someone else might mistakenly buy new subscription because they make it very hard to find where to sign out and in if you dont use a tv provider. App is glitchy as well. Shame on you hbo, all that money and you can’t make a good app?

title: Offline downloads won’t work half time
review: I love Everything about this app. The only problem I have is when I’m offline and try to watch the downloaded shows/movies it just won’t let you watch it. It doesn’t even let you go to the downloads at all.

title: App keeps crashing
review: I love the shows and would watch more but a lot of times the app just doesn’t work. I can’t get it to consistently download episodes without crashing out or getting an error message. Then when I finally do get an episode downloaded, the app crashes out every time I click on the episode (Flight Attendant Season 2 episodes) and won’t play it. Very frustrating.

title: The latest update is perfect
review: I’ve been using HBOMax for several years, and I’ve faced bugs that annoyed me thousands of times, but this latest version is seamless and I do really like it. Everyone should update to the latest version.

title: HBO App hasn’t worked for years. They see you as suckers.
review: The app is terrible. Slow to start and has bugs. I specifically want to watch Gomorrah and it says it’s in Italian but forces the terrible dubbed version. Sometimes it plays right. On top of that HBO charges more than Netflix and Prime yet has less content and their apps work. Even worse, some HBO employee responds to these bad reviews going years back saying they are working on improving the app. Bottom Line: App stinks, HBO is a ripoff. Save your money.

title: poor app
review: I can’t download anything without the app crashing or without the episodes or movies not downloading at all I’ve tried deleting the app multiple times and reinstalling. My Wi-Fi is good so it’s the app that’s a problem. I really like the movies and shows on this but it’s n worth the money if I can’t even watch downloaded stuff. I’m going camping and I was looking forward to downloading Craig of the Creek episodes but this app is not making it easy and it’s frustrating.

title: Offline viewing
review: The one major issue I have with the app is that it consistently crashes during offline viewing. I work offshore on a vessel where the shows I download to watch are my main source of entertainment for 5+ days in between cell service areas. App refuses to load, when it does shows none of my downloads, and crashes during episodes. Otherwise if it worked consistently it would be my #1 streaming service.

title: Cutting shows off.
review: Love HBOMax. One problem is the cutting off shows to early. Especially on Friends, very rarely do I see the ending of the episode. You start the count down to the next episode way too early at the end and it cuts the ending off, wait until the whole episode is done. Fix it!

title: More of a question than a review
review: Why is it that my downloads are still streamed? I noticed this when I attempted to watch a movie I downloaded on a car ride, but the app informed me that I cannot stream on cellular data. I didn’t think this would be an issue since I had the movie downloaded, but apparently not. Will this issue be resolved anytime soon?

title: Horrible app
review:
Stop. Requiring. Updating. Every. Five. Minutes. 
This is my kids iPad with parental controls and every time you require a stupid update that does absolutely nothing it stops working and I have to go through a whole series of steps to undo the parental controls, authorize the update, and then re-put on the parental controls again.
Don’t require your horrible update that does nothing. If I can play a movie just let me keep the freaking old version.

title: Buggy on iOS and AppleTV
review: HBO is the king of the golden age of television. I’d assume that the same with the tech. I experience more crashes with this app than any other streaming app.  I often download content to view while on business flights and once again I can’t watch something I downloaded last night.  On AppleTV the video will freeze while audio continues, the only way I have found to temporarily fix that issue is to Pierre down the AppleTV then Power on again.

title: Too buggy
review: I’ve been logged out of my HBO account about four different times now, not because I forgot the password or anything it just keeps logging me out. And then sometimes when it logs me out I do forget the password and after too many wrong attempts it locks you out of your account. Love the movies love the content but this is seriously so annoying and making me want to get rid of it

review: The app doesn't work when you download the content. The only advantage that you might use this app on a Mac M1 is to be able download the contents otherwise viewing content in Safari works the same as the app. Why would anyone use the App if they can do the same things in a browser. It has been more than 6 months that the app crashes when you want to play something offline and they haven't fixed it. It's terrible HBO.

At times, I’ve even had to click on “Spanish audio” just to get it to actually be in English because the settings are so off.

title: Buggy mess
review: Me and my wife are on our 4th attempt watching the new Matrix via this terrible app. When I can get it to run it will be in Spanish no matter what option I choose. I just keep toggling it until it starts to  work in English. Then, I I am unlucky, the narration will play even if I don’t want it to. Tonight, can’t get it to play at all via my Apple TV. Says it is connected then says it can’t connect.  Lots of great content packages in a poorly developed app that does not seem to improve.

title: Terrible App
review: HBOMAX content is vast and top tier quality. Just don’t understand how the app on phone or tablet is so terrible. I can’t even use the app at all on my phone, yet on my Apple TV, it works fine most of the time. I’ve deleted and redownloaded the app on my phone only to attempt to sign in, and be brought to same menu to sign in or sign up to menu to no avail. Sighs.

title: Untrustworthy for flights
review: When you download content to watch it online on a plane the app crashes after the first content played and does not let you in the app ever again during the entire flight. It only starts working again when you connect to the internet again which is something that can’t really happen on most planes. This is a very bad error because you can’t trust the app to watch your content online

title: Unable to watch downloaded content
review: HBO’s content is fantastic. But every time I travel on a flight, I download shows. 50% of the time when I download, there are glitches so I end up with episodes 2, 4, and 5 but not 1 and 3. Then, once I enter airplane mode, it doesn’t allow me to play downloaded content because there is no connection. Duh… that’s the point of downloading it. For such a quality content producer and major corporation, this is incredibly disappointing

title: Pretty Good App… Unless You Want to Watch Downloads
review:
Downloaded a few movies to watch on a plane… started the app… Waited for five minutes before the Home Screen appeared. 

Long story short it was another few minutes before I was able to watch the movie… I also found out on the ride home the movies also expire after 48 hours.

title: Awful offline
review: This is unequivocally the worst app I’ve ever used for trying to watch your downloads offline.  It crashes almost every time I try to watch something I’ve downloaded.  It’s like it requires internet access to process watching your downloads which is just useless for travel.  Awful and frustrating. Online is fine.  Offline is terrible

title: Ridiculously buggy
review: Great selection of shows and movies but unbearably buggy. Honestly this app has been out for how long? There’s no reason for it to function this way. Downloading episodes will cause it to crash, switching between categories will cause it to crash, sometimes you’ll download an episode and once you go back to it it won’t play. It’s super annoying and really not worth the price for all the trouble. They need to fix this asap

title: Frustrating App
review:
Video quality is below average for streaming services. Mostly HD only, little 4K content, and lots of compression and artifacts in videos.

The app is the most frustrating thing. It pauses every time you pull down notifications or use control center to adjust brightness or sound. And then it stays paused until you resume it manually again. Let the video play in the background.

title: Save Data option, please!
review: Okay, app experience has gotten a little bit better and more bearable for the great content (which is what keeps me around)—but please please give us a ‘save data’ option, like most other apps, and not just the option to stream over wifi only. You eat through my cellular data like a tapeworm.

title: Crashes on Apple TV- a lot
review:
It could be us but we’ve never had this issue before with any other streaming platform.

While searching for movies to watch this crashed 3 times in 5 min. It’s actually a family joke that this will crash daily. We take bets on how often.

Hoping to catch up on what we want to watch on here and will probably get rid of it in the next month or so.

title: Great content, horrible user experience
review: I have several streaming apps and this is definitely the worst one in terms of user experience. Really slow, freezes quite often and sometimes when I choose an episode there is no play option. I have to restart the app in order to be able to play the episode I want. It’s a shame that its good content can’t be appreciated as intended.

title: Rarely works on phone.
review:
I have a perfectly good new iPhone. This Ap constantly wants me to sign in, and sends me into a sign in loop. Asks me who my provider is when I pay HBO directly and am already signed in. I’ll waste no more than 15 minutes of my time trying to figure out your bad UI. 

HBO works on my laptop, but never on my phone. Will likely cancel subscription. 

This has to be a known issue. Probably trying to stop people from sharing, but I don’t need the hassle. BE MORE LIKE NETFLIX

title: Does HBO ever read the bad reviews?
review: Your app is getting worse with every update! Most of your content won’t load or you see the first couple of seconds then it stalls, wait a minute or two and it will jump to the end of the program. I have no problems with any other streaming app. You are a multi-billion dollar company with great content, but can’t hire developers to build a good streaming app that works.

title: Has potential but they don’t seem to care
review: This could be a really great streaming app if it didn’t constantly have problems downloading onto my iPhone. Even after deleting and reloading the app, still can’t seem to download anything. One of the rare times it did complete the download, the movie wouldn’t play. I’ve seen many complaints about this for a long time and still no solution.

title: Pretty good selection of shows
review: I’m not sure why the average is 2.8, as I’ve not come across any issues using it. If you love cartoons, there’s a pretty good selection of good animated shows on here, like Rick and Morty, Over the Garden Wall, and Guardians of Ga’Hoole (which has stunning animation, by the way.) I don’t use it as much as Netflix, but still pretty decent.

title: why the audio descriptions all the time???
review: I appreciate HBO being inclusive and including audio descriptions for those who need it. But - I can’t get it to turn off on my Roku TV, now it is happening on my phone. This time, it tried playing Crimes of Grindewald with Spanish audio description, even though I never selected that (nor saw it as an option!) seriously, this has been going on for months and I’m tired of it.

title: connection issues when used in iphone
review: this app keep giving an error that you are not connected with wi-fi.. and stops playing the video. My wi fi is fine .. i have 1gbps connection and all the other apps and streaming services works fine.. issue comes when i play the video in phone.. TV which is also connected in wi-fi works fine.. i have iphone xr. please fix this.

title: Worst
review: Great content, terrible app. By far the worst streaming app of all. SO buggy, it makes using it a pain. Constantly tells me I’m offline when I’m not, if I pause something and then go back to it it just doesn’t know what to do and I have to shut it down and open it back up. They’re HBO go app was also like this, I thought that by now being HBO max they would’ve improved on their apps but I guess not…really strange that it’s so bad when it’s such a big company.

title: Love HBO but downloads do not work
review: I travel and like to download movies and series to take with me on the road. Content will download fine, but when I get to my destination the downloads will not play offline.  Unfortunately, this app is not useful to me if I cannot watch downloads while I travel.

title: Crashes frequently
review: The iPad app is specifically pretty bad. It crashes constantly especially when internet connection is poor, even with downloaded content. It also makes it difficult to access downloaded content without internet connection. What’s the point of downloading content if you can’t access it. Not very good for travel or dead spots.

title: Ridiculously Awful App
review: Not sure what has changed with this app but it was fairly good when it first came out, but is now so extremely slow.  You are lucky if you can even get the show to load, but even if you do it will kick you right off.  We are an Apple family and have tried this on our iPads, Apple TV and phones.  Do not bother paying for this if you have an Apple product.  Worthless.  Pretty bad Stars and Showtime can out beat this.

title: Great shows. Not great app
review: So I downloaded the app because I don’t have internet at home and the only time I even have time to watch anything is during my lunch break so I’ve now paid for another month and the app hasn’t opened not once. I got thru maybe 3 episodes and now I can’t even access the account. It’s very irritating, and I can only assume I’ll have to connect to WiFi to even try and open the app. Will be cancelling and deleting after this month.

title: Been reasonable so far
review: Just for streaming on my phone, seems to be pretty functional so far.  I haven’t tried AirPlay or handoff to laptop or other devices (all things that I’ve seen other reviews for this app raise issue with), so can’t speak to that.   But for streaming on iOS, seems fine.

title: Contents is great, app is glitchy
review:
Pros: always high quality shows and movies to watch, and the experience inside of the app is smooth( when it works)

Cons: annoyingly consistent app crashes, constantly having to restart, re-download, log out and back in for it to continue working. 

Netflix has the same thing sometime, but maybe 1/150 times of opening the app, HBOmax is at least 1/10 times

review: I get HBO with my cable service.  This app works with my Apple TV and on my iPad.  However, even after a complete factory reset of my iPhone (updated and one of the latest models), I can not get this app to login with my service provider.  I have tried everything suggested on the HBO help, and more, and this crappy app will not work on my iPhone.  I’ve tried everything possible for the last year and it still does not work.

review: The app has a option to download content but it gets super buggy and won’t let you watch downloaded content when not connected to internet. I have always paid for HBO through my tv provider and now all of a sudden the app no longer allows me to sign in through a tv provider. Once you select the option to login through a tv provider all you get is a loading screen.

title: App keeps crashing
review: I downloaded a movie to my iPad Pro to watch since I would be spending the week in an area with no Internet and limited cell service. Every time I try to play the movie, the app crashes. This isn’t the first time I’ve had issues with downloads on my iPad. I don’t usually have any issues with HBOMax on my Samsung TV or Roku, but I’ve had nothing but problems with the app on my iPad Pro.

title: Worst streaming platform on the App Store
review: It works okay on a smart phone. But you dare think you’d be able to watch it on a Roku device. It took 5 mins for it to pass the profile screen… THE PROFILE SCREEN! And then from there it seems like it’s going okay until you find a show you want to watch. IT WILL STAY ON THE LOADING SCREEN UNTIL YOU DIE! You have to do some much just to watch something, but the end of it you don’t even want to anymore. Terrible stream service.

title: Overly greedy
review:
I tried to download some TV shows to watch while abroad and on plane. First of all, they seem to greatly throttle the download speed. Second of all, there is also a cap on the number of downloads. Finally, it seems like they will remove the download in just a few days - not even after a week. 

Unsubscribing because I can just buy full movies/TV shows in other episodes that let me download their shows/movies indefinitely.

title: Mobile app issues
review: It won’t let me long in or it takes a while to load and nothing happens, and it’s very irritating because I can log in on my computer perfectly fine but when it come to the mobile app it just won’t  let me long in or when I press sign it with tv provider the 3 dots pop up on the screen as if it’s load but nun happens and it just stays like that for 30 plus mins until I turn it off

title: Love this app
review: if I could read this app it would be 100% because it’s really good and I wish it keeps around if Mr. ZZ who’s thinking about to get rid of this app I would say he could add a link to discovery in this app so basically it would be HBO max discovery there you go

title: Buggy app, videos won’t play
review: I consistently get a notification telling me that I am not online, and therefore can’t play any videos, despite the fact that I am connected to WiFi. This happens on many different WiFi networks, and no other streaming apps have a problem. Also the only streaming app I have that won’t stream using cellular data. Ridiculous. Don’t subscribe to HBO if you’re planning to watch or download on a mobile device.

title: Unusable on the go
review:
The app is essentially unusable on the go. You pre-download a movie, but it still requires a connection to verify and start the movie. If you happen to catch a signal, and verify you are authorized for the content, it attempts to stream the movie rather than use the downloaded copy despite launching the process from the “my downloads” section.

For a commuter like myself, this makes the app, and ultimately the service, basically worthless vs its competitors.

title: buggy
review:
HBO Max on Apple TV is buggy. Trying to play out of the main TV app consistently causes the show to not play, lose its place, need to quit and re-open HBO, or hit play directly in HBO app. Doesn’t mesh very well with Apple TV app.

And do users really need to constantly tell the app who is viewing when their account only has one single user? If a user wants to switch to a different user, they will. Until then, leave it be, and stop asking every time a user enters the HBO app.

title: Show interruption
review: Content selection is good. My main issue with the app is that every 2 minute the app interrupts what I’m watching to ask if “I want to stream this title over cellular connection”. Asking once or twice is fine, but repeatedly back to back while I’m trying to enjoy a show is too much. Especially when I’m using WiFi sometimes to watch. Please fix this, it is very inconvenient.

title: Won’t Run - issue resolved
review: This app only plays movies intermittently. Netflix and Prime video and Curiosity Stream run fine on my iPad using the same wifi internet connection.  At the urging of HBO MAX customer service I deleted the App then re-installed it.  That did the trick and I was able to watch 15 minutes of a movie on my iPad using the App. We shall see if this fix holds up.

title: What happened on 4/8/22!?!?
review: AppleTV: I was using the app just fine. I’d just watched a preview and was about to play the series then boom: the app kicks me out. I search the app on the AppleTV and see that it needs an update (nice, I’ve had it on auto update for years with no problems, but whatever). I force the update thinking that would help. NOPE!! Still kicking me out of the app after the splash screen appears for a few seconds. I just love subscribing to something that I can’t use!!

title: Bait and Switch
review: Bait and Switch  - HBO reeled me in w the same day theater release feature that debuted movies onto the streaming service the day they were released in theaters, but have now shut that feature down. PS - They did this without notifying me of the change. This was the big advertising push to get new subscribers to sign up. Feature was eliminated without notification, but also kept the monthly price the same. Very disappointed. Bait and Switch is Bad Business HBO.

title: Needs to be fixed
review: The app and the website are trash . It continues to make me restart my device for it to work again after going out of it. Gives me network errors when I’m on wifi . I could be on FaceTime and Netflix at the same time and it works perfectly fine . Takes minutes to load show after clicking on it and it’s all blurry for a second . Really not worth it I wish I could give it a zero

title: close to terrible
review: For a network with such amazing shows, its app is extremely disappointing. Took me 10 minutes just to figure out how to add an entire show to my list rather than a single episode. The download feature also was not working for me, and when it finally did, i wasn’t able to watch my DOWNLOADED episodes without a internet connection. HBO, this app is a joke.

title: Why even pay for it?
review:
I have absolutely no patience left for this app. Trying to connect it to my Apple box is like pulling teeth - except that when you pull teeth, something eventually happens. Why would I bother paying for this app - and service - if I’m only able to watch it on my phone? 

Your Aircast/bluetooth pairing capabilities are an absolute joke and I’m so sick of fighting this app. Truly so frustrating from a company that is meant to be the penultimate in quality content.

title: App crashed and wouldn’t reload on plane ride
review: I downloaded a bunch of tv episodes for a plane ride, and halfway through watching one the app froze and then crashed. I tried quitting and reopening several times, and the app would just stay frozen then slowly show the episodes I downloaded, but then nothing would be clickable and the app would crash again. Horrible, horrible app with lots of great content! You’d think they’d have this figured out by now.

title: Full screen update
review: Thank you for adding full screen mode aka stretch to fill feature my rating has changed from 2 stars to a full 5 stars thank you and please keep this feature from now on

title: Has amazing shows and movies but…
review: I love the app in terms of the selections it has to offer… but the app could be more consistent. I seem to have a lot of issues with movies and shows freezing for no apparent reason (my other apps will work fine). Usually restarting the app is enough… but for the price it is per month it does get old.

title: Good shows but bad streaming delivery
review: HBO max is second best streaming platform after Netflix . I love the content the only biggest problem is the streaming delivery. Movies and shows get stuck like stop streaming all of a sudden and this has been happening a lot lately. The ad experience isn’t smooth either. The overall watching experience gets worse even if you add good shows. So 2 stars for this.

title: You will not be able to get through one episode of anything
review: This app constantly freezes. You have to close it and open it again multiple times just to get through a 40 min episode of a show and it’s frustrating. The only reason this app is even relevant is because of the shows you can’t watch any where else, but I wouldnt recommend purchasing it unless you enjoy struggling and getting annoyed.

title: Great content but….
review: This app has a wide variety of shows and movies which is great. Price per month is reasonable, but the app when used to cast to a device constantly cuts off the end of shows and or freezes and skips around. On another device it freezes and crashes. The app and platform need some work.

title: Needs refinement.
review: The content is good but the user interface is just clunky and inconvenient. Especially the downloads tab. Allow unlimited downloads and sort them by show not all episode independently floating in the downloads page. Like Netflix. Also make adding and deleting shows from downloads smoother.

title: poor functioning on macOS
review: This app minimally functions on macOS and so isn't worth nothing, but nevertheless utterly fails to conform to multiple longstanding macOS user interface standards. Video playback controls don't appear upon mouse movement; interface elements and video don't dynamically resize when the size of the window is changed.  Overall a weak and embarrassing effort by the developers. Please go back to the drawing board and implement a proper macOS applicaiton.

title: How are you still in business
review: Worst service ever. Free trial, great, I sign up! I like the content but hate the ads. So I decide to go ahead and purchase the premium package. Guess what I cant. You app and site will NOT take my money. There is no option to purchase once you start the trial. So I wait. Trial expires so I go to purchase. I get an Error something has gone wrong message. Seriously!!! How many times are you going to refuse to allow me to subscribe before I just go elsewhere!

title: Please fix the downloading
userName: idk what to do for my nickname
review: Every time before we go on a flight I try to download things from HBO max and it NEVER works. It takes like 2 hours to download 1 movie and you have to wait while just looking at the movie you picked. It’s very annoying especially because the movies are good. Please fix this as soon as possible

title: Can’t download anything.
review:
No matter what Internet I’m on the best Internet in a home in a public space over Wi-Fi anywhere on cellular it refuses to download anything! Really frustrating. Nothing but problems with this app. It’s glitchy it keeps freezing it’s constantly restarting. It’s got great shows and stuff but not if I can’t watch them.

And I’m sorry, but your response is generic and isn’t even relevant. It doesn’t have anything about why it won’t download.

title: Good content, terrible app
review: Updated 6/6/22 I find it great how the HBO app sprinkles the shows for you. It’s awesome that you can watch about 3 mins worth of a show before it totally boots you off. I mean why would you want to watch an entire episode all the way through? Plus, it’s awesome how the app just goes into stuck loading mode there by freezing up the rest of my device. And this is all after your super duper update. Great job on making a bad app even worse!

title: Wish it worked consistently
review: This app is a joke! Constantly freezing up and it’s not my TV (smart tv) nor is it the internet.  It starts to freeze about maybe a hour in if that then when it freezes you can’t back out of the app at all because it freezes the TV. Fix it! I’ve already sent a feedback ticket. Don’t blame the user or the TV for the app to act all glitchy.

title: Can’t watch offline downloads
review: This app is laughably bad. If you’re a subscriber hoping to download content for offline viewing while traveling, BEWARE. It works ok on Wi-Fi but as soon as you switch to airplane mode, nothing will play. The app crashes immediately while giving an error message saying you are offline. Like.. DUH that’s why I downloaded instead of just streaming. I can’t believe a company as large and well funded as HBO could release an app this terrible.

title: Awesome selection - worst app functionality ever
review: The phone app has always been buggy but I HAVE to mention that the smart tv app version of HBO max is the worst streaming service I’ve ever encountered. This app constantly crashes and freezes in the middle of watching shows - usually the first episode is fine but once you start watching more than one in a row it ALWAYS freezes and crashes.

title: About the worst UX out there
review: I’m honestly stunned at how bad the UX quality is on HBO Max. For having such an amazing catalogue of content, HBO he dropped the ball off a sheer cliff from a technical standpoint. Constant crashing, auto logging out, subtitles that are cut off, volume issues, horrifically hard to navigate play/pause/rw/ff controls. This app unfortunately has it all. Major work to do on their part to even get to a fraction of the functionality of HBO Go.

title: Crashes, crashes, crashes
review:
Always crashing and shutting down when I try to download content.  

When I’m offline, trying to view downloaded content, if the app crashes and I have to go in, the app will just remain on the purple loading screen until I can get to wifi which means I can’t view my downloaded content.

Love the content but hate the app.

title: A little confusing, but it has a nice selection
review: Can be frustrating operating the app (why can’t I look at episodes from a specific show from the recently watched page?) But the selection is right up my alley and for that I keep coming back.
